loans.use: to buy furniture from Korea in order to provide customers with quality products.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
When people unite, they are powerful,” says Salome, a 38-year-old farmer who lives in the village of Kiamutugi in the Kerugoya area of Kenya. As a girl, she watched women in her village form small groups so that they could be financially stable. The memory of this collective effort led her to join the Ngariama self-help group. 

For the past year, Salome has been actively involved in mixed farming. As she is from rural Kenya, gender roles still adhere and women do the heavy work of fetching and carrying water and wood, in addition to household chores, childcare and tending crops. Many are left to run farms alone while their husbands migrate in search of paid employment. 

This has not been a setback because Salome has been making great profits in dairy farming. Kerugoya is one of the places with conditions that favor horticulture farming: good climate, soil, transport system, and market. Salome has always wanted to diversify and start horticultural farming, but the biggest challenge she has been facing is the lack of funds. She is therefore requesting a loan to start horticultural farming. 

Through the Ngariama self-help group, whose members co-guarantee each other to secure a loan, Salome joined Juhudi Kilimo, a micro finance organization that supports young and enterprising farmers. With this loan she intends to buy good quality vegetable seeds, flowers and potatoes. Proximity to an airstrip will allow her to transport the produce faster to an international market, enabling her to make more money. 

This loan will improve Salome's living conditions and secure the future of her children.

loans.use: to start horticultural farming.

loans.name: Martha Lilian

texts.es:
Martha, elabora y vende quesadillas, su negocio tiene cinco años de existir, su producto es de calidad por lo que ha ganado popularidad y muchos clientes, ella es reconocida en la zona como una persona responsable y honesta, actualmente se encuentra soltera, tiene una hija que es enfermera y ejerce su profesión.
Comprará harina, leche, cuajada, levadura, etc., para elaborar las quesadillas que posteriormente vende, contara con la materia prima para continuar trabajando y satisfacer a sus clientes, pues ya cuenta con clientes potenciales, espera que la inversión le ayude a mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
Sus objetivos son mantener sus clientes satisfechos, seguir teniendo el espíritu de emprendedora para salir adelante y ayudar a otras personas a que puedan superarse.
texts.en:
Martha makes and sells quesadillas. Her business is five years old and her product is of high quality that has become very popular and attracted many clients. She is recognised in the local area as a responsible and honest person. She is currently single and has a daughter who works as a nurse.

She will buy flour, milk, curds, yeast, etc., to make quesadillas that she will later sell. She relies on these ingredients to carry on working and satisfying her clients. She already has potential clients lined up and hopes that the loan will help increase her income. 

Her aims include: keeping her clients satisfied, maintaining her entrepreneurial spirit in order to move forwards and helping others overcome difficulties.

loans.use: to buy flour, milk, curds, yeast, etc., to make quesadillas that she will later sell.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 43 years old.  She is a widow and has five children. She is a vendor selling vegetables in her village. 

She is now asking for an additional loan to invest in her business. She is asking for PHP 4,000 to buy squash, string beans, carrots and eggplant to sell.

This will increase her sales capacity and will give her good profits too. She also hopes to diversify her business.

loans.use: to buy squash, string beans, carrots and eggplant to sell.

loans.name: Geovany Isaias

texts.es: Geovany es un hombre de 40 años de edad que habita en vivienda propia al lado de su compañera de vida y sus 4 hijos que son la principal razón de su esfuerzo ya que les apoya para que estudien y sean personas de bien.  Él es un hombre trabajador que buscando la manera de sacar adelante a su familia y ante la falta de oportunidades de empleo se dedica a la venta de granos básicos, además aprovechando la clientela y el espacio vende frutas y verduras a la orilla de una carretera por lo que su negocio es muy rentable. Geovany desea invertir en una mayor cantidad de productos para obtener mejores ingresos, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: frijoles rojos, frijoles blancos, arroz, zapotes, mandarinas, guineos, papayas, etc., y de esta manera sostener a su familia y tratar de mejorar la calidad de vida de la misma.
texts.en:
Geovany is 40 years old and lives in his own home with his life partner and 4 children. He works hard so that he can help his children study and become good people. He is a hardworking man who is trying to find a way to get his family ahead. Due to the lack of employment opportunities, he makes a living selling rice, beans, fruit and vegetables from a roadside stall, a profitable location for his business. 

Geovany wants to invest in a greater quantity of products in order to earn a higher income. He is asking for a loan from FUSAI in order to invest in red beans, white beans, rice, sapotes, mandarins, bananas, papaya, etc. so that he can support his family and try to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in: red beans, white beans, rice, sapotes, mandarins, bananas, papaya, etc.

loans.name: Hady's Group

texts.fr:
Nouvellement inauguré le 29 décembre 2014 ce banc villageois est composé de femmes du groupement du village qui ont adhéré dans le programme afin de rendre les activités dans le petit commerce plus rentables, elles s’activent également dans l’agriculture sous pluie. Une bonne ambiance anime les rencontres du groupe. 

Madame Hady, âgée de 36 ans (debout à l’extrême gauche), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe.Elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants dont 02 garçons, elle s’active dans la transformation de pâte d’arachide. Elle achète les graines non décortiquées par sac  de 50 kg dans son village et les environs, pour la revente au marché international de la sous région après transformation.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 04 sacs de 50 kg à 10 000 Fr CFA l’un pour la transformation et la vente.

Avec les bénéfices, elle compte renforcer son épargne, améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Newly inaugurated the 29 december 2014, this village bank is composed of village women who all joined the program in order to enable their small businesses to become more profitable. They are also active in rainfed agriculture. There is a good atmosphere in the team meetings.

Mrs Hady, 36 years old and seen standing in the far left of the photo, is the star loanee of the group. She is married and the mother of 6 children, including 2 boys. She is involved in turning peanuts into peanut paste. She purchases the un-shelled peanuts in 50 kg bags in her village and the in the surrounding region, and sells the paste at the international market. She plans to use this loan to purchase 4 bags of 50 kg of peanuts at a cost of 10 000 FCFA each. She will use the profits to reinforce her savings as well as improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: purchase 50 kg bags of non-hulled/shelled grains in her village and surrounding areas, in order to resell as a finished good at the international market

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
This cheerful and nice lady is 24 years old and she lives with her husband and sweet child in the Kapan city of Syunik region. Anna has vocational education and a specialty of designer, but now being unemployed and also busy with her child’s care, she is also a skilled and resourceful grower. 

In her fruit garden she has apple, peach, plum and mulberry trees. On her plot of land she also cultivates some assortment of vegetables such as potato, beans, carrots and greens. Anna’s husband helps his lovely wife with the sale of their land’s sweet and tasty harvest. Anna says that she is happy with her family, and with her nice garden, which helps them to cover their family needs.

This loan in an amount of 300,000 Armenian drams she asks in order to fence her fruit garden and she also wants to buy some new sort of apple trees layers.

loans.use: to fence her fruit garden and buy some new apple tree layers.

loans.name: Glecy

texts.en:
Glecy, 44, is a married woman with six children, two of whom are still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Glecy raises pigs in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years. 

Glecy requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is married and lives in Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. 

Esterlita and her husband are both farmers; they raised their family doing this type of activity. This industrious farmer experienced hardship helping her husband in plowing the rice field, planting vegetables and other varieties of agricultural commodity to continue putting bread on the table in their home. 

In need of additional working capital, Esterlita decided to join Paglaum Cooperative. She has received several loans already and recently requested an amount to purchase fertilizer and herbicides to increase crop yield on her rice farm. Being a MIGS member (Member in Good Standing) of the cooperative, she has been able to manage her income. She is able to provide for the daily needs of her family. 

Esterlita is very thankful because if it were not for Paglaum, she might not have any savings at all nor be guided properly in her finances. She hopes to own a land tractor someday for fast and easy farm work.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and herbicides to increase crop yield on her rice farm.

loans.name: Maria Lidia

texts.es: María es una mujer trabajadora que tiene 63 años de edad que desde muy joven aprendió a ganarse la vida cultivando la tierra, con lo que a logrado sacar adelante a su familia, entre los productos que María cultiva se encuentran maíz, frijol, maicillo, ajonjolí, repollo, cebollas, etc. Además su compañero de vida es jornalero y le apoya con los gastos económicos al igual que tres de sus hijos. Ella habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida, sus hijos y un nieto de 8 años de edad. María desea construir una pila en su vivienda que le permita contar con un lugar adecuado para recolectar agua para el uso de su vivienda, además desea realizar la conexión de energía eléctrica en la misma y para ello solicita un  crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo, cables y mano de obra para construir una pila y conectar energía eléctrica en su vivienda lo antes posible y de esta manera evitar inconvenientes en invierno.
texts.en: Maria is a hardworking 63 year old woman. She learned farming since she was very young in order to earn her living, and with this she has been able to move her family ahead. Among the products she grows are corn, bean, sorghum, sesame, cabbage, onions, etc. Also, her domestic partner is a daily laborer and supports her with household expenses, as three of her children also do. She lives in her own house with her partner, her children and an 8 year old grandson. Maria wants to build a washstand with water storage in order to have a place to collect water to use in her house. Also, she wants to build the connection to electrical energy for her house. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to FUSAI to invest in: cement, sand, gravel, bricks, cables, and to pay for hand labor to build a washstand and to connect electrical energy in her house as soon as possible; and in this way avoid the problems in winter.

loans.use: to invest in: cement, sand, gravel, bricks, cables, and to pay for hand labor to build a washstand with water storage and to connect electric energy in her house.

loans.name: Baatar

texts.en:
Baatar, 45 years old, lives with his wife and son in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. 

He has been selling casual clothes to local people since 2006. His wife stays at home, taking care of house chores. Their son works at an information technology institution. 

He is requesting a loan of 5,000,000 MNT to rent a counter at the trade center in order to expand his business. As a result, he will hire one saleswoman, creating a job and increasing his business revenue.

loans.use: to rent a counter at the trade center.

loans.name: Denis

texts.en:
Denis is a hardworking man living in Masindi, Uganda. He is an education assistant and, due to his low salary, he decided to to start farming so as to generate more income. 

Denis hopes to expand his farm business, but inadequate capital and the prolonged dry spell hinder his business dream. He is requesting a loan to prepare the land for planting.

loans.use: to prepare the land for planting.

loans.name: Siriverio

texts.en:
Siriverio is a 39-year-old Ugandan man married to Juliet, with whom he has five children, age 17,15, 13, 9 and 5. Three of them are in school. He describes himself as a hardworking and honest person.

Siriverio has applied for a loan of UGX 2,000,000 to buy cereals in form of millet and maize to sell. This is his main business where he earns money to meet his household needs and pay tuition for his children. 

His dream is to expand his business and acquire more land, but he has challenges of seasonality in his business and price fluctuations.

loans.use: To buy millet and maize.

loans.name: Charry

texts.en:
Charry is 31 years old and is separated. Charry has always dreamed of managing her own business to support her three children. 

She is now engaged in running a quarrying business, buying and selling sand and gravel to the local community. She used her loan as working capital to pay for more loads of sand and gravel to meet the demands of her increasing customers. She is now on her way to repaying the loan with her new profits.

loans.use: to pay for more loads of sand and gravel to meet the demands of her increasing customers.

loans.name: Janefa's Group

texts.en:
Janefa is 50 years old and has five children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 10 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. 

Janefa has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of her desire to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Although she described her last harvest as good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Janefa also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Janefa's Group will be able to receive a total of three solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 5.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and build a bathroom, a septic tank, and a toilet at their home to improve access to water and sanitation for their family.

loans.name: José Kaín

texts.es:
José de 34 años de edad, estudió hasta 6° grado, está acompañado y su esposa se dedica a la venta de tortillas, tiene 3 hijos de los cuales dos ya se encuentran estudiando, y son los únicos que dependen de José

José se dedica a la agricultura y crianza de especie menores, él lo aprendió de sus padres, anteriormente tenía otro empleo pero hubo recorte de personal y fue despedido.

José solicita el crédito para poder invertirlo en su casa, ya que su vivienda necesita reparación antes de que se avecine el invierno.

Su sueño es poder ampliar su casa y sacar adelante a sus hijos con sus estudios para que puedan convertirse en unos profesionales.
texts.en:
José is 34 years old. He went to school up to the 6th grade. He is married and his wife sells tortillas. He has 3 children, two of whom are in school, and they are Jose's only dependents. 

José works in agriculture and in raising small animals. He learned this from his parents. Previously, he had another job but there were lay-offs and he was let go.

José is asking for the loan to be able to invest in his house, because it needs to be repaired before the rainy season comes. His dream is to be able to add on to his house and to get his children ahead so they can graduate from college.

loans.use: to invest in his house, which needs to be repaired before the rainy season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement and sand and pay for labour.

loans.name: Lolya

texts.en:
Lolya is a 37-year-old married lady from a village near Hebron city. She has two sons and one daughter. Her husband works as an employee in a local firm where and earns a low income. 

Lolya  raises sheep to sell milk and meat to the local traders. 

Lolya took a USD loan from FATEN to buy more sheep for her barn.  Lolya will be able to increase productivity and  the family's  income.

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more sheep for her barn.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a 46-year-old married woman with five children, two attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Elena has grown vegetables for 5 years and requests 8,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and  requested another loan to further build her businesses.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia, 46 years old, is married and has fourteen children, three of them in school. For the past 8 years, Rosalia has operated an agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rosalia has previously borrowed 7 times from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Rosalia would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Sonia Margarita

texts.es:
Sonia, de 40 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo año de bachillerato, no pudo seguir estudiando por situaciones económicas, está soltera, no tiene hijos y con ella vive su mamá, una sobrina y su abuela.

Sonia, trabaja en un laboratorio clínico desde hace dos años como secretaria, anteriormente trabajaba como empleada domestica, su trabajo está ubicado a una distancia de un kilometro de su casa, ella viaja en moto-taxi y su horario de trabajo es de 7:00 a.m a 4:00 p.m.
 
Sonia, está solicitando el crédito para comprar un televisor, ya que no tiene.

Sonia, sueña en poder tener una parcela agrícola, poder tener su casa propia y poner un negocio.
texts.en:
Sonia is 40 years old. She went to school up to the second year of high school. She was unable to continue her education due to the financial situations. She is single and has no children. Her mother, a niece and her grandmother live with her.  

Sonia has worked as a secretary at a clinical laboratory for two years. Before that, she worked as a maid. Her job is located a kilometer away from her house. She travels in a motorcycle taxi and her work schedule is from 7:00 a.m to 4:00 p.m.
 
Sonia is asking for the loan to buy a television, since she doesn't have one. Sonia dreams of being able to have a parcel of farmland so that she can have her own home and open a business.

loans.use: to buy a television.

loans.name: Carlos Enrique

texts.es:
Carlos de 37 años de edad, estudió hasta cuarto grado, está soltero y él se dedica a trabajar con un camión, solo su madre depende económicamente de él.

Carlos tiene 20 años de dedicarse a trabajar con un camión, el cual lo aprendió de su papá que se dedicaba a lo mismo. Don Carlos también se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos y algunas hortalizas.


Él solicita este crédito para construir una pequeña casa donde tiene los cultivos, con la pequeña construcción de esta casa, él podrá estar cerca de donde cultiva las hortalizas.

Su sueño es comprar un carro para trabajar y generar más ingresos para salid adelante y formar su propia familia.
texts.en:
Carlos is 37 years old. He went to school up to the fourth grade. He is single and drives a truck. His mother in the only one who depends on him financially.  

Carlos has been driving the truck for 20 years. He learned it from his father, who did the same thing. Carlos also grows basic grains and some vegetables.   

He is asking for this loan to build a small house where he has the crops. By building this house, he will be able to be close to where he grows the vegetables. 

His dream is to buy a car to work with and generate more income to get ahead and start his own family.

loans.use: to build a small house where he has crops. By building the house, he can be close to where he grows vegetables.

loans.name: Ndaro

texts.en:
Ndaro is a married woman; she has six children, all of whom attend school. Ndaro owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Ndaro operates a charcoal sales business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her major business challenges are stiff competition from other firewood operators and transportation.
 
Ndaro wants to use this KES 50,000 loan to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
Mary is 31 years old and has 5 children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 9 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. 

Mary has been farming with One Acre Fund since 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to earn enough to feed her family and, although she described her last harvest as good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Mary also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Mary's Group will be able to receive a total of 6 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 3.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Ursula's Group

texts.en:
Ursula is 38 years old and has 7 children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 9 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. 

Ursula has been farming with One Acre Fund since 2010. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods and, although she described her last harvest as poor due to the effects of MLND (maize virus), she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Ursula also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Ursula's Group will be able to receive a total of 4 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 4.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Chikhulupiliro Group

texts.en:
Ruth thanks Kiva for the previous loan that they granted her. She used the loan to expand her business, and this helped her to also increase her returns. Ruth is now able to pay school fees for her children and provide them with their basic needs, as most of her children did not have good clothes, and she was not able to provide them with food three times a day.

She would like to get another loan, since she wants to diversify her business by selling secondhand clothes. She opted for this business, since it is highly demanded in her area, and it brings more profits.

She hopes to build a better house with iron sheets for her children, and she plans to send them to private schools. The previous loans have helped her to become self-reliant.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothes.

loans.name: Najah

texts.en:
Najah is a 49-year-old married woman from the city of Jericho. She has two sons and one daughter.

Najah started her sheep raising business two years ago to sell milk and meat to the local traders. 

Najah took a USD loan from FATEN to buy sheep for her barn. Najah will be able to increase productivity and her family's income.

loans.use: to buy more sheep.

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
NY, 52, lives in a remote area of Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She is a lovely mother of two children. To make a living, she manages and operates a rice farm which is located near her home. She has farmed for twenty five years. 

She earns 2.00 USD per day. She wants to have household energy at a reduced monthly cost by purchasing a solar energy home system. Because there is inadequate money, she has requested a Kiva loan through its partner, HKL. After this initial investment, she hopes to have clean energy to power her household lights, TV, and radio. She is very happy and thankful because with this loan, HKL has provided her a special interest rate lower than its general loan rates. 

She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for a solar energy home system.

loans.name: Rey

texts.en:
Rey makes good earnings from his farm in Tambulig. He supports his family and is able to send his children to school. He wants to increase his farm yield especially that he has high cost of living when his children entered college. 

Rey approached Paglaum for a loan to purchase a knapsack sprayer for insecticides. He has high hopes that he will have good produce this growing season.

loans.use: to purchase a knapsack sprayer for insecticides.

loans.name: Willy

texts.en:
Willy is a farmer in Litein who grows maize, raises poultry, and dairy farms. He produces milk and eggs  for commercial purposes as opposed to many rural farmers who are in it for subsistence. Willy also grows maize for food and sales. These commercial activities place him in a better position to engage in other agriculture-related businesses. 

Willy seeks a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo to construct a cow shed. This will help him to significantly managing the animals’ health and hygiene. He has  farmed for at least 5 years and plans to continue as he finds farming to be not only fulfilling but also lucrative. However, his biggest challenges are the poor road network and lack of market. 

The loan will help Willy to construct a cow shed, which will later come in handy when he scales up and introduces zero-grazing. The long-term impact is an increase in productivity and improved animal health. The additional income from this development will go to his children’s education.

Help out a Kenyan entrepreneur with great visions!

loans.use: to construct a modern cow shed.

loans.name: May Belle

texts.en:
May Belle is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 36 years old, and all three of her children are still in school.

May Belle has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items such as fabric, needles, thread, etc.

May Belle has been in this business for eight years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items such as fabric, needles, thread, etc.

loans.name: Eunice's Group

texts.en:
Eunice is 53 years old and has 7 children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 11 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. 

Eunice has been farming with One Acre Fund since 2010. This decision was largely a result of her desire to earn enough to feed her family and, although she described her last harvest as good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Eunice also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Eunice's Group will be able to receive a total of 9 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 5.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Esther's Group

texts.en:
Esther is 65 years old and has five children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by ten farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya.

Esther has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Although she described her last harvest as very good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund.

Esther also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have an overall improved quality of life.

Obtaining this loan means that Esther's Group will be able to receive a total of three solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 5.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Lindison's Group

texts.en:
Lindison is 43 years old and has five children. He has been a farmer for fourteen years and is always said to be a very trustworthy person. Even though Lindison is the only one featured in the above picture, he is actually representing his group formed by nine farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya.

Lindison started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2010, and decided to do so because he wanted to earn enough to feed his family. Since then, he has seen his life improve, especially in the sense that he has had more profits from each harvest ever since. This year, he decided to represent his group because he wanted to be more active in his community.

Lindison’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of four acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of six solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Imagine investing in a venture and reaping nothing at the end of the day. This is the sad story of Patrick, a youthful 41-year-old Mzee (old man), a wise farmer whose neighbors and fellow farmers respect as a mentor. He farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills near Litein, in the northern Rift Valley region of Kenya where he grows maize and keeps dairy animals. Patrick's farming experience dates back to 2000. Like many other farmers in the region, Tea is a cash crop which he has been planting for as long as he can remember. With time, the fertility of his land has started to dwindle and whenever he plants tea the yields go down with each growing season. Patrick has also been affected with weeds he recalls that at some point a strange but nice looking weed which produced purple flowers emerged and started to slowly colonize his farm causing his maize yields to decline even further. At some point he could not be assured of harvesting anything at all. Patrick's initial thought was that his farms had been bewitched, a notion that made him feel helpless. 

Today, Patrick requests a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to buy fertilizer, pesticides, and good quality seeds. Through this loan Patrick is going to increase his crop production and improve his income. This loan will permanently change the living standards of Patrick and there is no doubt that he can find rewarding employment in farming.

Support the entrepreneurial dreams of a Kenyan with a loan today!

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pasticide, and good quality seeds.

loans.name: Yasmin

texts.en:
Yasmin is a 33-year-old married woman from a village near Hebron city. She is a mother for one son and one daughter. Three years ago, Yasmin started her own business which is a barn for raising sheep. She sells milk and meat to the local traders. 

Yasmin took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more sheep for her barn. By taking this loan, Yasmin will be able to increase the barn productivity and also the family income. 

Yasmin appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more sheep for her barn.

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Sim, 30, is originally from Kampong Speu Province. He has three children. To make a living and support his family, he runs a business selling wedding preparation services. Sim has been in this business for one year and earns, on average, an income of US $10 a day.  

To make his business become interesting and beneficial, Sim would like to have some modern materials such as tables, chairs, and speakers. As he is short of money, he would like to get a KIVA loan to pay for those materials. With the support from this loan, Sim hopes that his business becomes popular and profitable. He is thankful to all the lenders for their generous behavior.

loans.use: to invest in his wedding preparation services business

loans.name: Phal

texts.en:
Phal, 53, lives in a small community in Pursat Province, Cambodia. He is a father of four children. To make a living and support his family, he manages and operates a farming business, primarily growing rice and selling his agricultural product to the local dealers. He has been in this type of business for 25 years and earns, on average, an income of US $6 a day.

Phal wants to improve his entire family's general living conditions by having a latrine because there is no latrine in his house now. He is borrowing a loan from KIVA to build a latrine so he can help his family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. Phal is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Nigora

texts.en:
Nigora is a resident of the city of Isfara. She is a very hardworking and kind woman.  She is a married and has  one son. 

Nigora has sold fruit In the market for 3 years. Her husband helps Nigora with her business. Nigora  prefers this kind of work because selling fruit brings her a good income.  She wants to expand her business to buy different fruits and vegetables, as the demand for them is growing every day. She does not have the money to  expand and requests a loan to help her  improve her life and provide her with a good future.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Lida

texts.en:
Lida is 62 years old and lives with her son and his family in the city of Vanadzor in the Lori region. Lida has a higher pedagogical education and currently works at the municipality as a leading specialist in the department of culture and education. 

One of her duties is to make a program of preschool facilities and programs. She has successfully managed her work for 16 years and finds great pleasure in making the programs educational, cheerful, and nice. 

Lida is upset because she lacks the necessary computer skills to support her work. This loan will help her to attend courses of computer skills, which will surely lighten her work, and increase efficiency and accuracy.

loans.use: to attend computer skills courses.

loans.name: Azucinas

texts.en: Azucinas, 41 years old, is married and has five children, three of them in school. Azucinas works very hard to provide for them. For the past 16 years, Azucinas has run a general store in the Philippines, selling a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap and other groceries. She has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. In the future, Azucinas would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a hardworking 30-year-old farmer based in the village of Kapkisiara, in the Litein area of Kenya. She lives with her husband of five years on a three-acre farm in the village. Gladys makes a living raising dairy cows and poultry. She also has a borehole where she fetches water for both domestic and agricultural use.

Gladys is seeking a KES 30,000 loan to purchase poultry. She will buy more chickens to add to the eight she already has. Her dream is to scale up her poultry business and have it as one of her main sources of income. In order to achieve this, she has partnered with other local farmers to form a group so that they can access co-guaranteed loans. Income generated from the poultry farm will enable Gladys to repay the loan on time and she will use the additional amount to meet her family's basic needs and education costs.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 59 years old and a widow with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Rebecca has a food vending business in the Philippines. Rebecca requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Rebecca has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, Rebecca would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga is a 56-year-old married woman with one child.

Dominga has raised pigs for 5 years and requests 11,000 PHP through NWTF  to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She has previously borrowed 5 times from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Dominga would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is 41 years old. She is a married woman with eight children. Four of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Adelaida has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Adelaida requested a PHP 9,500 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

Adelaida has been in this business for two years. In the future, Adelaida would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past one year, selling goat meat to the community. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business.

With the loan of KES 50,000 that she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock goats for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase stock goats for resale.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Hello Kiva lenders! Meet Eunice, 44, a hardworking and honest farmer, who is based in the Litein area in Kenya. For the past ten years, she has been making a small living through practicing mixed farming. Her primary source of income has been selling milk and eggs to the nearby market. She also engages in a personal business, or “side hustle” as she likes to call it, to earn additional income. Eunice passionately loves dairy farming, but the biggest challenge she has been facing is accessing funds to increase her business. 

Through Juhudi Kilimo, an organization that supports enterprising farmers, she acquired her first loan, which she used to buy an additional cow. She paid the loan back fully. She also benefited from training and the impact of the first loan cannot be underestimated. Eunice is seeking another loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to buy a quality breed of dairy cow. The cow she plans to buy is not just an ordinary cow, but a quality breed of cow that will be producing between 15-20 liters of milk a day. A liter of milk costs 50 KES; this means she will be making 11 USD a day. From this loan, the life of Eunice will permanently change and she will be able to secure the future of her school-going children. She will also assure her aging parents of a secure future. Eunice waits for your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mashudi

texts.en:
Mashudi is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and transportation costs. 

For the past three years, she has operated a cereals shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and competition as major challenges in her business. Mashudi dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 50,000, she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking fat oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Mzungu

texts.en:
Mzungu is a married woman with seven children, six attend school. She owns a house without electricity and running water.

She has operated a retail business for the past six years to sell wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of stiff competition from other retail operators.

She will use the loan of 40,000 KES to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to increase her business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Tutsa Group

texts.es:
MATILDE.
Desde hace mucho tiempo, se dedica a atender su pequeña tienda de alimentos, la cual ha venido fortaleciendo con los créditos que recibe por parte de VisionFund, ella se describe como una mujer muy trabajadora y servicial, preocupada por el mejoramiento de su comunidad.
Tiene 6 hijos, los cuales están asistiendo regularmente a la escuela; es su segundo crédito en esta institución y se siente muy importante de ser parte de los programas que ofrece VisionFund en el Ecuador.
En esta ocasión ella recibirá la cantidad de $800 dolares con los que comprara artículos de primera necesidad como: arroz, azúcar, aceites, carnes, embutidos. Para poder ofrecer a sus clientes mas productos a un precio considerable.
Se considera una mujer de muchos anhelos, entre ellos el progreso de su comunidad y el mejoramiento de la calidad de la educación; es por ello que participa en las reuniones de la comunidad y centros de educación, para aportar con ideas.
texts.en:
MATILDE
For many years, Matilde has owned a small grocery store which has been strengthened by loans that she has received from VisionFund. She describes herself as a hardworking and helpful woman who is interested in the improvement of her community.

She has 6 children who attend school regularly. This is her second loan with the institution and she believes that it is very important for her to be involved with the programs that VisionFund offers in Ecuador.

This time, she will receive $800, which she will use to purchase goods like rice, sugar, oil, meat, and canned goods so that she can offer more products at a better price to her customers.

She considers herself a woman with many dreams, including progress in her community and improvement in the quality of education. She participates in community and school meetings in order to provide ideas.

loans.use: to purchase items like rice, sugar, oil, meat, and canned goods in order to offer products to her customers at a favorable price.

loans.name: Alba Asunción

texts.es:
Alba de 48 años de edad, estudió hasta 3° grado, es viuda y tiene 6 hijos de los cuales solo  3 viven con ella.

Alba se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan, ella se ha dedicado a este negocio desde hace 20 años el cual aprendió en un curso que se impartió donde ella reside, anteriormente ella vendía tamales pero ahora ella tiene su negocio de pan en su casa.


Alba solicita el crédito para comprar un horno eléctrico porque el que tenía era de leña y genera un costo muy elevado la compra de leña.

Su sueño es ampliar su negocio para poder generar empleos a otras familias.
texts.en:
Alba is 48 years old and attended school until third grade. She has 6 children, 3 of whom live with her. 

Alba makes a living by making and selling bread. She has been working at this business for more than 20 years. She learned the business at a course that she attended in her town. Previously, she sold tamales but now she has her bread-making business in her home.

Alba requests a loan in order to purchase an electric oven because purchasing wood for her wood-fired oven is very expensive. Her dream is to expand her business in order to provide jobs for other families.

loans.use: to purchase an electric oven because purchasing wood for her wood-fired oven is very expensive.

loans.name: Wihembe Twimukye Group

texts.en:
Dezi is a 29-year-old married Ugandan with 3 children, w attend school. He has farmed since 2009 and is also an agriculture produce dealer. He is from Rugarama Mpefu.

Dezi has applied for a loan of 700,000 UGZ from Ugafode to buy corn and beans to make a profit.

His dream for the future is to buy more land and construct a good family house.

He faces challenges of limited capital and bad weather that lead to poor performance. With continued financial support, he will grow his business. 

The group appreciates the support and partnership of the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy corn and beans.

loans.name: Rukhshona

texts.en: Rukhshona is a polite and simple woman. This is her second loan with Kiva. She used the first loan to buy a modern sewing machine and increase her income. She is grateful to you, but now requests another loan. She is going to buy fabric and livestock. She is planning to sew European dresses and sell them in the market.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Haytham

texts.en:
Haytham is a 24-year-old married man from Khan Younis city. He lives with his wife in a small, simple house. Haytham has a poultry farm. This is the only source of income to the family. He sells the meat and eggs to local clients.

Haytham took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy chicks for his farm. 

By taking this loan, he will be able to improve his business and increase productivity.
 
Haytham appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy chicks for his farm.

loans.name: Rieng

texts.en:
Rieng, 32 years old, lives in a community of Pursat Province, Cambodia. She is a lovely mother of two children. She manages and operates a rice farm  located near her house. She has farmed for fourteen years. On average, she is able to make an income of 7.50 USD a day.

She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she requests a loan from KIVA to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. 

She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 34-year-old married man from Khan Younis city. He lives with his wife and three kids; two sons and one daughter in a small simple house. Mohammad works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. He also has a poultry farm. He sells the meat and eggs to the local clients.

Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy chicks for his farm. 

By taking this loan, he will be able to improve his business and increase productivity. 

Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy chicks for his farm

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 28-year-old single man from Tubas, a village near Nablus. He lives with his family in a small, simple house. Ahmad works as a driver in a local firm, earning a small income. He also has a barn for raising sheep. His brothers sometimes help him with the barn work. 

Ahmad took a USD loan from FATEN to help him buy feed and medicines for the sheep. By taking this loan, Ahmad will be able to improve his business and increase productivity.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicines for the sheep.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is a 50-year-old married woman with eight children, three attend school. Zenaida works very hard to provide for them.

Zenaida has run a general store for 15 years and requests13,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

She sells a variety of items such as soap, canned goods, spices, and other groceries. 

In the future Zenaida would like to save enough money to continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries.

loans.name: Mara

texts.en:
Mara is 47 years old and she lives in the city Vanadzor in the Lori region. Mara has two sons, both work  in the Russian Federation. Mara now lives alone. 

She graduated from the Vanadzor State Pedagogical Institute and has worked for 15 years as a teacher of Armenian Language and Literature. She is very respected and loved by her pupils. She  enjoys her work and pupils. She also gives  private Armenian language lessons at her house to prepare the pupils for entrance examinations. 

Mara will use this loan to purchase a computer and professional literature (methodological books and dictionaries).

loans.use: to buy a computer, professional literature,(methodological books) and dictionaries.

loans.name: Artak

texts.en:
Artak, being greatly thankful for his first Kiva loan, hopes to be supported for the second time. He still runs his small fruit and vegetable business at the city's central wholesale market. He rents a stall where he sells apples, carrots, potatoes and radishes. Artak always tries to keep his stall’s assortment full with fresh and tasty products that he buys from his region’s farmers. 

Artak lives in Vanadzor, a city in the Lori region, with his brother and sister; they are also employed and altogether they work a lot to help each other. Artak is asking for this loan as he wants to enlarge his stall’s assortment with products that are raised in greenhouses during this period. They are more expensive but in great demand among Artak's customers. This loan of 150,000 Armenian drams will help Artak to buy cucumbers, tomatoes and peppers to sell at his stall.

loans.use: to buy cucumbers, tomatoes and peppers to sell at his stall

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a freezer in order to keep her meat products fresh.

loans.name: Mvumba

texts.en:
Mvumba is a married woman with five children. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past eight years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of competition from other operators

With the loan of 50,000 KES she is requesting, she wants to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin has been a farmer for a long time and knows what it takes to succeed. He is a hard worker who always says, “I eat from my sweat.” He lives in Rongena, a rural village in the rich highlands of Litein. He is happily married and has been blessed with angelic looking children. He has farmed for five years, and has never regretted it. 

His primary source of income has been milk, eggs, and crops. Most of the small-holder farmers in Rongena village own approximately ¼ acre of land per household, and this has made them work extra hard to fully utilize their farms. He has been able to earn a decent and honest living by selling milk and eggs. These ventures have enabled him to send his children to school and feed his family. 

Martin has planted many trees on his compound and also has Napier grass, which has high protein and is used to feed his dairy cow. This enhances his milk-selling profits. Because of increased demand, Martin requests a loan to buy a good quality dairy cow. Dairy farming is a very profitable venture, and he wants to take full advantage of the ready market for dairy products. 

Through the loan, Martin is sure of satisfying the demand for milk in his area. Through increased profits, Martin is sure that he will repay the loan on time and also be in a position to comfortably take care of his family. Martin, with his entrepreneurial spirit, strength and tenacity, would like to continue fighting so that he can achieve his dream of owning his own business and empowering society by being a source of employment. Juhudi Kilimo, through its training, has helped Martin save more effectively. He plans to add value to his milk through packaging. He also hopes to one day start manufacturing milk products such as yoghurt and cream.

Martin will be able to continue farming and succeed with your help!

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a quality dairy cow

loans.name: Omar Antonio

texts.es:
Omar de 29 años de edad, estudió hasta 9° grado, actualmente está casado y su esposa es ama de casa, tiene un hijo que estudia primer grado, y son los únicos que dependen de Omar.


Él se dedica a la albañilería, este trabajo lo aprendió desde hace 20 años con un curso que lo impartieron en la comunidad, también se dedica a la agricultura; para poderse desplazar hasta el lugar de trabajo, él lo hace en bus porque son 50 km de distancia.


Omar solicita el crédito para comprar una motocicleta para poder desplazarse a su lugar de trabajo de forma más rápida. 

Su sueño es comprar dos vacas para que le produzcan leche y poder innovar un nuevo negocio.
texts.en:
Omar is 29 years old and attended school until 9th grade. He is married and his wife is a homemaker. He has a son who is in first grade, and Omar supports his wife and son.

He is a bricklayer and has worked in this area for 20 years. He learned the trade at a course given in his community. He also works in agriculture. In order to get to work, he travels 50 kilometers by bus. 

Omar is requesting a loan, which he will use to purchase a motorcycle in order to get to work faster. His dream is to purchase two cows to produce milk so that he can start a new business.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle in order to get to work faster.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 200 chickens, 10 quintals of concentrated feed (1 quintal = 100 kg) and vitamins.

loans.name: Awad

texts.en:
Awad is a 35-year-old married man from Yata, a village near Hebron. He lives with his wife and seven children (three sons and four daughters) in a small, simple house. Awad works as a construction worker, earning a low and unstable income. He also has a barn for raising sheep. Awad's wife helps him sometimes with the barn work. 

Awad took a USD loan from FATEN to help him to buy feed and medicines for the sheep. By taking this loan, Awad will be able to improve his business and increase productivity.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicines for the sheep.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Hello world, meet Godfrey. Godfrey comes from Litein where he lives with his lovely wife and adorable kids. He has been a mixed-farmer for nine years. His primary income sources are eggs, tea, crops and an employment salary. Godfrey is most passionate about horticulture farming. He takes pride in being a part of the fastest growing agriculture industry category in Kenya. However, he is facing serious challenges brought about by harsh weather conditions.

Godfrey is seeking a loan to invest in the expansion of his horticulture farm. He sees a lot of room for improvement and growth. What is lacking is the capital to drive the positive change. With your loan, Godfrey will make enough income to take care of his family and other farming expenses. He wakes up early and goes to sleep very late every day to give his family a decent living and afford a proper education for his children.

Help out a Kenyan farmer with great aspirations and ambitions in life.

loans.use: To expand his horticulture farm.

loans.name: Wilberforce

texts.en: Wilberforce, 24 years old, lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is a hardworking man who deals in produce, mainly buying and selling beans, coffee and maize, among other items. Wilberforce earns additional income from teaching. This business has seen Wilberforce move to a level of self-sustainability and he is determined to reap more profits each season. Wilberforce desires to expand and develop his business and will use the loan to buy more maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize to sell.

loans.name: Chiputu

texts.en:
Chiputu is a married woman who lives with her husband and five children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past twelve years, Chiputu has operated a charcoal sales business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her major business challenge is the high cost of transportation. Chiputu dreams of expanding her business to a wholesale. 

Chiputu wants to use this KES 40,000 loan to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale. She decided to join to Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Sandra Luz

texts.es:
Sandra, de 37 años de edad, estudió hasta séptimo grado, está casada y su esposo trabaja como empleado en una hacienda, tiene 4 hijos, uno de ellos ya esta acompañado, solo tres estan con ella y estudian nadie.

Sandra, se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace tres años, la necesidad la llevo a dedicarse a este negocio, anteriormente se dedicaba a los oficios domesticos y a vender frutas, verduras y tamales.- Ahora, ella vende en su comunidad, camina alrededor de 9 a 10 kilometros 3 veces a la semana y horario de trabajo comienza a las 8:00 de la mañana y regresa a la 1:00 de la tarde a hacer los oficios de la casa.

Sandra, esta solicitando el credito en CREDICAMPO para comprar 300 ladrillos, 10 bolsas de cemento, 2 quintales de hierro y una camionada de arena, para arreglar su casa y ayudar para que su familia viva comodamente.

Sandra, sueña a futuro en tener un comedor, que sus hijos sean profesionales y poder a tener dos vacas lecheras.
texts.en:
Sandra, who is 37 years old, studied until 7th grade. She is married and her husband works as an employee at a hacienda. They have 4 children, one of whom is married. Three of her children still live with her and none attend school.

Sandra has made a living by selling clothing for the past three years. Economic necessity drove her to work. Previously, she did domestic tasks at home and sold fruits, vegetables, and tamales. Now, she sells clothing in her community. She walks around 9 or 10 kilometers three times per week. She leaves her home around 8:00 am and returns at 1:00 pm in order to do housework.

Sandra is requesting a loan from Credicampo in order to purchase 300 bricks, 10 bags of cement, 2 quintals of iron, and a truck full of sand. She will repair her home with the materials, which will help to allow her family to live comfortable.

Snadra dreams of having a kitchen in the future, owning two dairy cows, and seeing her children become professionals.

loans.use: to purchase 300 bricks, 10 bags of cement, 2 quintals of iron and a truck full of sand.

loans.name: Nduni

texts.en:
Nduni is a married woman with three kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Nduni operates a grocery vegetable stall where she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of the high cost of transportation and competition in her business.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Sylivia

texts.en: Sylivia is a married woman who lives in the outskirts of Kyotera town. She was attracted to joining the traditional bark cloth business because a relative has reaped big from the same and the bark cloth was available in a nearby location; yet the market was equally available ranging from musicians who use them during traditional dances to the city merchants who weave different crafts out of them. With the loan, she will buy directly from the harvesters of the bark cloth which will make it cheaper and profitable.

loans.use: to buy bark cloth to sell.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a twenty-year-old, single man from a village near Hebron City, Palestine. He lives with his family in a very poor house. Ahmad has a poultry farm that is is the only source of income for the family. He sells the meat and eggs to local clients. Ahmad received a loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (Kiva's partner) to help him to buy chicks for his farm. With this loan, Ahmad will be able to improve his business and increase the productivity.

loans.use: to buy chicks for his farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a quality breed of cow

loans.name: Zuma

texts.en:
Zuma is a married woman with seven children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past six years, selling goat meat in the community. A major challenge she faces in her business is competition.
With the 40,000 KES loan she is requesting, Zuma wants to purchase a stock of goats for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of goats for resale.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is a thirty-five year old married woman with five children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She deals in cocoa and food stuffs. She works hard to sustain her business and hopes to build a permanent house. Her only challenges are high levels of competition plus seasonality changes.
Annet needs a loan to buy cocoa and food stuffs for selling.

loans.use: to buy cocoa and food stuffs for selling.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is a hardworking, married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a farmer growing food crops like bananas, cabbages and tomatoes. He faces a challenge of inadequate capital. Moses has hopes of completing his house construction. He has asked for a loan to build a residential house.

loans.use: to build a residential house.

loans.name: Mwachupa

texts.en: Mwachupa is a married woman and lives with her husband and children. She owns a house without electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. For the past 12 years, she has operated a charcoal selling business. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. She decided to join Yehu (Kiva's partner) to access loans to boost her business. With the 50,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase more bundles of charcoal for resale. She dreams of expanding her business to be a wholesale supplier.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Marys Consuelo

texts.es:
Marys, supo invertir el crédito anterior en la venta de ropa, su situación económica está mejorando, mantiene clientes satisfechos y en su familia todos se encuentra muy saludables y apoyándola para que siga trabajando.
Se  decidió a solicitar un nuevo crédito por los beneficios que tiene de ellos, lo invertirá en ropa interior, pantalones, camisas, camisetas, blusas, etc., surtidos en tallas, estilos y colores para adultos y niños/as, seguirá dando una buena atención a sus clientes y teniendo ingresos.
texts.en:
Marys invested her previous loan in the sale of clothing and her economic situation is improving. She keeps her clients satisfied and her family are all in good health and supporting her so that she can continue to work. 

She decided to ask for another loan because of her previous success. With the new loan she will buy underwear, trousers, shirts, t-shirts, blouses, etc., supplied in a range of sizes, styles and colours that are both for adults and children. She will continue to provide her clients with good service and have an income.

loans.use: to buy underwear, trousers, shirts, t-shirts, blouses, etc., supplied in a range of sizes, styles and colours that are both for adults and children.

loans.name: Chinyavu

texts.en:
Chinyavu is a married woman with three children, two of whom attend school and the other one who is still young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past four years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of customers waiting too long to repay goods taken on credit.

With the loan of KES 30,000 she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es:
Alfredo de 57 años de edad, estudió hasta 2ª grado, está acompañado y tiene 3 hijos, todos mayores de edad. 

Alfredo es agricultor y su compañera de vida se dedica a los oficios domésticos, anteriormente él se dedicaba al destazo de cerdos pero por su edad y un accidente que tuvo, quedó con pocas fuerzas para trabajar con animales, además  se dedica a la agricultura ya que durante toda su vida ha sido su mayor fuente de ingresos. 

Él necesita este crédito para pagar el alquiler del terreno donde trabaja.

Él desea que Dios le de salud y fuerza para trabajar ya que el trabajo para él aparte de ser su fuente de ingresos es como un pasatiempo.
texts.en:
Alfredo, who is 57 years old, attended school through the 2nd grade. He is married with three grown children.

Alfredo is a farmer and his wife works in an office. Formerly he worked butchering pigs but due to his age and an accident he had, he settled on a less physically demanding job working with animals. He also works in agriculture, which throughout his life has been his primary source of income.

He needs this loan to pay rent on the land where he works. He hopes that God gives him health and strength to do the work which for him is a hobby in addition to providing him a source of income.

loans.use: pay rent on the land where he works.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase new model cell phones to resell to his customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase new and stylish women's clothes and incense to resell them to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chicks for his farm.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson is a 36-year-old married and hardworking man with five children, living in Kagadi, Uganda. He has operated an animal drug shop since 2003 and owns rentals where he provides quality service and in turn gets profits to sustain his family. He hopes to increase his household income despite competition and insufficient capital leading to under stocking and in turn low returns on his sales. Wilson is requesting a loan to increase his stock by buying more animal drugs.

loans.use: to increase his stock by buying more animal drugs.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Hello lenders! Meet Benard, 39, who is based in the Litein area of Kenya. This area may be the major 'bread basket' of the country, but it is increasingly emerging as an important dairy farming zone for East Africa. Thousands of farmers are now finding dairy farming a good supplement, if not a substitute, for maize. This handsome father has been practicing mixed farming for the past 14 years and his primary source of income has been milk and eggs.

Benard passionately loves dairy farming and he enjoys feeding his cow. Milking his cow is his hobby. Waking up every morning to milk his cow is very fulfilling to him. The biggest challenge he faces is the lack of a proper dairy unit where his cows can feed and rest. Because of this, he has suffered losses through diseases that attack his cows because of the harsh weather conditions. If you are to reap more from cows, you must feed them properly to get high quality milk. He is requesting a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to build a modern dairy unit. With the loan, he will be able to increase his milk production, improve his living conditions and secure the future of his school-going children.

loans.use: to build a modern dairy unit.

loans.name: Reyna Guadalupe

texts.es:
Reyna, es madre soltera de un niño de un mes de nacido, se enfoca en trabajar para obtener los recursos económicos con los que puede costear sus gastos personales y cubrir todas las necesidades de su hijo, se dedica a vender ropa, cosméticos y joyería de enchape, lo hace todos los días y lo atiende ella sola, no representa dificultades para atender el negocio y cuidar de su hijo.
Comprará pulseras, aretes, cadenas, anillos, variedad de ropa y cosméticos, tendrá un inventario al día con las tendencias de la moda, de esta manera se le facilitara su venta e incremento en las ganancias, espera utilizar correctamente el crédito para tener efectos positivos. 
Los sueños de Reyna son cancelar sus deudas y que su negocio sea autosostenible.
texts.en:
Reyna is a single mother with a one-month old son. She is focussed on working to earn the money to pay for personal expenses and all the things that her son needs. Reyna sells clothing, cosmetics, and costume jewelry, a job she does every day. She works alone and doesn’t have any problem running her business and looking after her child.

She plans to buy bracelets, earrings, chains, rings, and a variety of clothing and cosmetics so that she has an updated, fashionable range of items. Then she will be able to sell more and increase her income. Reyna expects to use the loan appropriately so it will have positive effects on her business.

Her dreams are to pay off her debt and have a sustainable business.

loans.use: buy bracelets, earrings, chains, rings, and a variety of clothing and cosmetics

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel lives in Homa Bay County. Homa Bay County is located in south-western Kenya, and borders on Lake Victoria, the second-largest lake in the world. Populations are dense close to the lake, where many individuals make their living from fishing, and a few work in the small but slowly growing tourism industry. A popular tourist attraction in Homa Bay County is Ruma National Park, a game reserve that is home to the rare roan antelope, a shy species distantly related to the reticulated giraffe. Most people in Homa Bay make their living from farming and the rolling hills of the area are dotted with fields and fruit tree plantations.

Samwel is married and has seven children. He is a community health worker. He also does farming with his wife. They have been farming for twenty years now and they are currently growing maize, millet and sunflower. Samwel is excited about beekeeping as it will earn him some income from the sale of honey and it will provide him with honey for medicine.

This is Samwel's first loan with Honey Care and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to pay school fees for his children. Samwel's hope for the future is to become a good beekeeper and to have his children educated.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Balmoris

texts.es:
Balmoris tiene 40 años de edad, estudió hasta 6ª grado en la cuelas, está acompañado y tiene dos hijos pero solo su hija se encuentra estudiando. 

Balmoris se dedica al destazo de cerdos desde hace un año, su compañera de vida le ayuda en la venta de carne fresca. Casi toda su vida se ha dedicado a la agricultura pero aprendió el destazo cuando lo buscaron de ayudante y decidió poner su propio negocio. 

Este crédito lo necesita para comprar cerdos para el destazo, y luego comercializar la carne. 

Lo que él más desea es salir adelante con el negocio pero al por mayor ya que tiene mucha clientela y la demanda es mayor.
texts.en:
Balmoris is 40 years old. He attended school through the 6th grade. He is married and has two children, but only his daughter is still in school.

Balmoris has worked butchering pigs for one year. His wife helps him sell the fresh meat. Almost all his life he has worked in agriculture. He learned butchering when an assitant was being sought and decided to open his own business.

He needs this loan to buy pigs for butchering in order to later sell the meat.

He wants most of all to succeed in his business on a larger scale given that he has many clients and demand is great.

loans.use: to buy pigs for butchering in order to later sell the meat.

loans.name: Hala

texts.en:
Hala is a 53-year-old married mother of three children who has worked in her grocery shop for seven years to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family.

Hala is a hard worker and ambitious lady who is trying desperately to satisfy her children's needs and develop her business. Thus today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay her child's university tuition fees, and she wants to increase her business merchandise with new products.

Hala hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and stay capable of satisfying her children's needs.

loans.use: to pay her child's university tuition fees and  increase her business merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy additional poultry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in cheese, margarine, wheat flour, ham, eggs, sugar, and other goods, as well as a bigger oven.

loans.name: Zyinat

texts.ru: Зыйнат 51 год, замужем, мать 3 детей, у нее высшее образование, работает учителем в школе. Зыйнат в качестве дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи на протяжении 30 лет занимается разведением скота и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду на сегодняшний день Зыйнат имеет в хозяйстве 3 коровы, 20 овец. На земельном участке мерою 1,2 Га выращивает ячмень. Вся деятельность приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS). Сделав вывод, что данный бизнес рентабелен, Зыйнат обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства и постройку сарая для скота.
texts.en: Zyinat is 51, married, and has three children. She has a college education and is a schoolteacher. In order to earn additional income for her family, she has been raising livestock and planting crops for thirty years. Thanks to her hard work, Zyinat currently has three cows and 20 sheep. She grows barley on a 1.2 hectare plot of land. All of her farming activities bring in a profit of 20,000 som (KGS) per month. Because her business is profitable, Zyinat asked for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) with Bai-Tushum Bank to buy a cow. She plans to invest her profits in expanding her farm and to build a barn for her livestock.

loans.use: to purchase a cow for fattening and resale

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Hello world! Meet Charles, a farmer in Kericho. Charles is involved in maize, poultry and dairy farming. He engages in milk and egg production for commercial purposes as opposed to many rural farmers who are in it for subsistence. Charles also grows maize for food and sales. These commercial activities place him in a better position to engage in other agriculture related businesses, which, in fact, he does.

Charles is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo to construct a cow shed. This will help significantly in managing the animals’ health and hygiene. He has been in the farming business for at least 10 years. He has no plans to quit in the future as he finds farming to be not only fulfilling but also lucrative. However, his biggest challenges are the poor road network and lack of market.

With your loan, Charles will construct a cow shed, which will later come in handy when he scales up and introduces zero-grazing. The long-term impact is an increase in productivity and improved animal health. The additional income from this development will go to his children’s education.

loans.use: To construct a cow shed

loans.name: Candelario Antonio

texts.es:
CANDELARIO, ESTUDIO HASTA SEGUNDO GRADO DE BÁSICA, ESTÁ ACOMPAÑADO Y SU PAREJA TRABAJA EN LOS OFICIOS DOMESTICOS, TIENE SEIS HIJOS QUE VIVEN EN CASA, DOS ESTUDIAN, DOS TRABAJAN Y DOS ESTAN PEQUEÑOS.

CANDELARIO, TRABAJA CON GANADO DE REPASTO, LO HA HECHO POR MAS DE 14 AÑOS Y LO APRENDIO POR INICIATIVA PROPIA; DECIDIO HACERLO PARA OBTENER INGRESOS ECONOMICOS EXTRA PARA SU FAMILIA, TAMBIEN TRABAJA LA AGRICULTURA, ANTES SOLO ERA JORNALERO.- LA DISTANCIA QUE CAMINA PARA LLEGAR A SU LUGAR DE TRABAJO ES DE 2 KILOMETROS, LE AYUDAN SUS DOS HIJOS Y SU HORARIO ES DE 6:00 AM A 11:00 AM Y TRABAJA EN LA AGRICULTURA Y CON EL GANADO EL RESTO DEL DIA. 

CANDELARIO NECESITA EL CRÉDITO PARA COMPRAR GANADO DE REPASTO, CON ESTO MEJORARA MUCHO, PORQUE TENDRA LA OPORTUNIDAD DE TENER MÁS GANADO Y ESO LE PERMITIRA TENER MEJOR CALIDAD DE VIDA Y SENTIRSE SATISFECHO.

SUS SUEÑOS SON, SEGUIR TRABAJANDO LO MEJOR QUE PUEDA, PARA PODER DARLES UN MEJOR FUTURO A SU FAMILIA Y AYUDAR A SUS HIJOS PARA QUE ESTUDIEN.
texts.en:
Candelario attended school through the 2nd grade. He is married and his wife works in an office. He has six children who live at home: two go to school, two work and two are still very young.

Candelario has worked with beef cattle for more than 14 years. He learned his trade through his own initiative. He decided on this line of work to obtain extra income for his family. He also works in agriculture. Before, he was a day laborer.

Candelario walks two kilometers to work. He works with two of his children from 6am until 11am. He works in agriculture and with cattle the rest of the day.

Candelario needs this loan to buy beef cattle. This would help him a lot as it would give him the opportunity to buy more cattle, which would give him a better quality of life and a sense of satisfaction.

His dreams are to continue working as best he can in order to provide his family a better future and to help his children so that they can attend school.

loans.use: buy beef cattle.

loans.name: Rigo Alberto

texts.es:
RIGO, ESTUDIO HASTA SEXTO GRADO DE BASICA, ESTA CASADO Y SU ESPOSA TRABAJA EN LOS OFICIOS DOMESTICOS, TIENE DOS HIJOS QUE ESTUDIAN Y VIVEN CON EL.
