Luis Enrique works as a well operator in the aqueduct business, and has worked in said business for 7 years. He continues to work, this being the main source of income for family support. He presented himself at the CEPRODEL offices to ask for a loan to buy blocks and iron to complete the construction of a room in his house because his income is not sufficient to carry out this maintenance with his own funds. Luis Enrique sees the positive and hopes that this loan will be given so he can carry out the purchase of these materials. He hopes he will improve his home little by little and also reach a better life.

loans.use: to buy blocks and iron

loans.name: Kotognontala Group

texts.fr:
Sizere est une vendeuse de chaussures, Malienne, âgée de 30 ans, mariée mère de 4 enfants âgé de 2 à14 ans, dont 2 vont à l’école. Son mari est un cultivateur ; Elle n’a jamais été à l’école .Elle a commencé à exercer ce travail il ya 6 ans de cela. Elle revêt le bonheur de ses enfants ; elle fait recourt au RMCR pour avoir de l’argent enfin d’acheter beaucoup de chaussures pour vendre, Elle vend les chaussures, assiettes, et beaucoup d’autres marchandises. L’approvisionnement se fait à Bamako. Elle vent dans les marchés locaux en espèce et à crédit. Après le payement de la dette ce qu’elle  gagne comme bénéfice lui permet à prendre certaines charges dans la famille (santé, habillements, nourriture).   
Sizere est celle assise avec la main levée sur la photo.
texts.en: Sizere is a shoe saleswoman. She is Malian and 30 years old, and is married and the mother of 4 children who range in age from 2 to 14 years, two of whom go to school. Her husband is a farmer and she never attended school. She began to run her business 6 years ago. She takes care of her children's well-being and came to RMCR to get funds to purchase lots of shoes to sell. She sells shoes, plates and lots of other merchandise. She purchases her stock in Bamako. She sells in local markets, directly and by offering credit. After paying the loan, what she keeps as profit will allow her to pay certain family costs (health, clothing, food). Sizere is the woman seated on the left with her hand raised in the photo.

loans.use: to buy lots of shoes to sell

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es: Esteban  tiene la edad  de 24 años, está soltero, vive con sus padres que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas y pagar mano de obra en trabajos de asistencia para el café, además de comprar algunas plantas de almácigo para hacer resiembras a inicio de lluvias esto con el objetivo de aumentar la densidad de plantas por área, además de aprovechar la buena fertilidad del suelo y las condiciones de clima y otras que favorecen al cultivo de café. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también invertir un poco más en el área de cultivo y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Esteban is 24 years old, is single, and lives with his parents—who are his top priority. 

He plans to use the loan to buy fertilizers and fungicides, and to pay for labor to help him with the tasks involved in growing coffee. He will also buy a few seedlings to replant at the start of the rainy season with the purpose of increasing the density of plants in the area. He will take advantage of the good soil fertility, climate, and other factors that favour coffee cultivation. 

With these improvements to his crops, he hopes to generate a bit more profit and, thus, improve his family's living conditions. He also hopes to invest a little bit more in his cultivation area and achieve some of his goals.

This is the first loan that Esteban has received from FUDECOSUR. He had not had any other loans from state banks before, but FUDECOSUR has granted him a loan with better terms and at a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs to grow coffee.

loans.name: Triunfo Group

texts.es:
Don Mario y Emma son esposos desde hace 27 años, juntos formaron una familia con cuatro hijos que actualmente ya son independientes. Don Mario tiene 46 años de edad y le enorgullece tener una familia muy trabajadora.

Don Mario es un hombre responsable y emprendedor, hace 20 años inició su vida como comerciante, vendía plásticos pero sus conocidos siempre le recomendaron el negocio de los zapatos ya que tendría la posibilidad de mejorar sus ganancias. “Inicié vendiendo en los tianguis con una inversión de $1,000 pesos ($70 USD)” comento Don Mario, que para él realmente fue mucho dinero que había conseguido al trabajar durante algún tiempo en EE.UU.

Posteriormente, la esposa e hijo de don Mario (Miguel) también invirtieron para tener su propia mercancía; cada uno tomó una ruta diferente vendiendo en tianguis y plazas para abarcar más mercado. La venta de zapatos siempre fue muy productiva en los tianguis, pero uno de los sueños de Don Mario era tener un local. Por esta razón, hace 15 años adquirió un terreno para construir sus locales invirtiendo también el primer préstamo solicitado para dar una pequeña parte de la deuda de su terreno. “Ha sido un poco complicado poder iniciar con la construcción y con el permiso hemos batallado aun mas” comentó Don Mario. Finalmente este año la familia obtuvo la autorización para levantar sus locales y planean usar algunos para vender ropa. 

Para continuar con el plan, Don Mario necesita invertir un nuevo préstamo en material como cemento, arena, grava, varillas. Los tres están muy contentos y agradecidos con VisionFund y KIVA por los préstamos otorgados porque gracias a ellos ahora tienen un terreno propio y tendrán sus locales, además porque su calidad de vida ha  mejorado. Don Mario espera terminar muy pronto de construir sus locales para contratar a algunas personas y así ayudarlos también a mejorar su calidad de vida.

*La fotografía fue tomada en el lugar donde los integrantes guardan su mercancía.
texts.en:
Don Mario and Emma have been husband and wife for 27 years.  Together they formed a family with 4 children who are now already independent.  Mario is 46 years old and it fills him with pride to have such a hard-working family.

Mario is a responsible and enterprising man.  Twenty years ago he began his life as a merchant selling plastics, but his friends always recommended the business of selling shoes since it would have the possibility of improving his earnings.  “I began selling in the open-air markets with an investment of $1000 pesos ($70 USD),” commented Mario, which for him was really a lot of money that he had obtained working for some time in the US.

Later, his wife and his son Miguel also invested to have their own merchandise.  Each one took a different route selling in open-air markets and plazas to take in more of the market.  The sale of shoes was always very productive in the open-air markets, but one of Mario's dreams was to have his own premises.

For this reason, 15 years ago he acquired a piece of land on which to construct his premises, investing also the first loan that he asked for in order to pay a small part of the debt for the land. “It has been a bit complicated to be able to begin construction and we have battled even more with the permission,” commented Mario.  Finally, this year the family obtained the authorization to put up their premises and they plan to use some for selling clothing.

In order to continue with the plan, Mario needs to invest a new loan in material such as cement, sand, gravel and bars.  The three of them are very happy and thankful to VisionFund and Kiva for the loans granted because thanks to them now they have their own land and they will have their own premises. Also, because their quality of life has improved.  Mario hopes to finish building their premises soon in order to hire some people and thus also help them to improve their quality of life.

*The photograph was taken in the place where the members keep their merchandise.

loans.use: to buy material such as lime, cement, sand, gravel, etc.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Rokia est une restauratrice au Mali mariée, âgée de 45 ans, mère de trois (3) enfants dont tous sont scolarisés  Son mari est un cultivateur. Elle n’a pas été à l’école. Elle a un endroit pour la restauration. Elle exerce ce métier il y’a 7 ans .Pour agrandir sa restauration elle a décidé de contracter un prêt au RMCR pour acheter des sacs de riz et condiment pour la restauration. Elle fait la restauration hebdomadairement c'est-à-dire  pendant les jours de foires de la localité. Le bénéfice lui permettra de couvrir les charges de la famille. 
Rokia est la dame assise avec le sac a sa droit sur la photo.
texts.en: Rokia is a restaurant-keeper in Mali who is married, 45 years old and the mother of three (3) children who have all been to school. Her husband is a farmer. She hasn't been to school. She keeps a restaurant. She has had this business since 7 years ago. To grow her restaurant she decided to take a loan from RMCR in order to purchase sacks of rice and condiments for her restaurant. She opens her restaurant each week, during the days of the weekly markets in her town. Her profits will allow her to pay for family expenses. Rokia is the woman seated with the sack of rice to her right in the photo.

loans.use: to buy rice, meat and condiments for her restaurant

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy onion, bullion, and salt to resell

loans.name: Rosa De Saron Group

texts.es: Rosa de Saron es un grupo solidario integrado por cuatro mujeres laboriosas que se esfuerzan a diario por brindar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia, solicitan por séptima ocasión el financiamiento en ADIM de sus negocios. Quien coordina el grupo es Ivania una mujer de éxitos en su vida laboral, tiene la edad de 40 años, casada, se dedica a la comercialización de ropa además ofrece el servicio de comida principalmente a trabajadores de una zona franca cercana a su domicilio, con los créditos anteriores ha logrado aumentar su clientela lo que la ha motivado a seguir solicitando los financiamientos, el crédito actual lo solicita para la compra de granos básicos como es arroz, aceite, frijol, plátano verde, plátano maduro, platos térmicos, tenedores y cucharas desechables, etc., una de sus metas es mantener su negocio ya que es el que le permite obtener los ingresos para cubrir parte de sus gastos. El resto de los integrantes son las señoras, María de la luz que tienen la edad de 66 años ofrece el servicio de fritanga en su domicilio desde hace ocho años, Lissette una mujer de 31 años comercializa calzados y bisutería a los pobladores de su comunidad desde hace cinco años y Dora que a sus 60 años de edad continúa trabajando es propietaria de una pulpería, comercializa calzado y ofrece el servicio de fritanga en su domicilio desde hace diecisiete años.
texts.en: Rosa de Saron is a support group made up of four hard-working women who strive daily to provide a better life to their families. They are requesting funding from ADIM for their businesses for the seventh time. Ivania is the group's coordinator and a successful woman in her working life. She is 40 years old, married, and makes a living selling clothing and also offers food service to workers in an open area near her home. With the previous loans, she has succeeded in increasing her clientele which has motivated her to continue requesting funding. The current loan is requested for the purchase of basic staple foods such as rice, oil, beans, green bananas, ripe bananas, thermal plates, forks and spoons, etc.One of her goals is to maintain her business because it allows her to obtain income to cover part of her expenses. The other members are: María De La Luz, aged 66, who has sold fried food from her home for 8 years; Lissette, aged 31, who has sold shoes and costume jewellery to the residents of her community since she was age 5; and Dora, aged 60, who continues working as the owner of a little store where she also sells shoes and has sold fried food from her home for 17 years

loans.use: to buy basic staple foods, since the clientele has increased and therefore the demand for the products offered

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks, etc. to build a bathroom and basin.

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
Ana María se destaca en  su comunidad  por ser una persona muy amable, ella es una mujer casada de 33 años tiene 3 hijos comprendidas entre las edades de 3 a 8 años.  Esta hermosa familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá. 

Ana María es una mujer muy visionaria con su familia porque los ama, ella trabaja con el afán de que sus hijos tengan lo necesario,  para generar sus ingresos económicos ella trabaja como secretaria en una institución desde hace 10 años.
Ana María por su mismo trabajo ella necesita de una computadora y más adelante también le servirá  también a sus hijos para que  tengan donde realizar sus trabajos, por la misma necesidad que se le presenta a Ana y  pues para obtener la máquina, Ana decide buscar un préstamo de tres mil quetzales con y con ingresos  pagara el préstamo poco a poco.
 
La ilusión de Ana es seguir apoyando a sus hijos y verlos algún día graduados y anhela también comprar lotes de terrenos para construir una vivienda  para cada uno de sus hijos. Ana María no pierda esperanzas en conseguir el crédito lo más antes posible y hacer realidad lo que necesita
texts.en:
Ana María stands out in her community as a very kind person. She is a married woman of 33 years. She has 3 children between the ages of 3 and 8 years old. This beautiful family lives in the community of Sololá.

Ana María is a visionary woman with her family because she loves them. She works with the desire that her children will have what they need. In order to make an income, she has worked as a secretary in an institution for 10 years.

Ana María needs a computer for her job, and later it can also serve as a place for her children to do their work. For this reason, she has decided to seek a loan of three thousands quetzales, and use her income to pay the loan off gradually.

Ana's dream is to continue to support her children, and to see them graduate some day, and also yearns to buy parcels of land to build a house for each of her children. Ana María will not lose hope in getting the loan as soon as possible, and fulfilling her need.

loans.use: to purchase a computer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy prawns, fish and crabs.

loans.name: Milenium Group

texts.es: Al grupo solidario Milenium lo integran cuatro mujeres emprendedoras. Está coordinado por Juniek una joven que a sus 20 años de edad conoce de sus responsabilidades, ella se dedica a la comercialización de electrodomésticos y calzado, es el segundo ciclo que solita a ADIM el financiamiento para la inversión en abanicos, planchas para el cabello, sandalias altas, sandalias bajas, zapatos colegiales, etc., con el crédito anterior logró aumentar la mercadería ofrecida. Las demás integrantes son, la señora María Josefa que tiene la edad de 38 años su negocio es la hecha y venta de tortillas desde hace cuatro años, Sebastiana una señora de 31 años de edad y comercializa ropa de segunda de manera ambulante desde hace un año, y Yaris una joven de 19 años y se dedica a la comercialización de ropa de segunda en las calles de su comunidad desde hace dos años.
texts.en: The solidarity group Milenium is made up of 4 entrepreneurial women. Their coordinator is Juniek, a young woman who at the age of 20 knows her responsibilities. She makes a living selling household appliances and shoes. This is the second cycle of requesting funding through ADIM, for investing in fans, hair straighteners, high heels, sandals, collegiate shoes, etc. With the previous loan she was able to increase the merchandise offered. The other members are: María Josefa, aged 38, whose business has been the making and selling tortillas for 4 years; Sebastiana, aged 31, who has sold second-hand clothing as a street vendor for a year; and Yaris, aged 19, who has made a living selling second hand clothing in the streets of her community for 2 years.

loans.use: to buy fans, sandals, hair straighteners, etc., in order to meet the demand for these products.

loans.name: Rider Roger

texts.es:
Rider es un joven de 33 años. Su madre fue quien la motivó a vender pescados y actualmente él se dedica a la venta de pescados y mariscos desde hace varios años, ubicado en el mercado central. Su anhelo es ahorrar un pequeño capital con las ventas  para  poder tramitar sus documentos de titulación dado que pronto culminara sus estudios superiores. Requiere el crédito para comprar más pescados y mariscos para su venta diaria. 
Rider está muy agradecido con los inversionistas Kiva por haber confiado en él y así poder cumplir una de sus metas.
texts.en:
Rider is a young man of 33. He was motivated to sell fish by his mother and has been selling fish and shellfish in the central market for several years. 

His challenge is to save a little bit of capital from his sales so that he can pay the processing fees for his degree documents, as he is about to finish his post-secondary studies. He is asking for a loan so he can buy more fish and shellfish to sell daily. Rider is very grateful to the Kiva investors for having confidence in him and helping him accomplish one of his goals.

loans.use: to buy fish and shellfish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer, potato seeds and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Ana Erlinda

texts.es:
Ana, de 33 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos.

Ana, se dedica a la venta y compra de mariscos, tiene alrededor de 20 años de ejercer este negocio, el cual lo emprendió desde que estaba muy joven.

Hoy en día Ana, solicita un crédito para comprar camarones, pescado, langostas, entre otros mariscos; pues ella considera que debe de tener más variedad, porque la demanda de clientes es más grande.

A futuro sueña con tener un negocio más grande, que le permita mejores condiciones de vida para ella y su familia.
texts.en: Ana, aged 33, is married with 2 children. She makes a living selling and buying seafood and has around 20 years of experience in this business, which she started when she was very young. Now Ana is requesting a loan to buy shrimp, fish, and lobster among other seafood, because she believes that she should have more variety because the demand of her customers is very big. In the future she dreams of having a bigger business, which will allow a better life for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy shrimp, fish, and lobsters

loans.name: Dina Ruth

texts.es:
Dina, de 44 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora, ama de casa, dedicada a su familia y su hogar; está casada.

Dina, se dedica a la venta de pescado desde hace 20 años, ella sale a vender todas las mañanas en los lugares aledaños a su vivienda. 

Ella, necesita el crédito para comprar redes de pescar y más producto para su negocio.

Dina, desea mejorar su vivienda para darles la oportunidad de estudiar a sus hijos, hasta que logren ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Dina, aged 44, is an enterprising woman. She is married and is a homemaker devoted to her family and home.

Dina has been selling fish for 20 years. She goes out to sell her product in the neighbourhood every morning.

She needs a loan to buy fishing nets and more supplies for her business.

Dina hopes to improve her home and give her children the opportunity to study until they become professionals.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and more supplies for her business.

loans.name: Aminata's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois  a été créé le 06 Février 2010 lors l’inauguration du dit banc villageois. Ce groupement vient d’entamer son neuvième cycle et  compte des femmes qui habitent toutes le même village. Elles jouissent d’une bonne entente et d’un bon esprit de groupe. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Aminata (debout à l’extrême droite) est l’emprunteuse vedette du  groupe. Elle est âgée 50 ans, mariée et mère de 04 garçons et  vendeuse de thé, de sucre et des sachets de jus.

Avec ce nouveau crédit elle compte acheter 4 sacs de sucre à 20000 f l’un, du thé à 14000f  la caisse, les sachets de jus à 10000 et paie un transport qui lui revient à 2000f pour le revendre en détail. 

Avec les bénéfices, elle compte consolider ses épargner et contribuer à la dépense quotidienne.
texts.en:
The "banc villageois" was created on February 6, 2010 at the moment of its inauguration. This group has just begun its ninth loan cycle and is made up of women who all live in the same village. They get along well with each other and have a good group spirit. Their main business is small-scale commerce. 

Madame Aminata (standing on the far right) is the featured borrower of the group. She is 50, married, the mother of four sons, and sells tea, sugar, and bags of juice. 

With the new loan she expects to buy four sacks of sugar at 20,000 francs each, tea at 14,000 francs a case, bags of juice at 10,000 and to pay transport which comes to 2,000 francs on these goods for retail sale. With the profit, she intends to consolidate her savings and contribute to daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy four sacks of sugar at 20,000 francs each, tea at 14,000 francs per case, bags of juice for 10,000 and to pay transport which comes to 2,000 francs for goods for retail.

loans.name: Las Vencedoras Group

texts.es: Las vencedoras en un grupo solidario integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras que solicitan por novena ocasión el financiamiento para sus negocios. Lo coordina la señora Ánjela que tiene la edad de 40 años, acompañada, su negocio es la comercialización de productos lácteos y ropa de segunda, en su domicilio y comunidades cercanas, el crédito actual lo solicita para la compra de lácteo como es crema, queso quesillo, mantequilla, cuajadas, queso para freír, etc., con los créditos anteriores ha logrado aumentar y diversificar los productos ofrecidos. El resto de las integrantes son las señoras, María que tiene la edad de 49 años y es propietaria de una pulpería desde hace tres años, y Sara de 36 años de edad propietaria de una pulpería desde hace tres años.
texts.en:
Las Vencedoras is a solidarity group made up of three hard-working women, and this is the ninth cycle in which they are asking for a loan for their businesses.

Anjela is the coordinator of the group. She is 40 years old and has a life partner.  Her business is selling dairy products and second-hand clothing from her home and in the nearby communities. This loan is for the purchase of dairy products such as cream, fresh cheese, butter, curds, frying cheese, etc. Prior loans have allowed her to increase and diversify the products she offers.

The other members are Maria who is 49 and has owned a grocery store for three years, and Sara who is 36 and has also owned a grocery store for three years.

loans.use: to buy dairy products because these products are always in demand.

loans.name: Yeredeme Group

texts.fr:
Bintou est une commerçante, vendeuse de légumes et de condiments au Mali, âgée de 46 ans, mariée, mère de 3 enfants dont 2 sont à l’école. son mari est un cultivateur et habite dans la même localité. Elle n’a pas  été scolarisée  mais elle dispose un endroit pour la vente  des légumes et  des condiments. Elle pratique cette activité il y’ a 13 ans de celà. Pour vendre assez de légumes et condiments  elle fait recourt  au RMCR pour prendre de l’argent, elle s’approvisionne au marché public et revend dans le même marché publique. Avec le bénéfice gagné elle  contribuera  pour le bien-être de ses enfants, elle ambitionne construire une boutique de légumes et condiments en dure afin que les denrées puis être accessible en tout moment. 
Bintou est la dame au bout à droit et la main levée sur la photo
texts.en: Bintou is a trader, she sells vegetables and condiments in Mali, and is 46 years old. She is married and the mother of 3 children, 2 of whom attend school. Her husband is a farmer and they live together. She didn't attend school but has a place for selling vegetables and condiments. She has had this business for the past 13 years. To sell enough vegetables and condiments, she comes to RMCR for financing. She purchases and sells her stock in the same public market. With the profits she will earn she will contribute to the well-being of her family, and would like to construct a vegetable and condiment store in order to be able to serve customers all the time. Bintou is the woman standing with her hand raised in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and condiments to sell

loans.name: Sebeke Group

texts.fr: Djeneba est une vendeuse de  boisson  sucrerie   âgé de 36 ans, mariée, mère de six (6)  enfants dont trois sont scolarisés. Son mari  est  cultivateur, ils habitent dans la même localité au Mali. Elle quitta l’école  en classe de 6eme année  et elle pratique cette vente de boisson  il y a 2 ans de cela. Pour acheter beaucoup de sachets de boisson  elle fait recours  au RMCR pour prendre un prêt et le bénéfice généré par ce prêt vont lui permettre de construire une boutique en dure pour éviter les sointes de la pluie pendant l’hivernage  .Elle s’approvisionne en boisson dans  un lieu de dépôt de boisson de la localité et vend dans son village. Djeneba est la dame qui a les saches de boisson en main  sur la photo.
texts.en: Djeneba sells soft drinks and is 36 years old, married, and the mother of six (6) children, three of whom attend school. Her husband is a farmer, and they live together in Mali. She left school after 6 years, and started selling drinks 2 years ago. To purchase lots of drink mixes, she came to RMCR to take a loan. The profits generated from this loan will allow her to construct a permanent store to avoid the rains during the rainy season. She purchases beverages at a wholesale store in her area and sells in her village. Djenaba is the woman with the drinks in her hand in the photo.

loans.use: to buy drinks to resell

loans.name: Gnongondeme Group

texts.fr: Mohamed est malien,  âgé de  35 ans, père de jumeaux de 2 ans .Mohamed n’a pas été à l’école, il exerce la fonction commerçante  détaillant depuis plus de 5 ans .Mohamed est propriétaire d’une boutique de produit s de première nécessité a savoir le sucre ,le lait, les savons ,les thé, le riz etc. Avec le prêt RMCR Mohamed achète beaucoup de produits  (lait ; l’huile, sucre, farine etc) sur le marché local avec les grossistes et le revend en détail à la population du quartier. Avec le prêt, la boutique est renforcée et il n’y a plus de rupture de stock. Le bénéfice tiré de l’activité permet à Mohamed de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille (épouse et ses jumeaux) au village. Mohamed est l’homme avec un sac en main sur la photo.
texts.en: Mohamed is Malian, 35 years old and the father of 2-year-old twins. Mohamed didn't go to school, and has been retailing consumer goods for 5 years. Mohamed is the proprietor of a store that sells necessary goods such as sugar, soaps, teas, rice and more. With the loan from RMCR he is buying lots of products (milk, oil, sugar, flour, etc) in the local market from the wholesalers, that he sells retail to the people in his neighborhood. With the loan, the store is stocked and he doesn't have any more out-of-stock issues. The profits he makes from the business will allow Mohamed to meet his and his family's needs (his wife and twins) in the village. Mohamed is the man with the bag in his hand in the photo.

loans.use: to buy rice, soaps, milk, oil, sugar and flour to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in wheat flour, butter, sugar, salt, yeast, etc.

loans.name: Primera Vez Group

texts.es: Al grupo solidario Primera Vez lo integran tres mujeres emprendedoras, está coordinado por la señora Juana una mujer laboriosa de 44 años de edad, acompañada, se dedica a la compra-venta de cosechas comercializándolas en el mercado de la municipalidad, el crédito actual lo solicita para la compra de cosecha de tamarindo ya que este es uno de los productos que mayor demanda tiene y de esta manera espera seguir mejorando sus ingresos. El resto de los integrantes son las señoras, Mercedes que tiene la edad de 34 años y comercializa ropa nueva en su comunidad desde hace seis años, y María del Socorro de 45 años se dedica a la compra-venta de cosechas y las comercializa en el mercado de la municipalidad desde hace veinte años.
texts.en: The communal bank First Time is made up of three enterprising women, and is coordinated by Juana, a hard-working, 44-year-old woman, who lives with her partner. She works buying and selling fruits and vegetables at the municipal market. She is requesting the loan to buy tamarind, as it is one of the products that is in highest demand, and in this way hopes to increase her income. The other member of the group are Mercedes, aged 34, who has been selling new clothing in her region for six years, and Maria del Socorro, who is 45 years old and has been buying and selling fruits and vegetables at the municipal market for the past twenty years.

loans.use: to buy tamarind harvest

loans.name: Las Canelitas De La I Group

texts.es: Esta es la Nueva Alcancía “Las Canelitas De La I” La cual  está constituida por 05 socias emprendedoras con muchos deseos de comenzar a desarrollarse en su negocio. Paulina de 54 años de edad es casada y tiene 04 hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica  a la venta de canelas y oréganos. Hace más de 03 años que viene desempeñándose en dicho negocio el cual le va bien.  Su mayor deseo es continuar creciendo en su negocio ampliando su local de venta. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de canelas y oréganos. La Nueva Alcancía “Las Canelitas De La I” agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por facilitarles este crédito. Paulina es la segunda del lado  derecho y viste polo floreado.
texts.en:
This is the new communal bank “Las Canelitas De La I” which is made up of 5 entrepreneurial members who are eager to start developing their businesses. 

Paulina, 54, is married and has 4 dependent children. She makes a living by selling cinnamon and oregano. Paulina has been working in this business for more than 3 years and it is doing well. Her biggest wish is to keep growing her business by expanding her retail premises. She is requesting a loan in order to buy cinnamon and oregano. 

The new communal bank “Las Canelitas De La I” are grateful to Kiva lenders for providing them with this loan. Paulina is pictured second from the right and wears a flowery top.

loans.use: to buy cinnamon and oregano.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
FAKOUMA est une éleveuse Malienne  âgé de 38ans . Mariée et mère de 7 enfants,  âgés respectivement de 1 à 13ans dont 5 vont à l’école. Son mari est cultivateur, depuis 3 ans  elle exerce cette activité d’élevage des moutons. Ayant abandonné l’école en 6e année fondamentale ; elle emprunte au RMCR pour pouvoir acheter beaucoup de moutons pour élever en vue de les revendre. Son approvisionnement se   fait dans les marchés locaux. Elle  vend ses moutons en détail dans les marchés  environnant. Le bénéfice qu’elle tire de cette activité lui permet de couvrir les dépenses de ses enfants (éducation ; soins et leur habillement).
Fakouma est la dame au milieu et tient le mouton en main sur la photo.
texts.en: Fakouma is a Malian livestock-raiser who is 38 years old. She is married and the mother of 7 children ranging in age from 1 to 13 years old, 5 of whom attend school. Her husband is a farmer. For the past 3 years, she has had a sheep-raising business. Since she left school in the 6th year of primary school, she borrows from RMCR in order to be able to purchase lots of sheep to raise and resell. She purchases sheep at the local markets. She resells sheep in surrounding markets. The profits generated by this activity allow her to cover her children's expenses (education, medical and clothing costs). Fakouma is the woman in the middle holding the ewe in her hand in the photo.

loans.use: to buy sheep to resell

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr: Bouhé est un malien de 36 ans marié, père de 3 enfants , âgés de 3 à 7 ans dont le plus âgé et son second vont respectivement  à l’école et a la maternelle. Bouhé est commerçant d’hydrocarbures ( essence) et dérivés depuis plus de dix ans. N’ayant pas été à l’école, avec le prêt RMCR; Bouhé achète plus de carburant   et d’huile moteur à Bamako qu’il revend en gros et en détail sur le marché local. Les bénéfices tirés de l’activité lui permet de prendre en charge les dépenses de la famille tel que : les frais sanitaires, les frais de scolarisation des enfants etc.Bouhé est l’homme qui tient le bidon en main sur la photo.
texts.en: Bouhé is a Malian man who is married and the father of 3 children whose ages range from 3 to 7 years old. The oldest and second-oldest are in school and in day care, respectively. Bouhé sells fuels (gas) and similar products for the past 10 years. Not having attended school, with his loan from RMCR Bouhé is buying more gas and motor oil in Bamako that he resells wholesale and retail in local markets. The profits from this business allow him to take care of his family's expenses such as sanitary and schooling costs. Bouhé is the man holding the bottle in his hand in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase gas and oil to resell

loans.name: Sinignesigui Group

texts.fr:
Bougou est un Malien,  éleveur des moutons, analphabète âgé de 59 ans marié  sa femme est une ménagère  et père de 4 enfants de 15 à 22 ans tous scolarisés. Il exerce  l’élevage des moutons depuis 5 ans. Il souhaite de devenir un grand éleveur dans l’avenir.
Il fait recourt  à IMF pour acheter  beaucoup de moutons pour revendre. Il s’approvisionne sur le marché local et  revendre  ses moutons dans le même marché, les bénéfices qu’il réalise lui permet de financer les frais scolaire de ses  enfants et autres besoins familiaux.
Il est souvent confronté à un problème de baisse du prix de vente de ses animaux sur le marché au moment de la vente.
Bougou est l’homme qui a touché le bélier avec les 2 mains sur la photo.
texts.en:
Bougou is Malian, and he raises sheep. He is unable to read, and is 59 years old. His wife is a housewife and they have 4 children from 15 to 22 years old, all of whom attended school. He has been raising sheep for the past 5 years. He would like to become a large-scale sheep-raiser in the future.
He came to this microfinance institution in order to purchase lots of sheep to resell. He purchases sheep at the local market and sells them in the same market. The profits he makes allow him to finance his childrens' schooling and his other family needs. 
He frequently deals with low prices for his animals during the time when he sells. Bougou is the man touching the ram with both his hands in the photo

loans.use: to buy sheep to resell

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Gouanse est une Malienne âgée de 40 ans,  mariée, mère de 6 enfants âgés de 2 à15 ans. Son mari est un cultivateur âgé de 50 ans, ses 2 enfants fréquentent l’école fondamentale la  2è et  la 5è année respective. Gouanse est une commerçante de chaussures, assiette,  elle  effectue des achats et  vente depuis 15ans.Pour bien préparer l’avenir de ses enfants, elle fait recourt au RMCR pour acheter beaucoup de chaussures et assiettes . Elle s’approvisionne  des chaussures, assiettes et beaucoup d’autre matériel pour la cuisine; en zone urbain et  elle revend en  espèce et à crédit court terme, elle se promène dans les villages environnant et les marchés locaux de la zone pour sa vente. Après le remboursement ce qu’elle gagne comme bénéfice lui permet de prendre  certaines charges familiales telles que la scolarisation des enfants, soins, nourriture.
Gouanse est la femme qui a levé sa main `a côté de l’homme par derrière  sur la photo.
texts.en: Gouanse is a Malian woman who is 40 years old, married, and the mother of 6 children aged 2 to 15 years old. Her husband is a farmer who is 50 years old. 2 of her children attended school and are in 2nd and are in their 5th years of schooling. Gouanse sells shoes and plates and has been buying and selling goods for the past 15 years. In order to work for her children's future, she has come to RMCR for funding to purchase lots of shoes and plates. She purchases shoes, plates and other goods for cooking in the vcity and sells them retail and on short-term credit. She visits outlying villages and local markets in her area to resell. After repayment, what she makes as profit will allow her to take care of some family expenses such as school fees, healthcare and food. Gouanse is the woman with her hand raised standing next to the man in back in the photo.

loans.use: to buy shoes and plates to resell

loans.name: Rosas De Tilata I Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROSAS DE TILATA I” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Julia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de slachipapa, venta de chompas, venta de mantas, venta de pescado, tienda de barrio, venta de polleras, venta de comida. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Julia es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio al observar la carencia de este negocio en su zona y en conversación con su esposo deciden invertir un dinero en la implementación de este negocio. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de conservas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo venderá en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “ROSAS DE TILATA I” communal bank group will begin its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Cascada. It is made up of eight members and is led by a board of which Julia is the president. The businesses that the communal bank group members carry out are varied and include salchipapa [a french fry and sausage dish] sales, sweater sales, blanket sales, fish sales, a neighborhood store, pollera [traditional Andean skirt] sales, and food sales. 

The loan that they are taking out will benefit the small business-owners, of whom Julia is one. She says that a year ago, she joined Pro Mujer, joining at the invitation of a promoter from the institution who went to visit her at her house. Currently she has a neighborhood store. She mentions that she began this business when she noticed the lack of this business in her zone and in talking with her husband, they decided to invest some money in undertaking this business.

The loan that she is getting now is to increase her capital (purchase canned goods in bulk) that she will get from the wholesalers in the city of El Alto and later will sell in her retail space. This type of work allows her to generate income to support her family economically, since she is married and has three children.   

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health center and the training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy canned food in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy condiments.

loans.name: Emma Elizabeth

texts.es:
Emma, de 23 años de edad, es comerciante, realizó sus estudios hasta séptimo grado, está acompañada y su pareja se dedica a la albañilería, tiene un hijo de un año. 

Emma, se dedica a la venta de carne de res, ella tiene su propio destazadero, ella destaza tres veces a la semana.

Emma, solicita el crédito para comprar cerdos, para crecerlos y luego venderlos.- Tambien, necesita comprar reces para destazo.
 
El Sueño de Emma, es ser muy reconocida en su comunidad, para que más personas compren sus enbutidos y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos, para poder darle a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida y una mejor educación.
texts.en: Emma is a 23-year-old trader who studied up to seventh grade. She lives with her partner, who works as a builder, and they have a one-year-old son together. Emma works selling beef, and has her own slaughterhouse where she butchers cows three times a week. Emma is requesting a loan to buy pigs to fatten and sell. She also needs to buy cows to butcher. Emma's dream is to be well-known in her area so that more people buy her sausages and she can increase her income and give her son a better quality of life and a better education.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Ysabel

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco ILLARY III,la socia sigue dedicándose a  su negocio de compra y venta de carteras, pantalones, blusas y chompas, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia vende a sus clientes que le solicitan como amistades,familaires entre otros, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
 La socia solicita el crédito para comprar carteras entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: Ysabel is a member of the ILLARY III village bank. She continues with her business buying and selling purses, pants, blouses and sweaters. She is responsible and diligent, She sells to her clients, among them friends and family, being this way how she helps her family get ahead. She is requesting a loan to purchase purses, among other items. This member is grateful for the loan and is committed to making her payments as scheduled.

loans.use: To buy purses, among other items.

loans.name: Yoni

texts.es:
La socia Yoni se sigue dedicando al negocio de crianza de animales, la socia cria cuyes y gallinas, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere poner su tienda de abarrotes ya que es su sueño tener su propio negocio, la socia también quiere tener un lugar más amplio para que pueda vender sus animales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas y también alimentos para los animales.

La socia solicita el credito para la compra de gallinas para su negocio.
texts.en:
Yoni continues with her animal sales business.  She raises guinea pigs and hens, and by way of her business wants to establish a grocery store, which is her goal.  She also wants to expand the area where she keeps her animals so she can sell more.

The loan she is requesting is to buy guinea pigs and hens, as well as animal feed.

loans.use: To buy guinea pigs and hens, as well as animal feed.

loans.name: Maria De La Flor Doris

texts.es:
Maria de la Flor Doris tiene 41 años de edad, es madre soltera, con un hijo a su cargo, vive en casa familiar en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Maria de la Flor Doris se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral como patos, chivos, conejos, entre otros, desde hace 08 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio. Ella solicita préstamo para capital de trabajo; pues desea comprar cerdos, cuyes, patos, gallinas, para poder aumentar y diversificar su stock de animales, el préstamo le ayudará para tener una mayor inversión, esto con la finalidad de incrementar su negocio de los mismos y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria de la Flor Doris is 41 years old. She is a single mother with a dependent child. She lives in a family home in the rural area of the district of Oyotún in the province of Chiclayo in the region of  Lambayeque on the northern coast of Peru. Her community is dedicated primarily to agriculture, livestock, and trade.

Maria de la Flor Doris earns her living breeding and selling farmyard animals such as ducks, goats, rabbits, and others. She began this business 8 years ago in her home. She requested a loan for working capital because she wants to buy pigs, guinea pigs, ducks, and hens to increase and diversify her herds of animals. The loan will help her make a bigger investment in order to increase her business, satisfy the needs of her customers, and improve her short term revenue, increase profits, and improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to diversify her herds of animals by buying pigs, guinea pigs, ducks, and hens

loans.name: Chimere

texts.en:
Chimere is a married man with five children, all of whom attend school. He lives at his own house, that has neither electricity nor piped water.

He has operated a business of selling palm leaves used for construction purposes for the past one year in addition he has a shop in the village where he sells house hold consumables like wheat flour, maize flour and sugar

With the loan of 50,000 KES that he is requesting, he wants to purchase a stock palm leaves for sale to enable him get money to support his family as he is the bread winner  He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock palm leaves for sale

loans.name: Leli Salomon

texts.es:
Leli, de 48 años de edad, es agricultor, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, debido a que sus padres no tuvieron las condiciones económicas para mandarlo a estudiar, está soltero y solo vive con su madre quien ya no puede trabajar.

Leli, se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos, pero el año pasado las cosechas no dieron buenos resultados, no hubo utilidad, sino perdidas.- Ahora, tiene dos vacas lecheras, él vende la leche a un comprador que pasa por la zona, pero necesita aumentar el número de vacas, para poder aumentar la producción de leche, como también sus ingresos.

El dinero del préstamo será para comprar una vaca lechera más, ya que necesita aumentar la producción de leche, cada vaca tiene un valor de $800 pero Leli, tiene $300 de la venta de la cosecha.

Leli, tiene planeado hacer un corral y tener su ganado más seguro, ya que por el momento las deja amarradas cerca de su casa, pero su mayor sueño es que su madre goce de buena salud.
texts.en:
Leli is 48 years old, and he is a farmer. He didn’t have the opportunity to study because his parents didn’t have the financial resources to send him to school. He is single and lives only with his mother, who can no longer work.

Leli is dedicated to growing basic grains, but in the last year, the harvests did not have good results. They were not useful, and he faced losses. Now, he has two dairy cows. He sells the milk to a buyer who passes through the area. However, he needs to increase his number of cows, so that he can increase the milk production and his income. 

The money from the loan will be used to buy one more dairy cow, since he needs to increase his milk production. Each cow has a value of $800, but Leli has $300 from selling his harvest.

Leli has planned to have a corral, which will keep his cattle safer; at the moment, he leaves them tied near his house. His biggest dream is that his mother enjoys good health.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Adjo Celine

texts.fr: Céline, âgée de 52 est une femme divorcée et mère de trois enfants vivant à Lomé au quartier Akodessewa. Céline est vendeuse de pate fermentée et  emballée généralement appelée « KOM » à Akodessewa. Elle achète le mais  et des poissons au marché d’akodessewa une fois par mois. Céline désire ce prêt pour acheter du mais et des poissons afin de satisfaire sa clientèle qui ne cesse de croître ;ce qui pourra lui permettre de gagner plus de bénéfices et de mieux épargner pour faire face à d’éventuels besoins
texts.en: Céline is a 52-year old divorced woman, a mother to three children and living in Lomé, in the Akodessewa area. Céline sells wrapped cornmeal, generally called "Kom" in Akodessewa. She buys the corn and some fish at the Akodessewa market once a month. Céline wants this loan to buy corn and fish in order to satisfy her growing clientele, which will allow her to earn more profit and to save up more to cope with potential needs.

loans.use: to buy 1 sack of corn and 6 kg of fish.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel, de 43 años de edad, trabaja como agricultor desde muy joven, estudió hasta educación básica, actualmente tiene tres hijos, los cuales están estudiando educación básica, está casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y en algunas ocasiones ayuda a su esposo en los trabajos agrícolas.

Miguel, trabaja en la agricultura, tiene alrededor de veinte años de dedicarse a este trabajo, pero hace cuatro años, decidió dedicarse también, a la crianza de aves de corral, esta actividad la aprendió cuanto estuvo trabajando en una empresa avícola, por esa razón decidió poner este negocio en su casa .

Él, ha trabajado con su propio capital, pero ahora no es suficiente para lo que necesita en el corral.

Miguel, necesita el crédito para comprar tela de gallinero, cemento y alimento para las aves.

Sus proyecciones a futuro son, mejorar su negocio y tener una mayor producción de pollos, para poder comercializar en el mercado.
texts.en:
Miguel, 43 years old, has worked as a farmer since he was young. He studied up until elementary school. He currently has three children, who are studying in elementary school. He is married, and his wife works as a homemaker, and on some occasions, helps her husband with the agricultural work.

Miguel, works in farming. He has made a living in this work for around 20 years, but four years ago, he decided to also raise poultry. He learned this trade when he was working for a poultry company. For this reason, he decided to start this business in his house.  

He has worked with his own capital, but now it is not sufficient for what he needs in the corral. Miguel needs the loan to buy chicken wire, cement, and chicken feed. His future projections are, to improve his business and to have a increased production of chicken, to be able sell in the market.

loans.use: to buy chicken wire, cement, and bird feed.

loans.name: Maria Juana

texts.es:
Juana, de 49 años de edad, está acompañada y junto a su pareja, vender mariscos en los lugares aledaños a su comunidad, tienen 3 hijos a quienes aman muchísimo.

Hoy en día Juana, decidió invertir en su negocio, ha solicitado un crédito para comprar camarones y langostas para vender, los cuales son muy solicitados por sus clientes. 

Ademas de tener esa venta de mariscos Juana, también vende tortillas por las tardes en su casa de habitación.

Ella todos los días se levanta muy temprano, para emprender sus labores, las cuales le permiten ingresos muy buenos para su hogar.

A futuro sueña con ver a sus hijos graduados de la carrera que elijan.
texts.en: Juana is 49 years old and works with her life partner selling seafood in the local area. They have three children whom they love dearly. Juana took the decision to invest in her business and is requesting a loan to buy shrimp and lobsters to sell, as these are very popular with her customers. As well as selling seafood, Juana also sells tortillas in the afternoons from home. She wakes up early every day to start working and this helps her to generate a good household income. In the future, she dreams of seeing her children graduate in their chosen vocation.

loans.use: to buy shrimp and lobster to sell.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en: Dolores is 44 years old and pays rent. She is the mother of 2 daughters; one of her daughters is going to college, and the other will graduate soon.  Dolores sells refreshments at a bus stop. She needs a loan to buy supplies so she can start selling food that she will cook. She wants to help her daughters and is ready to work harder. She hopes you can help her. Dolores will sell food and refreshments in the same location

loans.use: to buy supplies so she can start selling food that she will cook

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy clothes.

loans.name: Mujeres Valientes Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Valientes se encuentra en el tercer ciclo del programa de comités. El grupo se formo en la ciudad de Santaní, con la unión de varias vecinas y amigas.
La Sra. Herminia, integrante de este comité, es una de las miembros más activas, se dedica a la venta de comidas en su propia casa, cuenta con muchos clientes debido a su buena atención y preparación higiénica de sus alimentos. Comenta que con esfuerzo y sacrificio ha ido creciendo y está mejorando cada vez más.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para poder invertirlo en la compra de verduras, condimentos, hortalizas carne, pollo y demás, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Valientes (Valiant Women) group is now in their third loan cycle. This group meets in the city of Santaní and is made up of various neighbours and friends.

Herminia is one of the most active members of this group. She sells meals in her own home and has many customers thanks to her great customer service and hygienic preparation of her meals. She tells us that through effort and sacrifice her business has been growing and is improving more and more. 

Herminia is applying for a loan to purchase ingredients such as vegetables, condiments, leafy greens, meat, chicken and other items so that she can continue making sales. She is grateful for this opportunity which will be of great help to her.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, condiments, leafy greens, meat, chicken and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, brick, iron, etc. to repaid the bathroom and to cement the floor in the hallway of her home.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is aged 24 years, single, and lives himself. Since his parents are old, he is taking the responsibility to support them, together with his young sister and brother who are still at school. 

To be able to manage all (his life and family support), he started a business of jewelry in small room, where he sells necklaces, rings and purify gold and other similar items.  Previous, his room was rough and not attractive, but after the support of several Kiva loans, he has made a great upgrade to his office. He bought more stock of selling items, installed an aluminum door, shades and painted the room.  Not only that, he bought a motorcycle and added amount to buy a tricycle for a transportation business. He is really working hard, dreaming to be successful in his businesses. He has been in these businesses for two years now, working from 08am to 07pm per working day, and is able to make a good return.

Fredrick is now requesting his fifth credit from Tujijenge Tanzania. He has paid back his previous loans successfully, which he used to upgrade his business. He earned some extra income which he used to support his parents, and young sister and brother, together with his life.  

With his new credit request, he will use to open another branch of jewelry so as to grow his income. He will be accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to open another branch of jewelry so as to grow his income.

loans.name: Ani Roxana

texts.es:
La socia Ani Roxana se sigue dedicando al negocio de crianza de animales, la socia cria pollos y gallinas, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere poner su tienda de abarrotes ya que es su sueño tener su propio negocio, la socia también quiere tener un lugar más amplio para que pueda vender sus animales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar pollos y gallinas y también alimentos para los animales.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Ani Roxana continues working in the business of raising animals. She raises hens and chicks and through this work wants to establish her grocery store since it is her dream to have her own business. She also wants to have a larger space where she can sell her animals. She asks for the loan to purchase hens and chicks and also feed for the animals. 

She is happy for the loan and promises to make the payments.

loans.use: to purchase hens and chicks and also feed for the animals.

loans.name: El Gran Progreso Group

texts.es:
La socia Yesica pertenece al banco comunal EL GRAN PROGRESO, él banco  esta ubicad en el distrito de Santa Ana, provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Yesica tiene 34 años de edad tiene 02 hijos y es soltera, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la agricultura, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día su negocio, la socia cultiva lo que son frutas como plátanos, naranjas entre otros, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas y abono.

La socia Yesica se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.

Los demás socios se dedican a la agricultura, crianza de animales menores, tienda de abarrotes, restaurante.

Los socios que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
Yesica belongs to the communal bank El Gran Progreso. The bank is located in the district of Santa Ana, the province of La Convencion and the department of Cusco.

The member is 34 years old, has two children, and is single. She alternates her daily activities, making a living in agriculture. She spends a lot of time in her business, which has been going well thanks to the determination she puts into her business every day. She cultivates fruits such as plantains, oranges, and others. The member wants to be able to continue this work in order to continue supporting her family.

This member is asking for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. She is grateful for the given loan and promises to fulfill her scheduled bills. 

The other members make their livings in agriculture, raising small animals, grocery stores, and restaurants. The members who appear in the added photo asked permission to arrive late to the meeting, due to work.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Los Puntualitos Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal LOS PUNTUALITOS, el banco está ubicado en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Rosmery continua con el negocio de restaurante, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia continua elaborando diversos platos como saltados, sopas, arroz con pollo entre otros para sus clientes que le solicitan cada dia, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz, aceite, menestras entre otros.
Los demás socios se dedican a la venta de tienda de abarrotes, transporte, librería, ropa.
texts.en:
Rosmery belongs to the Los Puntualitos communal bank, which is located in the province and department of Cusco. She still has her restaurant business. She feels grateful for the loan granted and promises to make her established payments. She is still making a variety of plates like stir fry, soups, and chicken with rice for her customers who ask for her each day. She is a responsible and determined person; this is how she is able to get her family ahead. She is asking for the loan to buy rice, oil, and beans, among other items.

The other members make a living in sales, in a grocery store, transportation, a bookstore, and selling clothing.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, and beans, among other items.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married and has four school-going children. She own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Fatuma has operated a business selling paraffin for use in cooking at retail to her neighbors. She faces the challenge of delayed payments, hence low profits in her business.

With the loan of 20,000 KES that she is requesting, she wants to establish a rental house and purchase cement, iron sheets, nails and timber. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cement, iron sheets, nails and timber to build a rental house

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
María, de 40 años de edad, tiene 25 años de habitar en su comunidad, está casada y tiene cuatro hijos, de los cuales tres de ellos viven en el extranjero y su esposo se dedica a la ganadería.

María, trabaja la agricultura, ella se dedica a esta actividad ya que su esposo le enseño y tiempo después no había nadie quien trabajara, fue por esa razón que ella decidió tomar las riendas de dicha actividad. 

El dinero lo utilizara para comprar postes de madera y alambres para cerca el terreno donde tiene sus cultivos, ya que últimamente han tenido problemas con el ganado, porque le han ocasionado daños en su cosecha.

El sueño que María es, ver crecer a sus hijos con buenas condiciones de vida y que puedan estudiar y logren sus metas.
texts.en:
María, age 40, has lived in her community for 25 years.  She is married and has four children.  Three of them live abroad, and her husband works with livestock.

María works in agriculture with her two children.  She works in this business activity because her husband taught it to her.  After that, there was not anyone to do the work, and that is why she decided to take the reins of this business activity.

She will use the loan to buy wooden posts and wire to fence the land where she has her crops.  Lately they have had problems with the livestock, and they have caused damage to her crop.

María’s dream is to see her children grow with good living conditions and that they are able to go to school and achieve their goals.

loans.use: to buy wooden posts and wire to fence the land where she has her crops.

loans.name: Julia Feliza

texts.es:
Julia es una mujer que lucha cada dia para generar sus ingresos, ella es casada tiene  44 años  vive con   su único hijo de 23 años y su esposo, ella vive en una comunidad de Solola. 

Julia es una persona que le gusta prosperar en la vida, pues ella desde hace diez años decidió poner una tienda de abarrotes en su casa, con ese ingreso  ella complementa los gastos que generan en su familia,  pues ahora además de abarrotes vende también medicina,  ya que en la comunidad donde ella vive existen pocas farmacias y quedan lejos de ese comunidad.  
Julia es una mujer que le encanta trabajar  y todo lo que emprende  le trae buenos resultados ella también para generar más ingresos cuenta con un molino de nixtamal.  Estos trabajos lo entretienen a Julia  y además le generan ingresos. Pues ahora Julia quiere agrandar la tienda equipándolo con más abarrotes y comprar más medicinas para acaparar más clientes, es muy visitada por que los dos negocios están en el mismo lugar, pues Julia solicita un prestamo para lograr su objetivo y transformar su negocio, ya que el sueño de Julia es seguir con esta actividad y verlo cada día más equipada.
texts.en:
Julia, 44, is a woman who strives every day to earn her income.  She's married and lives with her only daughter, 23, and her husband in a community in Sololá.

Julia likes to prosper in life.  Twenty years ago she decided to set up a grocery store in her house.  She helps with the family expenses with that income.  She sells medicine as well as groceries, because there are few pharmacies where she lives and they're far away.  She also has a nixtamal mill to earn more income.

Julia loves to work, and everything she undertakes brings her good results.  These jobs keep her busy and generate income for her.

Now Julia wants to expand her store, supplying it with more groceries and buying more medicine to attract more customers.  She has a lot of customers because the two businesses are in the same place.

Julia's requesting a loan to achieve her goal and transform her business.  Her dream is to continue with this business and have it better outfitted every day.

loans.use: to buy groceries and medicine

loans.name: Oscar Rolando

texts.es:
Rolando, de 28 años de edad, estudio hasta primer año de bachillerato, es empleado, está acompañado, tiene una niña de 2 años de edad y viven en casa con sus padre. 

Rolando, trabaja en un hotel y tiene 13 años de estar trabajando ahí, su puesto es de mesero y del ingreso que recibe, ha logrado cubrir los gastos familiares y ha logrado poner una tiendita  en la casa.

A parte de la tienda, tiene un molino donde su compañera de vida se encarga de atender a sus clientes. 

Rolando, solicita el crédito para comprar fajas nuevas y repuestos para el molino, para que siga generando ingreso.

El Sueño de Rolando, es poder arreglar su vivienda, ya que necesita algunas reparaciones y ampliarla más.
texts.en:
Rolando, 28, studied until the first year of high school. He is employed, married, and as a 2-year-old daughter who lives at home with her parents. 

Rolando works in a hotel. He has worked there for 13 years as a waiter and receives an income. He has managed to cover family expenses and put a little shop in his house. A part of the store has a grain mill where his wife is responsible for serving customers. 

Rolando is requesting a loan to buy new belts and parts for the grain mill to continue generating income. Rolando’s dream is to be able to fix his home because it needs some repairs. He also wants to expand it.

loans.use: to purchase new belts and parts for his wife's grain mill

loans.name: Rios Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Rios está haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, que les permitirá a todas conocer la situación de vida que tienen y conforme a ello poder trabajar e ir superando la situación de pobreza que tienen.
La Sra. Rosalia, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel dos, es decir, un nivel medio de ingresos,  ella lucha por poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida, ya que de esa forma podrá dar lo mejor a su familia. 
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas variadas, ya que ella vende ropas, y quiere poder seguir con sus ventas.  Agradece por la oportunidad que todas reciben de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The group, called Rios, is completing the Elimination of Poverty Survey, allowing them to all know their situation in life and to work accordingly to overcome their poverty. 

Rosalia, who in her latest survey indicated a level of poverty of two, i.e., an average level of income, strives to improve her living conditions, since that way she can give the best to her family.

She asks for this loan to enable her to invest in the purchase of various garments, since she sells clothes, and wants to be able to continue with her sales. She is grateful for the opportunity, that they all have received, to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy clothes to put up for sale

loans.name: Gilmar

texts.es:
El socio Gilmar se sigue dedicando al negocio de agencia de viajes, el socio por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, el socio es una hombre emprendedor y luchador, el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de agencia de viajes.El socio solicita el crédito para comprar un escritorio para su agencia de viajes.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Our member continues to work in the travel agency business.  By working in this line of business, the member would like to get ahead. The member is an entrepreneur and a hard worker. His dream is to expand the travel agency. He is requesting the loan to buy a desk for the travel agency. He is happy for the loan and he is committed to make his payments.

loans.use: to buy a desk for his travel agency

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Dairy farming is something that is more of a passion for Sarah than a business. She started pursuing her passion in the year 2000. She is a hardworking and honest farmer who is based in Magena, a remote village in the Kenyenya area of Kenya. For the past six years, she has been making a small living through practicing mixed farming. Her primary source of income has been selling milk and eggs to the nearby market. She also engages in a personal business or “side hustle” as she likes to call it, to earn additional income. Sarah passionately loves dairy farming, but the biggest challenge she has been facing is accessing funds to increase her business. Through Juhudi Kilimo, an organization that supports enterprising farmers, she acquired her first loan, which she used to buy an additional cow. She paid the loan back fully. She also benefited from training and the impact of the first loan cannot be underestimated. Sarah is seeking another loan from Juhudi Kilimo, via Kiva lenders, to buy a quality breed of dairy cow. The cow she plans to buy is not just an ordinary cow, but a quality breed of cow that will be producing between 15-20 liters of milk a day. A liter of milk costs 50 KES; this means she will be making 11 USD a day. From this loan, the life of Sarah will permanently change and she will be able to secure the future of her school-going children. She will also assure her aging parents of a secure future. Sarah waits for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Grupo Las Hermanas Group

texts.es:
Antonia(es la que aparece al lado derecho de la foto blusa morada)  es madre de familia  de 25 años de edad, tiene una hija de 4 años,  y viven en una comunidad llamada Xejuyup. 
Antonio es una mujer que se dedica a su trabajo, para prosperar con su familia,  a pesar de que ella solo tiene una hija, no es motivo de perder el tiempo, a Antonia su mamá le enseño buenos principios que para prosperar en la vida hay que trabajar para generar ingresos, pues con esa mentalidad Antonia desde hace dos años se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa típica tales como: güipiles y cortes de difentes diseños , ella eligió esta actividad porque en la comunidad donde vive llegan compradores de lugares aledaños que utilizan estos trajes. Ella es vendedora  de piso plaza no cuenta con un local formal. 
Antonia quiere agrandar su negocio pero con las ganancias no es suficiente esta nueva inversión entonces para poder lograr esta meta ella decidió mejor buscar un prestamo para completar el capital ella  lo utilizaría para comprar más mercadería de ropa típica.
Los sueños de Antonia con la ampliación del negocio es generar más ganancias, para que más adelante pueda alquilar un local para que su venta sea más formal y que se mantenga para la prosperidad de Antonia y su familia.
texts.en:
Antonia (the one in a purple blouse on the right side of the photo) is a 25 year old mother who has a 4 year old daughter and lives in a community called Xejuyup. Antonia is a woman who dedicates herself to work, to prosper with her family; although she only has one daughter, there is no reason to waste time. Antonia's mother taught her good values: that to thrive in life one must work to generate income. 

With that mentality, Antonia has worked for two years buying and selling traditional clothing, such as blouses and woven cloth of different designs. 
She chose this activity because at the community where she lives, many buyers who use these garments, arrive from surrounding areas.
She sells on the plaza floor, since she does not have a formal shop. Antonia wants to increase her business, but her profits are not enough for this new investment; to achieve her goal, she decided to seek a loan to supplement the capital she will use to buy more traditional clothing merchandise.

Antonia's dream with the expansion of her business, is to generate more profit so that later on she can rent a shop, which will make her sales more formal and continue on for the prosperity of Antonia and her family.

loans.use: buy traditional clothing

loans.name: Erlis Esmeralda

texts.es:
Erlis, estudio hasta noveno grado, está acompañada y su pareja trabaja como empleado de seguridad, tiene un hijo que vive con ella y está estudiando. 

Erlis, trabaja con ganado de repasto, lo ha hecho por más de 4 años y lo aprendió de su padre, decidio hacerlo por motivación de su mamá y buscar un ingreso extra, anteriormente, solo se dedicaba a los oficios del hogar; la distancia que camina para llegar a lugar donde tiene su ganado, está a 1 kilómetro, le apoya su padre y compañero de vida.

Erlis, necesita el crédito para comprar ganado de doble proposito, esto le permitirá obtener mayores ganancias y mejorar su vida. 

Sus sueños son, poder seguir trabajando y ofrecerle un mejor futuro a su hijo.
texts.en:
Erlis studied until 9th grade. She lives with her partner who works in security. She has a son that lives with her, and is studying.

Erlis works with beef cattle, and has done so for 4 years. She learned from her father. She decided to do it for extra income because of her mother. Previously, she had only worked as a homemaker. She walks 1 kilometer to get to the place where she keeps her cattle, to support her father and her life partner.

Erlis needs a loan to buy dual purpose cattle. This will help her to obtain greater earnings and to improve her life. Her dreams are to be able to continue working and to offer a better future for her son.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Bivamuntuyo Group

texts.en:
Godfrey is a group member of Bivamuntunyo group. He is a 53-year-old married man with 4 children, aged 16, 14, 12, and 7. He also looks after 4 dependents, providing for all their needs such as clothing and food.

Godfrey is a tailor at a busy street, where he also operates a retail shop. This business, which he has been in for the last 20 years, helps to support his family, and supplements his income.

Godfrey has a long-term plan to expand his business. He has applied for this loan to purchase stock of sugar, cornflour, beans, rice, and soda, among other items, for his shop. However, he faces the challenge of competition from the other tailors and shops. With a continuous financial boost from Kiva lenders and UGAFODE, he is assured of achieving his dreams. The UGAFODE credit officer is at the extreme left in a tie.

loans.use: He will buy retail stock for his shop, and clothing for sewing

loans.name: Amistad San Juan Group

texts.en:
San Juan La Laguna is a quiet beautiful town on the shores of Lake Atitlán in the Western Highlands of Guatemala. It is well-known as a center for natural dyes using plants, fruits, vegetables, flowers, insects and bark. Many of the talented ladies in the village create beautifully designed clothing and other weavings on a back strap or foot loom.

Maria is one of the talented artisans of San Juan. She is the president of the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank group “Amistad San Juan.” The group is composed of eight women who received a loan from KIVA investors last May. They happily report that they are just about to complete their loan cycle, paying back all loans fully and on time. The funding was very useful to the women and their businesses. Maria used her loan to create textiles such as scarves, shawls and backpacks that she sold in various places in the town. 

Maria is requesting a new loan to help her buy necessary supplies such as needles, thread, buttons and zippers. Her friends in the Trust Bank also need funding for their loans and are asking KIVA investors for assistance. Friendship Bridge believes that the combination of small loans and education that forms Microcredit Plus is a pathway to success for these women. During monthly meetings, a Friendship Bridge Loan Officer facilitates educational seminars so that the ladies can learn how to manage their loans effectively (budgeting, pricing, marketing, customer service, accounting), acquire knowledge about caring for their families (nutrition, health, hygiene and the use of medicinal plants) and gain personal tools (self-esteem and empowerment). Kiva investors are gracious partners with Friendship Bridge in funding these much-needed loans. The ladies of the “Amistad San Juan” Trust Bank are very grateful and want to share their gratitude. Thank you, Kiva investors!

loans.use: to purchase thread and supplies for her textile business

loans.name: María Inés

texts.es: María Inés es una mujer laboriosa que a sus 30 años de edad se dedica a la comercialización de ropa y cosméticos en su domicilio, este negocio lo impulsó hace seis años y con los créditos a logrado crecer en su negocio, comenzó vendiendo cosméticos AVON a los pobladores de su comunidad y actualmente comercializa los cosméticos y ropa de segunda en su domicilio y a pobladores de su comunidad, el crédito actual lo solicita para la compra de una vitrina con cinco depósitos lo que le permitirá ofrecer una mejor visión a sus clientes de su negocio, mostrando así un ejemplo de superación.
texts.en:
Maria Ines is a hard-working 30-year-old woman who works selling clothing and cosmetics in her home.  She started this business six years ago and with the loans has succeeded in growing her business.  She began selling AVON cosmetics to the inhabitants of her community and now she sells cosmetics and second-hand clothing in her home and to the residents of her community.

The loan she is now asking for is to buy a display case with five shelves which will permit her to offer her customers a better view of her business, thus showing an example of improvement.

loans.use: to buy a display case that will permit her to offer her customers a better view of her business

loans.name: Caminando Juntos Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “CAMINANDO JUNTOS”; Este banco se ubicado en la provincia de La Convencion, distrito de Echarate perteneciente al  departamento de Cusco.
La socia Livia tiene 45 años de edad, 04 hijos  y es separada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al cultivo de frutas como platanos, naranjas entre otros y vende a sus cliente que le solicitan, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas y abono.
Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de venta de crianza de animales menores, cultivo de frutas, agricultura.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the “CAMINANDO JUNTOS” communal bank which is located in the province of La Convencion, Echarate district, which belongs to the department of Cusco.

Livia is 45 years old, separated and has 4 children. She divides her time between her daily activities and working growing fruits like bananas and oranges amongst others to sell to clients that request them.
