The member has been in this business for quite some time and things are going well for her thanks to the effort that she brings to her business each day. She is a responsible and hard-working person and in this way gets ahead with her family.

Livia is requesting a loan to buy seeds and manure.The other members work in businesses selling and raising small animals, growing fruit and agriculture. The member thanks all those who form part of this dream through this loan and promises to comply with the established installments on time.

loans.use: to buy seeds and manure.

loans.name: Amélida

texts.es:
Amélida, de 37 años de edad, es una mujer que trabaja arduamente por su familia, su familia es muy numerosa, ella tuvo que dejar sus estudios, para dedicarse a buscar el sustento para cubrir las necesidades básicas de su casa; ss una madre soltera de 8 hijos, pero eso no le ha quitado las ganas de luchar y buscar maneras de obtener ingresos para su hogar.

Amélida, tiene una pequeña tienda, donde vende golosinas, granos básicos, bebidas, entre otros productos, tiene 6 años de experiencia y este oficio lo aprendió por iniciativa propia.- Antes de tener la tienda, vendía platos de comida típica como pasteles de carne y tamales, lo hacia todas las tardes cerca de su casa. 
Sus hijos le ayudan atendiendo su pequeño negocio cuando ella tiene que hacer otras actividades.

Con el financiamiento de Credicampo ha podido hacer crecer su negocio.- Ahora, ella utilizará el préstamo para comprar mercadería para su tienda, está vez comprará al por mayor, para reducir costos, así tendrá mayores ingresos para su familia.

Su principal sueño es poder comenzar a construir su casa poco a poco, hasta tener su vivienda propia.
texts.en:
Amélida is 37 years old and is a woman who works arduously for her family.  Her family is very large.  She had to give up her studies in order to work to provide for the basic needs of her household.  She is a single mother with 8 children, but this has not taken away her desire to struggle and find ways to obtain income for her family.

She has a small store where she sells candies, basic grains, beverages, and other products.  She has 6 years of experience in this field and she learned the business on her own initiative.  Before opening the store she sold meals of traditional foods such as meat empanadas and tamales.  She did this every afternoon close to her home.  

Her children help her by tending the small business when she has other obligations. 

With a loan from Kiva partner Credicampo, Amélida has been able to grow her business.  Now, she will use a new loan in order to purchase merchandise for her store.  This time she will buy in bulk in order to reduce costs and thus have greater income for her family. 

Her main dream is to be able to build her own home little by little, and thus have her own place to call home.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Mwanakame

texts.en: Mwanakame is a single woman who does not have children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.For the past three years, she has operated a cosmetics shop business. Her potential customers are town dwellers and neighbours, especially women. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her family’s basic needs.With the loan of 25,000 KES that she is requesting, she wants to purchase perfumes, lipsticks and body lotions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, lipsticks and body lotions.

loans.name: Centro De Guineales Group

texts.es:
Martin es casado de 35 años de edad, él vive en una comunidad de Guineales, forma una bonita familia de 4 hijos,  dos ellos estudian en una escuelita de su comunidad. 
Martin es un padre de familia que trabaja incansablemente,  pues para la generación de sus ingresos, él desde hace 6 años se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa típica, él vende en el  mercado de su comunidad,  y vende también en otras comunidades cercanas.
 
Martin cuenta que es un negocio bonito y si genera ingresos, pero para tener una bonita venta y captar clientes es necesario también contar con variedad de productos en tonalidades y estilo, pero él no cuenta con capital para surtir su negocio, pues por esa razón es que Martin está buscando un prestamo para comprar mas ropa y a la moda de su clientela. 
Pues la meta de Martin para el futuro  es generar más ingresos y ganancias y con eso él pueda construir casa para sus hijos y darle una mejor comodidad.
texts.en:
Martin, 35, lives in the community of Guineales and has a nice family with four children.  Two of them attend the community school.

Manuel is a father who works tirelessly to earn an income buying and selling typical clothing which he has been doing for six years.  He sells at the community market and in nearby communities.  He claims it is a good business and generates an income but in order to earn more and attract more customers he must have a variety of products in different colors and styles.  Since he does not have the money available he is requesting a loan to buy more clothing to suit his customers' needs.  
Manuel's future goal is to generate more income and profit so he can build a house for his children, making them more comfortable.

loans.use: To buy and sell typical clothing.

loans.name: Abduholiq

texts.ru:
Абдухолик молодой парень 32 лет. Он родился и вырос в сельской местности г. Истаравшан в семье  дехканина.  Абдухолик  занимается  животноводством около 6 лет и сейчас  у него есть 2 коровы. Также он занимается  дехканством. Он женат и имеет троих детей. В животноводстве ему помогает жена. 
 Абдухолик  хочет увеличить поголовье скота и расширить свой бизнес.  Он обратился в МДО Арванд за кредитом. Он заранее благодарит за поддержку и доверие.
texts.en:
Abduholiq is a 32-year-old young man. He was born and grew up in the countryside of Istaravshan city in a farmer's family. Abduholiq has been practicing livestock breeding for about 6 years. He currently has 2 cows. He also practices farming. He is married and has three children. His wife helps him with the livestock breeding.

Abduholiq wants to increase the size of his herd and expand his business. He turned to MDO Arvand for a loan. He thanks you in advance for your support and trust.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Flores De Panimache Group

texts.en:
The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank loan group “Flores de Panimache” has just successfully completed a loan cycle and is hoping that Kiva investors will finance a new one.  The seven ladies of the group are in great necessity for funding since there is no other way that they can secure a loan to sustain or expand their small businesses, send their children to school, and support their families. Many of the women weave and embroider colorful cloth and must purchase thread and yarn as well as other supplies. Their textiles are unique tapestries of flowers, birds and geometric figures.

Maria is a 30-year-old member of the “Flores de Panimache” who has had only three years of formal education. She has two children. Maria wants to invest her loan in her “tortilleria” or tortilla shop where fresh tortillas are made three times each day. She will use her portion of the group loan to purchase large quantities of corn, lime, and cooking gas. Her business is ideally located in Guatemala City, the busy capital of the country. Maria is quite happy to have her business because it is profitable and she is able to employ two young women to meet the demands of her clientele. She has short-term plans to open another locale.

The members of “Flores de Panimache” are quite enthusiastic about the educational component of their monthly meetings. A Friendship Bridge Loan Officer shares knowledge with the women about a variety of subjects ranging from effective business practices to nutrition and hygiene as well as women’s rights and self-esteem. The organization calls the combination of education and small loans “Microcredit Plus” and it has had a huge positive impact on the women. They have greater confidence than when they first joined the Trust Bank which translates into a commitment to making a good and responsible use of credit in order to benefit themselves and their families. 

The women are extremely grateful to Kiva investors for this opportunity to secure a loan and education. With the strong bond that they have formed with each other and the positive relationship that they have with their Trust Bank officer, they are creating a more prosperous world for themselves, their families and their community. Thank you, Kiva investors!

loans.use: to purchase large quantities of corn, lime, and cooking gas

loans.name: Sonia Aracely

texts.es: Sonia de 26 años de edad es una joven emprendedora que vive con su compañero de vida y su hijo de 7 años de edad en la vivienda del suegro desde hace 2 años. Ella se gana la vida elaborando prendas de vestir en una empresa cercana, con lo que ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia y apoya a su hijo para que estudie y pueda optar por una mejor calidad de vida.   Sonia se siente muy agradecida con su suegro porque les permite vivir en su casa pero ella desea tener un lugar propio donde vivir, actualmente cuentan con un pequeño terreno en el cual desea construir su propia vivienda, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: madera, lámina galvanizada, clavos y alambre para construir su vivienda de madera y poder disfrutar de una casa propia sabiendo que logrará cancelar las cuotas que el crédito implica gracias a su trabajo.
texts.en:
Sonia is 26 years old, and is an enterprising young person. For the past two years, she has lived in her father-in-law's home with her partner and seven-year-old son. She earns her living making clothing for a nearby business, and so has been able to do her best for her family and support her son so that he can study and have a better quality of life in future.

Sonia is very grateful to her father-in-law for letting them live in his house, but she wishes to have her own place to live. The couple currently have a small plot of land, where Sonia hopes to contruct her own home. She is therefore seeking a loan via FUSAI to invest in wood, galvanised metal sheeting, nails and wire in order to build a wooden house, and so enjoy her own home, knowing that she will be able to make the necessary payments thanks to her work.

loans.use: to invest in wood, galvanised metal sheeting, nails and wire to build her own home.

loans.name: Si, Si, Si Group

texts.es: El grupo “Si, Si,Si” es un grupo conformado por socios dedicados al comercio minorista. Mauricio tiene 28 años de edad es conviviente con una 01 hija educando. El se dedica a la preparación de turrones de quiwicha hace unos años. Dicha actividad lo aprendió con su hermano mayor. El crédito lo invirtió en la compra de quiwicha miel y de más insumos para su producto. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Mauricio es el que se encuentra parado en el lado derecho.
texts.en: The group "Yes, yes, yes" is made up of members dedicated to small micro-businesses.  Mauricio is 28 years old and lives with his life partner and his 1 year old daughter.  He works making healthy snacks, specifically "turrones de quiwicha" or a sweet honey and grain bar, and has been working in this field for some years.  He learned this work from his older brother.  He will invest his loan in the purchase of honey and quiwicha (a type of grain like quinoa) and other food stuffs for making his product.  His communal banking group is thankful for the Kiva lenders and the loans offered.  Mauricio is the gentleman in the photograph standing on the right side.

loans.use: to purchase honey and quiwicha (a type of grain like quinoa) and other food stuffs for making his sweet grain bars.

loans.name: Unidos Para Siempre Group

texts.es:
Unidos para Siempre es el nombre de un grupo de préstamo formado en una comunidad desde donde se puede disfrutar el paisaje que ofrece el Pico de Orizaba, volcán más alto del país. La vista del volcán también esta acompañada de las chimeneas de los diferentes ingenios (fábricas de azúcar) de la región. El nombre del grupo se debe a lo que los integrantes del grupo esperan que pase mantenerse unidos para siempre, ellos son:

Caridad, Herlinda - Antojitos 
Leonarda - Abarrotes
Rosa Elvia - Chofer
Juan – Estética 
Rebeca - Carne
Alberta – Sabanas

Doña Caridad, mejor conocida como Cari, es una mujer muy trabajadora, desde hace 25 años inició con un pequeño puesto de comida el cual establecía en el corredor de su casa. Con las ganancias obtenidas y el sueldo de su esposo lograron darle estudios profesionales a sus hijos. Al principio Cari únicamente vendía los fines de semana pero los clientes, la demanda y la motivación han crecido lo suficiente para poder trabajar todos los días desde las 7 pm hasta las 11 pm. Con sus ganancias y la ayuda de los préstamos, Cari también ha podido mejorar el lugar donde atiende a sus clientes: compró un enrejado que sirve como protección mientras vende.

La comida preferida de los clientes de Cari son las tostadas, empanadas, panuchos, garnachas, tacos dorados, chiles rellenos, plátanos fritos, papas y por ello necesita invertir en más ingredientes para elaborar específicamente estos platillos: queso, media crema, frijol, aceite, jitomate, chiles, huevos, cebolla, cilantro, aguacate, mole, pollo, carne de res, platos, papel estraza, cucharas, vasos, bolsas, papel aluminio jugos y refrescos.. "Gracias a Dios por la gran fortaleza, bendición que me ha dado con mi negocio, la ayuda de mis hijas y mi hermana es grato”. Cari comenta que el éxito de su negocio se debe al trato que da a los clientes, el horario de venta, la ubicación del negocio y lo mejor de todo el sazón de la comida. 

Lo más sorprendente, es que después de 25 años Cari continúa cocinando con pasión y entusiasmo, su plan es continuar su negocio hasta que Dios se lo permita y le gustaría que después sus hijas sean dueñas del negocio para que se convierta en una tradición familiar.

*La fotografía fue tomada en el interior del negocio de doña Cari quien viste blusa negra y esta parada delante de su hijo Juan Manuel.
texts.en:
“Unidos para Siempre” (“Always United”) is the name of a loan group formed in a community, where one can enjoy the landscape offered by the Pico de Orizaba, the tallest volcano in the country. The view of the volcano is also accompanied by the chimneys of the different sugar factories in the area. The name of the group comes from the fact that the members of the group hope that they can stay united forever. The members are: 
   - Caridad and Herlina, who sell snacks.
   - Leonarda, who sells groceries.
   - Rosa Elvia, who is a driver.
   - Juan, who sells beauty products.
   - Rebeca, who sells meat.
   - Alberta, who sells bedsheets.

Caridad, is a women known as Cari. She is a very hard-working woman. Twenty-five years ago, she started a small food stand in the hallway of her house. With the earnings she obtained and her husband’s salary, the couple succeeded in offering professional educations to their children. In the beginning, Cari only sold food on the weekends, but her clients’ demands and her motivation have grown enough that she can work everyday from 7pm to 11pm. With her earnings and the help from the loans, Cari has also been able to improve her business location. She bought a grille, which serves as protection while she sells. 

The food Cari’s clients prefer are the tostadas, empanadas, stuffed tortillas, tortillas with meat filling, golden-brown tacos, chile rellenos, fried plantains, and potatoes. Because of this, she needs to invest in more ingredients to make the following dishes in particular: cheese, half and half, beans, oil, tomatoes, chilies, eggs, onions, cilantro, avocados, mole, chicken, cow meat, plates, brown paper, spoons, glasses, bags, aluminum foil, juices, and soda. 

“Thanks to God for the great strength and blessing that he has given me with my business. The help of my daughters and my sister is nice.” Cari says that the success of her business stems from how she treats her clients, her selling schedule, the location of her business, and above all the flavor of her food. 

The most surprising thing is that after 25 years, Cari continues cooking with passion and enthusiasm. Her plan is to continue her business as long as God allows, and she would like for her daughters to be the owners of the business after that, so that it can because a family tradition.

* The photograph was taken inside the business of Cari, who is shown in a black shirt and is standing next to her son Juan Manuel.

loans.use: to buy cheese, half and half, beans, oil, tomatoes, chilies, eggs, onions, cilantro, avocados, mole, chicken, cow meat, plates, brown paper, and spoons.

loans.name: Puerto Nuevo Group

texts.es:
Cinco mujeres laboriosas cada una con negocios diferentes, decidieron unirse para solicitar por primera en ADIM el financiamiento con el objetivo de incrementar el capital de trabajo de cada una de las socias, este grupo solidario es Puerto Nuevo. Está coordinado por Petrona una mujer emprendedora de 27 años de edad, casada, su negocio es la comercialización de ropa en algunos departamentos del país, el crédito lo solicita para la inversión en camisetas, pantalones para damas, pantalones para caballeros, planchas para el cabellas, etc., una de sus metas es comercializar electrodomésticos. 
El resto de los integrantes son, Darling una joven de 24 años que se dedica a la comercialización de ropa en comunidades cercanas a su domicilio desde hace dos años, María Elizabeth una señora que tiene la edad de 39 años y ofrece el servicio de venta de comida en su domicilio, Yeris que tiene la edad de 28 años y se dedica a la hecha y venta de nacatamales, sopa y repocheta en su domicilio, y Helmyn de 34 años de edad propietaria de una pulpería desde hace cuatro años.
texts.en:
Five hard-working women, each with a different business, decided to join together to request financing with ADIM for the first time. Their objective is to increase the working capital of each woman in the group, which is called the Puerto Nuevo Solidarity Group.  It is coordinated by Petrona, an enterprising, 27-year-old woman, married, whose business is selling clothing in several departments in the country. 

She is requesting the loan to invest in t-shirts, ladies’ pants, men’s pants, straightening irons for hair, and such.  One of her goals is to sell household electrical appliances.

The other members are Darling, 24, who sells clothing in the communities near her home; Señora María Elizabeth, 39, who offers a food service from her home; Yeris, 28, who makes and sells corn tamales, soup, and grilled quesadillas in her home; and Helmyn, 34, who has owned a small grocery store for four years.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell.

loans.name: Coralia

texts.es: Coralia es una microempresaria laboriosa que tiene la edad de 39 años y es propietaria de un taller de costura y bordados  desde hace diez años, es el octavo ciclo que ADIM le brinda el financiamiento y ha demostrado ser una persona que ha sabido invertir y manejar su negocio, cuenta con cuatro trabajadores que on remunerados, el crédito actual lo invertirá en la compra de tela de dacron, entre tela, elástico, seda, conos de hilo, zipper, etc., con los créditos anteriores logró ofrecer trabajadores a otras mujeres que tienen conocimiento de este negocio por lo que la producción ha aumentado y por ende le permite cubrir los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Coralia is a hardworking small-businesswoman who is 39 years old.  She has been the owner of a sewing and embroidery workshop for ten years.  This is the eighth cycle in which ADIM has provided financing for her and she has proven to be a person that has known how to invest and manage her business.  She has four paid workers.  

She will invest the current loan in the purchase of Dacron fabric among other fabrics, elastic, silk, cones of thread, zippers, etc.  With the previous loans she was able to offer work to other woman who have knowledge of this business.  For that reason production has increased and that has therefore allowed her to cover her family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics, zippers, cones of thread, elastic, etc., in order to increase production.

loans.name: María Felix

texts.es: María Félix es una microempresaria que a sus 56 años tiene las fuerzas y ánimo para seguir laborando y así seguir aportando a los gastos de su hogar, ella se dedica  a la compra-venta de cosechas de frutas y verduras, comercializándolas en el mercado más populoso de la capital, este negocio lo impulsó hace quince años gracias a un préstamo que le hizo a una amiga y con financiamientos que le ayudaron sus hijos, cuenta con la ayuda de un trabajador que es remunerado y el crédito actual lo solicita para la compra de cosecha de tamarindo, ya que es uno de los productos que mayor demanda tiene en esta temporada, es el noveno ciclo que ADIM le brinda los financiamientos para su negocio y ha demostrado ser una persona responsable con el cumplimiento de las cuotas y con alto espíritu de superación.
texts.en:
María Félix is a micro-entrepreneur who, at 56 years old, has the strength and the courage to continue working and thus continue contributing to the household expenses.  She makes a living buying and selling fruit and vegetable crops, marketing them in the most populous market in the capital.  She boosted this business fifteen years ago thanks to a loan that a friend gave her and with funding that her children helped her with.  

With the help from a paid worker, she is requesting to buy tamarind crops, since it is one of the products that has the highest demand during this season.  This is the ninth cycle that ADIM has given her the funding for her business.  She has demonstrated that she is a responsible person with the repayment of her loan, and that she has a high spirit to overcome.

loans.use: To buy tamarind crop, since it is one of the products that has the highest demand during this season.

loans.name: Ricardo Francisco

texts.es:
Ricardo, logro estudiar hasta quinto grado, vive con sus padres, por falta de ingresos económicos no pudo seguir estudiando.

Ricardo, tomo la decicion de dejar de estudiar y ayudar a su padre con los gastos de la casa y asi fue como su padre le enseño como trabajar en la agricultura, principalmente a como hacer milpas.

Ricardo, necesita el crédito para contruir un cuarto para él.

El principal sueño de Ricardo es, formar una familia.
texts.en:
Ricardo was able to attend school up to the fifth grade.  He lives with his parents.  Because of a lack of financial income he wasn’t able to continue with his studies.

Ricardo made the decision to stop attending school and help his father with the household expenses and that’s how his father taught him how to work in agriculture, mainly how to make milpas (cornfields).

Ricardo needs the loan to build a room for himself.

Ricardo’s main dream is to start a family.

loans.use: to build a room onto his parents’ house.

loans.name: Evelin Arely

texts.es:
Evelin, de 28 años de edad, es empleada, es madre soltera de dos hijos.

Evelin, trabaja en una empresa de concervados de atúnes, tiene 7 años de estar brindando sus servicios en esa empresa.

Evelin, solicita el crédito para comprar cemento, arena y pagar la mano de obra, para que le reparen su casa.

El sueño de Evelin es, poner un negocio que le genere ingreso a su hogar y mejorar así la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Evelin is 28 years old. She is an employee and the single mother of two children. Evelin works in a  tuna packing company. She has been working here for 7 years, Evelin is requesting a loan to buy cement, sand and to pay for labor to repair her house. Evelin's dream is to open a business to generate money for her household to improve the quality of living of her family.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and pay for labor to repair her house.

loans.name: Muhayo

texts.ru:
Мухаё 29 лет. Она замужем и мать двоих детей. У нее один сын и одна дочка, они еще маленькие, им по 5 и 2 лет. Мухаё вместе семьей проживает в районе Файзабод. Ее муж работает заправщиком на Авто заправочной станции. Он старается обеспечить семью всем необходимым, но мужу трудно и Мухаё стала заниматься шитьем женской одежды и помогать мужу - обеспечить дом. 
Мухаё трудолюбивая женщина. Она занимается шитьем у себя дома, и она параллельно ведет домашнее хозяйство. Мухаё начала ремонт гораздо раньше, но из-за нехватки средств одна комната осталась без ремонта. Она решилась обратиться за кредитом, купить стройматериал и закончить ремонт. Это кредит поможет осуществить ее мечту о красивом интерьере. Помогите Мухаё осуществить свою мечту.
texts.en:
Muhayo is 29 years old. She is married and is a mother to two children. She has one son and one daughter. They are both still very young - 5 and 2 years old. Muhayo and her family live in the Fayzabad District. Her husband works as a fuel attendant at a car service station. He tries his best to provide their family with all of the necessities, but is it is difficult for him. This is why Muhayo began helping her husband by sewing women's clothing.

Muhayo is a hardworking woman. She sews in her home and simultaneously performs all of the housework. Muhayo making renovations on her home a very long time ago, but because of insufficient funds, one room was not renovated. She decided to apply for a loan in order to buy construction materials and finish the renovation. This loan will allow her to accomplish her goal of a beautiful home interior. Please help Muhayo accomplish her goal.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and renovate one of her rooms.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy the fruits that are in highest demand.

loans.name: Santos Narciso

texts.es:
Santos, es un hombre trabajador y dedicado a su familia, solamente pudo estudiar hasdta cuarto grado, ya que desde muy temprana edad tuvo que apoyar a su padre en las actividades agrícolas.- Hace algunos años, emigro a Estados Unidos, pero fue deportado al poco tiempo de haber llegado.

Actualmente, está casado y su esposa realiza los quehaceres del hogar y también ayuda en la crianza de cerdos y gallinas, tienen cuatro hijos, tres de estos estudian.

Santos, se dedica principalmente a las actividades de agricultura y crianza de especies menores; en el manejo de cultivos, comenzó a trabajar desde muy pequeño, aprendió este oficio gracias a que su padre.

En la crianza de especies menores trabaja desde hace 5 años, buscando nuevas fuentes de ingresos. 

El crédito lo necesita para seguir invirtiendo en el negocio de crianza de cerdos y pollos de engorde, ya tiene establecida las instalaciones, pero este año quiere incrementar la producción, ya que ha podido notar que hay gran demanda de este producto.

Su sueño es poder diversificar su producción, estableciendo una granja que sea sostenible y pueda ayudarle para cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia.
texts.en:
Santos is a hardworking man and dedicated to his family.  He was only able to study until the fourth grade, since from an early age he had to support his father in the agriculture jobs.  A few years ago, he emigrated the United States, but he was deported soon after having arrived.

Currently, he is married, and his wife does the household chores and also helps raising the pigs and the hens.  They have four children, three of whom go to school.

Santos mainly works in the agricultural jobs of raising small animals.  In the management of crops, he began working very young.  He learned this trade thanks to his father.  In the raising of small animals, he has been working in this for five years, looking for new sources of income.

He is requesting the loan to continue investing in the business of raising pigs and chickens to fatten.  He has already established the facilities, but his year he wants to increase the production since he has noticed that there is a big demand for this product.

His dream is to be able to diversify his production, establishing a farm that will be sustainable and can help him to cover the basic necessities of his family.

loans.use: To continue investing in the business of raising pigs and chickens to fatten.

loans.name: Ana Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria, de 36 años de edad, es empleada de una maquila cercana a su lugar de residencia y tiene 4 años de experiencia de trabajar ahí, está acompañada y su pareja es soldador, tiene 2 hijos, el primero de 12 años de edad y la segunda de 7 años, ambos estudian educación básica.

El crédito que solicita Gloria es para comprar una herramienta para soldar, pues a su esposo le hace falta esa pieza que es clave en su trabajo.

A futuro Gloria, desea mejores condiciones para ella y su pequeña familia.
texts.en: Gloria is 36 years old and works in a factory near her home. She has worked there for four years. She lives with her husband, who is a solderer, and they have two children aged 12 and 7 who both attend elementary school. Gloria is requesting a loan to buy a soldering iron, as this is an essential tool for her husband's work. In the future, Gloria would like her small family to have better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a soldering iron.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 39 years old, married, and has three children who are still in school. She is in the agricultural business in the Philippines and has been for 2 years now.

Mary Grace requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has borrowed once in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy is 41 years old, married woman, and has one child who is still in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Mary Joy has a fish vending business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 10 years.

Mary Joy requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase materials like fishing nets, bamboo, etc. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials like fishing nets, bamboo, etc.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 55 years old and has children who are still in school.

Erlinda has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business like meat, spices, flour, etc.

Erlinda has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough money to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business like meat, spices, flour, etc

loans.name: Luda Joan

texts.en:
Luda Joan is 48 years old and married with two children.

Luda Joan works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like soft drinks, shampoo, noodles, canned goods, sugar, milk, coffee, spices, etc.

Luda Joan has borrowed and paid back seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 16 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Luda Joan aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soft drinks, shampoo, noodles, canned goods, sugar, milk, coffee, spices, etc

loans.name: Luís Alonso

texts.es:
Luis, de 37 años de edad, es agricultor, estudió hasta bachillerato y por falta de recursos economicos, le fué imposible continuar, está acompañado y es padre de tres hijos.

Luis, se dedica al cultivo de maíz y pipían, desde que formó su hogar se dedica a la agricultura.- Para poder llegar hasta donde tiene sus cultivos, tiene que caminar un kilómetro aproximadamente.

Con el dinero que solicita Luis, pretende comprar una bolsa de maíz, cinco sacos de abono, fertilizantes y veneno para la preparación de la tierra y el pago de la mano de obra.

Luis, pretende que su trabajo de agricultura le genere buenas ganancias, para así poder contribuir con el estudio de sus tres hijos.
texts.en:
Luís, 37 years old, is a farmer.  He studied until high school and, for lack of economic resources, it was impossible for him to continue.  He is married and the father of three children.

Luís makes a living cultivating corn and squash.  Since he formed his house he has been working in agriculture.  To be able to arrive where he has his crops, he has to walk about a kilometer.

With the loan that Luis is requesting, he intends to buy a bag of corn, five sacks of manure, fertilizers, and poison to prepare the land and to pay for manual labor.

Luís hopes that his agricultural job will generate him good profits so as to be able to contribute to the studies of his three children.

loans.use: To buy a bag of corn, five sacks of manure, fertilizers, and poison for the preparation of the land and to pay for manual labor.

loans.name: Ma. Ruth

texts.en:
Ma. Ruth works hard to support her family. She is married and has a handicraft making business in the Philippines.

Ma. Ruth requested a PHP 3,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials like zippers and fabric for making bags and belts.

Ma. Ruth has been in this business for two years now, and also earns additional income from dried fish.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials like zippers and fabric for making bags and belts.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
Cesar es una persona muy responsable y mayormente con su familia, él vive en una comunidad de San Andrés Sementabaj, junto a su familia, él es casado  y tiene ahora 46 años. 
Cesar para la generación de más ingresos económicos, pues hace cuatro meses instala una tienda de ropa en la comunidad donde vive, pues por la amabilidad con que atienden  es muy visitado y gracias a Dios él vende,  pero aún hace falta que equiparlo más, Cesar ahora necesita capital de trabajo para poder comprar más cortes típicos, la solución y para darle respuesta a esta necesidad es buscar un prestamo, Cesar entonces se acercó a esta institución para solicitar un prestamo de  cuatro mil quinientos quetzales. Él está muy seguro de que la venta  será  rentable y con ganancias estaría pagando el  prestamo. 
Cesar manifiesta que él también se dedica a la albañilería y que con este trabajo ha logrado mantener a su familia, y ahora con el nuevo negocio que implemento, recibirá más ingresos económicos, el anhelo de Cesar es buscar superación todos los días, y él lo hace porque quiere a su familia, y él sueña que con sus ganancias construirá casa para sus hijos, y por ahora seguir apoyándolos para que estudien.
texts.en:
Cesar is a very responsible man, and especially with his family. He lives in the community of San Andres Sementabaj with his family. He is married and is 46 years old.

In order to generate more income, four months ago he opened a clothing store in the community where he lives. And due to the amiability with which he treats those who visit his shop, and thanks be to God, his sales are succeeding. But he still needs to better supply the store. Now, Cesar needs working capital to purchase more traditional cloth. The solution, and to respond to this necessity, was to locate a loan. Cesar approached this institution to solicit a loan of 4,500 quetzales. He is sure that sales will continue to be profitable, and with the earnings, he will be able to pay off the loan.

Cesar notes that he is also a bricklayer and that with this work, he has been  able to maintain his family. And, now, with the new business which he has launched, he will receive more income. Cesar's hope is to seek out advancement every day, and he will do so because he loves his family and dreams that with the earnings, he can build a house for his children, and for new, he will continue helping them so that they may study.

loans.use: purchase traditional cuts of cloth to sell.

loans.name: Nigora

texts.ru: Нигора молодая жена и мать. Ей всего 23 лет. Она проживает в районе Кубадиён. Нигора красивая, добрая и трудолюбивая женщина района. У нее среднее образование, она после окончания школы вышла замуж и начала новую жизнь.  Нигора начала заниматься земледелием 2 года назад. Она ведет домашние хозяйство, и хорошо справляется со своей работой. Нигора сейчас готовила почву для посева урожая. Нигоре надо купить минеральные удобрения, семена пшеницы и картофеля. Из-за отсутствия достаточных средств на приобретения семян и удобрений Нигора обратилась за кредитом. Это кредит поможет ей посеять урожай и не остаться без дохода весь сезон. Земледелие ей как воздух, без этой деятельности она не может дышать. Она любит заниматься этой земледелием, потому что доход от этого бизнеса обеспечивает ее семью.  Вы можете поддержать Нигоры сейчас. Только Вы можете помочь Нигоре.
texts.en: Nigora is a young wife and mother. She is just 23 years old. She lives in the Qubadiyon district. Nigora is a beautiful, kind and hardworking woman. She has a secondary education. After graduating from school, she got married and began her new life. Nigora started crop farming two years ago. She runs the household and does a good job managing her work. Nigora is now readying the soil for sowing seeds. Nigora needs to buy mineral fertilizers, wheat seeds and potato seeds. As she does not enough money to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers, Nigora applied for a loan. This loan will help her sow her seeds and not be without an income for the entire season. Crop farming is like air for her - without this business, she is unable to breathe. She loves crop farming because the income from this business provides for her family. You can now support Nigora. Only you are able to help her.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers, potato seeds and wheat seeds.

loans.name: Plan 3000 2 Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PLAN 3000 2” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Maria es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de tenis, venta de enaguas, salón de belleza, venta de mantas, venta de busos de algodón, venta de repuestos de autos, venta de ropa para damas, venta de comida. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Maria es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de salón de belleza; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio después de haber estudiado en instituciones técnicas, posteriormente trabajo como ayudante donde aprendió más y decidió emprender un negocio independiente. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de secadora profesional y toallas) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo implementará en su espacio de trabajo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank PLAN 3000 2 is requesting its second loan from Pro Mujer (Pro Woman), part of the Centro Focal de Cascada. The group is made up of 8 members and is led by a board of which Maria is the president. The members of the group run various types of businesses including tennis shoe sales, underskirt sales, blanket sales, sweatshirt and pants sales, car parts sales, women's clothing sales, and food sales. The loan that they are requesting will benefit the small entrepreneurs in the group. Maria states that she joined Pro Mujer one year ago after she was invited by a friend who is a customer of the institution. 

Maria runs a beauty salon, a business that she started after finishing her studies at technical schools. Before starting the business she worked as an assistant where she learned her trade and later decided to start her own business. She is requesting the loan in order to purchase tools, such as a professional hairdryer and towels, that she will buy from the sellers in the city of El Alto to use in her workplace. Her work allows her to make money to support her family as she is the single mother of a son. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the health area that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy a professional hairdryer and towels.

loans.name: Jeanette

texts.en:
Jeanette is 51 years old and married with three children, two of whom are still in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Jeanette runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like sardines, soft drinks, noodles, etc. to sell.

Jeanette has been in this business for three years.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like sardines, soft drinks, noodles, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Prelyn

texts.en:
Prelyn is 35 years old and married with four children. With two children in school, Prelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Prelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Prelyn has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as soap, canned goods, shampoo and other groceries.

In the future Prelyn would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and build a bathroom, septic tank, a toilet and water sources at their home to improve access to water and sanitation for their family.

loans.name: Ma. Erma

texts.en:
Ma. Erma is 54 years old and a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Ma. Erma has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Ma. Erma has been in this business for eight years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Kathia Ivonne

texts.es:
Kathia es una joven de 23 años, nació en el fronterizo Municipio de Puerto Suarez del departamento de Santa Cruz de la Sierra – Bolivia, actualmente se encuentra culminando sus estudios en la carrera de Ingeniería de Sistemas, para lo cual solicita un crédito educativo. 
Kathia comenta que desde hace aproximadamente un mes empezó a trabajar como operadora de Call Center en una empresa que ofrece sus servicios en el área de sistemas, como forma de apoyar económicamente a sus padres, quienes se dedican a la agricultura.
Kathia escogió esta carrera ya que siempre le gustó la informática y manifiesta que este ha sido un reto personal porque le exige mucha dedicación y constante actualización. Menciona además que sus anhelos de superación y el tener la posibilidad de apoyar económicamente a su familia, es lo que la impulsa a seguir adelante. 
Kathia piensa que lo que la diferencia de los demás es la perseverancia y el esfuerzo que demuestra día a día, ya que no ha sido fácil vivir sola y estar alejada de su familia. Su sueño es trabajar como Administradora de Sistemas en una empresa prestigiosa del país.  
Kathia está agradecida con aquellas personas que a través de sus recursos económicos ayudan a otros que buscan su superación personal; aplaude esta noble labor, pues ella está segura que si hubiera más personas como ellos se tendría una cadena de solidaridad y ejemplo para muchos.
texts.en:
Kathia is a young woman who is 23 years old.  She was born in the border town of Puerto Suarez in the department of Santa Cruz de la Sierra, Bolivia.  Currently, she finds herself finishing her studies in the degree of Systems Engineering, which is why she is requesting an education loan.
 
Kathia says that about a month ago, she began to work as an operator for a Call Center in one of the businesses that offers its services in the area of systems.  She does this to support her parents economically, who make a living in agriculture.

Kathia chose this career since she has always liked computers and declares that this has been a personal challenge since it requires a lot of dedication and constant updating.  She also mentioned that her desires to overcome and to have the possibility to support her family economically is what makes it possible to continue forward.

Kathia thinks that what sets her apart from the rest is her perseverance and the effort that she demonstrates everyday.  It has not been easy to live alone and to be so far from her family.  Her dream is to work as a Systems Administrator in a prestigious company in the country.

Kathia is grateful to those people who, through their economic resources, help those who are seeking personal growth.  She applauds this noble work since she is sure that if there were more people like them, they would have a chain of solidarity and example for many.

loans.use: To pay for her degree in Systems Engineering.

loans.name: Mahsudahon

texts.ru: Махсудахон молодая жительница района Б.Гафуров. Ей 23 лет. Махсудахон не замужем и не имеет детей. Она молодая, красивая и талантливая девушка. Махсудахон после окончание школы решила заняться шитьем женской одежды. Ее мечта была заняться этой деятельности, привлечь себе много клиентов, и открыть свое ателье по шитью национальной женской одежды. Она начала заниматься этой деятельностью 2 года назад. В швейном деле Махсудахон нравиться сшить разную женскую одежду и общаться с новыми людьми. Махсудахон берет кредит для купли новой швейной машинки, чтобы ускорить процесс работы  и продвигаться дальше. Это кредит поможет Махсудахон купить желаемую швейную машинку. Она верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Mahsudahon is a young resident of the B. Gafurov District. She is 23 years old. Mahsudahon is unmarried and she does not have any children. She is a beautiful and talented young woman. After graduating from school, Mahsudahon decided to take up sewing women's clothing. It was her dream to run this business, attract a lot of customers for her herself and open her own seamstress shop sewing Tajik-style women's clothing. She began this business two years ago. In her sewing business, Mahsudahon lives to sew different kinds of women's clothing and talk with new people. Mahsudahon is taking out a loan to buy a new sewing machine in order to speed up her work and make further progress. This loan will allow Mahsudahon to buy her desired sewing machine. She believes in you and your support.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy condiments wholesale.

loans.name: Aminata's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois a été créé le 06 Février 2010 lors l’inauguration du dit banc villageois. Il est composé de femmes qui jouissent d’une bonne entente et d’un bon esprit de groupe. Elles  ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Aminata (debout à l’extrême droite),  est l’emprunteuse vedette du  groupe. Elle est âgée de 21 ans, mariée et mère de 01garcon. Elle est vendeuse d’habits pour hommes et femmes.
 
Son nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter des habits d’une valeur de 150 000f  et de payer son transport jusqu'à bord pour un montant de 20000f et les revendre en détail. 

Les bénéfices réalisés, lui permettront d’épargner et d’acheter des meubles et sa chambre à coucher.
texts.en:
[This group] has been created on February 6, 2010 at the launch of its banc villageois. The group is composed of women who have good rapport among themselves and show team spirit.  They mainly work as vendors.

Mrs. Aminata (the one standing on the far right in the photo) is the star borrower of the group. She is 21  years old, married, and has one son. She sells men's and women's clothing. Her new loan will allow her to buy clothing items  worth 150,000 West Afrucan francs and pay transportation costs of 20,000 francs in order to resell them retail. Her revenues will allow her to grow her savings and buy furniture for her bedroom.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Fima

texts.en:
Fima is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF in order to purchase an additional stock of groceries to sell for her general store business.

Fima successfully paid back her previous loan, and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Fima's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional stock of groceries

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 46 years old and single.

Lourdes runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items, such as canned goods, noodles, candies, biscuits, soft drinks, etc., to sell.

Lourdes has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, noodles, candies, biscuits, soft drinks, etc.

In the future, Lourdes would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items, such as canned goods, noodles, candies, biscuits, soft drinks, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Rema

texts.en:
Ma. Rema is 47 years old and a married woman with three children who are all in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Ma. Rema has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. Ma. Rema requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stock of clothing like curtains, bath towels and other clothing.

Ma. Rema has been in this business for six years. In the future, Ma. Rema would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothing like curtains, bath towels and other clothing.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is 48 years old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like soap, shampoo, rice, etc. to sell.

Amalia has borrowed and paid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years, and also earns an income from rice retailing.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like soap, shampoo, rice, etc.

loans.name: Carol

texts.en:
Carol is 40 years old and married woman with three children, who all attend in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Carol has a dry goods business in the Philippines. Carol requested a PHP 29,500 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stock of kitchen ware, plastic ware, and other school supplies to offer for sale.

Carol has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stock of kitchen ware, plastic ware and other school supplies

loans.name: Carlita

texts.en:
Carlita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her rice retailing business.

Carlita has been in this business for five years. She earns more income from a general store.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. 

She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice

loans.name: Carmela

texts.en:
Carmela works hard to support her family. Carmela is married, and has a tailoring shop business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fabrics, thread, needles, and other materials needed.

Carmela has been in this business for 21 years now. She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Carmela would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics, thread, needles, and other materials needed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and build a bathroom, septic tank, a toilet and water sources at their home to improve access to water and sanitation for their family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and build a bathroom, septic tank, and a toilet at their home to improve access to water and sanitation for their family.

loans.name: Flor De Azucena Group

texts.es:
Margarita es una mujer muy responsable dentro de su comunidad, es reconocida por esta  cualidad, además es muy sincera, ella tiene 48 años, con una familia de 7 hijos pero bajo la responsabilidad de sus padres hay únicamente cuatro. Ellos viven en una comunidad de Sololá 
Margarita (es la que aparece en medio de la fotografía) es una persona  que está muy ligada con su familia, ella desde hace 20 años busca una actividad que le generara ingresos económicos, pues la actividad que ella selecciono es la elaboración de ropa típica y entre otros productos relacionados con la línea de ropa. 
Es un negocio que años atrás no era muy común, pero ahora ya mucha gente se dedica a esta actividad, pero Margarita por los años que lleva trabajando  ya tiene clientela. Margarita para que este negocio se mantenga ella necesita de un prestamo que le servirá para comprar hilos que le servirá para elaborar güipiles, telas pulseras y comprar mostacillas porque también elabora acabados  en blusas de otras comunidades. 
Este prestamo Margarita lo solicita involucrando a otras mujeres, ya que Margarita lo que busca es que otras mujeres progresen como ella no importando la actividad que emprenden, pues ella les cuenta que es importante que la mujer genere sus ingreso,  porque solo asi se logra alcanzar las metas, y el sueño del grupo ahora es conseguir el prestamo  para que puedan apoyar a sus hijos hasta llegar hacer profesionales, y el crédito gestionado en grupos es más fácil y rápido porque no piden tanta garantía.
texts.en:
Margarita is a very responsible woman in her community and is recognized for this quality.  In addition, she is very sincere.  She is 48 years old with a family of seven children, but only four of them are their parents' responsibility now.  They live in the community of Sololá.
Margarita (she is the one in the middle of the photograph) is a person who is very committed to her family.  Twenty years ago, she looked for an activity to generate economic income.  The activity she chose was making traditional clothing and other things related to the clothing line.
It is a business that years ago was not common, but now many people make a living with this activity.  Because of all the years she has been working, Margarita has customers.  In order to maintain this business, Margarita needs a loan which will help her buy thread which she can use to make blouses, fabric bracelets, and buy beads because she also makes finished blouses for other communities.
Margarita is requesting this loan along with other women, since Margarita wants other women to progress as she has regardless of the activity they engage in.  She tells them that it is important for women to generate their income because only in this way that they will they be able to reach their goals.  The dream of the group now is to get the loan so that they can assist their children to become professionals and it is easier and faster for a group to get credit because they don't request as many guarantees.

loans.use: to buy basic materials (threads).

loans.name: Carmencita

texts.en:
Carmencita is 54 years old and married with five children, two of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like soft drinks, sugar, rice, etc. to sell.

Carmencita has been in this business for four years.

In the future, Carmencita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like soft drinks, sugar, rice, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and build a bathroom, a septic tank, and a toilet

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and build a bathroom, septic tank, and a toilet at her home to improve access to water and sanitation for her family.

loans.name: Medina

texts.en:
Medina is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Medina is 48 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Medina has a business raising livestock in the Philippines. Medina requested a loan amount of 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her livestock.

Medina has been in this business for 15 years. Medina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her livestock

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Clarita works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Clarita is borrowing 8,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her rice retailing business.

Clarita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Luzviminda is 48 years old and has four children who are currently in school.

Luzviminda has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. Luzviminda requested a loan of 7,000 PHP through NWTF to buy spare parts for her motorcycle and for maintenance.

Luzviminda has been in this business for four years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her motorcycle and for maintenance

loans.name: Charlyn

texts.en:
Charlyn is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Charlyn is 32 years old and has five children who are in school.

Charlyn has a general store business in the Philippines. Charlyn requested a loan of 8,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more items like sardines, eggs, spices, diapers and other groceries.

Charlyn has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Charlyn would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more items like sardines, eggs, spices, diapers and other groceries.

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es: Felicita: Es una mujer miskita, originaria de Puerto Cabezas; tiene 46 años de edad, casada, tiene seis hijos: cuatro estudian su carrera universitaria y dos adolescentes que cursan su secundaria. Su esposo trabaja como conductor de un bus que viaja hacia las comunidades aledañas.  Desde hace 5 años estableció una pulpería, en anexo de madera que construyó  pegado a su vivienda, generando sus ingresos propios con lo cual aporta económicamente en el hogar. Solicita financiamiento para surtir más su pulpería y de esa manera también mejorar sus ingresos. Ella vende granos básicos, jabón, detergentes entre otros productos básicos. Sueña con llegar a tener un negocio prospero.
texts.en:
Felicita is a member of the Miskito ethnic group, and is originally from Puerto Cabezas. She is 46 years old, married, and has 6 children. Four of them are studying university degrees, and two teenagers are in high school. Her husband works as a bus driver that travels among the surrounding communities.

She started a grocery store 5 years ago in a wooden annex built onto her home. She earns her own income which contributes financially in the home. She is requesting a loan to further stock her store and in this way improve her income. She sells basic grains, soap, detergents and other basic products. She dreams of having a prosperous business.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, candies, rubber boots, dish soap, laundry detergent and other products.

loans.name: Miriam Leonor

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Bahía De Caraquez, conocida por sus hermosas playas, por su rica y variada gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente, cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Grupo  De Crédito San Agustín Km 20.
En este lugar vive la señora Miriam, tiene 46 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 26, 23 y 21 de edad, el menor estudia en universidad y es el que aun vive con ellos. El marido se dedica a la agricultura y al comercio. 
Doña Miriam junto a su esposo  tienen una tienda de víveres en su casa,  allí venden todo tipo de productos como granos, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, verduras y frutas, también productos de bazar y papelería, trabajan todos días y sus ventas son muy buenas ya que cuentan con muy buena clientela, ella también los días domingos prepara y vende el delicioso encebollado de pescado en su local y que es del agrado de sus clientes. Tienen más de 20 años con su negocio el cual es parte de su vida.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, entre otros productos de primera necesidad. Está desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los  créditos les ayudan mucho. Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
In the city of Bahía De Caraquez, known for it's beautiful beaches and it's rich and varied foods and the warmth of it's people, the members of the "San Agustín Km 20" communal bank meet every fortnight.

Miriam lives in this place. She is 46 years old is in a common-law relationship from which she has 3 children aged 26, 23 and 21 years old. The youngest studies at university and still lives with them. Her husband works in agriculture and commerce.

Miriam along with her husband have a food store in their house where they sell all types of products like grains, oil, detergent, vegetables, greens and fruits and also knick-knacks and paper products. They work every day and their sales are very good as they have a very good clientele. On Sundays she prepares and sells a delicious fish stew in her store that her customers love. They have been in business for more than 20 years and it is part of their lives.

They will use this loan to stock their store more. She will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, amongst other basic food items. She has been in the communal bank since it's inception and she likes it as the loans are very helpful. Her goal is to continue to advance with her business and that her store grows day by day.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent and other basic needs products.

loans.name: Yadira Genoveva

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos desde épocas coloniales se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo De Crédito solidarios.
En este lugar  vive la señora Yadira, tiene 47 años, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene  2 hijos de 13 y 8 años que  estudian en colegio y escuela. Su marido trabaja en una empresa privada. 
Doña Yadira es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para satisfacer sus necesidades, se dedica a la venta de zapatillas y sandalias, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale a recorrer en los momentos que esta mas desocupada de sus tareas en el hogar,  deja a crédito y cobra cada 15 días, lleva varios años dedicada a esta actividad la cual le deja buenos ingresos que le permiten pagar su crédito y ganar algo por su cuenta para el bien de su familia. 
Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar zapatillas y zapatos. Ella está desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Solidarios" (Supportive Ones) meets every two weeks in Portoviejo, known since colonial times as the city of the true tamarinds.

This is where señora Yadira lives. She is 47-years old, married and has two children, who are 13- and 8- years old respectively. They attend high school and primary school. Doña Yadira's husband works for a private company.

Doña Yadira is a woman who likes to work to meet her needs. She makes her living selling slippers and sandals. She makes her sales by going door to door when she doesn't have a lot of housework to do. She makes her sales on credit and collects payments every two weeks. Doña Yadira has been making her living this way for a number of years. It gives her a good income, which allows her to pay off her loans and earn something for herself and her family.

This loan will be used to purchase slippers and shoes. Doña Yadira has been with her communal bank since its inception. She likes it because of the help she gets from the loans. Her dream is to give her family the best.

loans.use: to purchase slippers and shoes.

loans.name: Mirla Angelica

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos desde épocas coloniales se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo De Crédito solidarios.
En este lugar vive la señora Mirla, tiene 30 años de edad, está casada pero aun no ha tenido  hijos. Su esposo es técnico en refrigeración.
Doña Mirla es una joven mujer que le gusta trabajar y así ganarse lo propio para satisfacer sus necesidades y de su hogar, ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa y zapatos por catalogo. Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta sale en los momentos en que no tiene mucho que hacer  aunque también vende en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos, ella deja a crédito y cobra cada ocho días, lleva más de 2  años en esta actividad con la cual se gana lo suyo pensando en un mejor porvenir.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa y zapatos. Esta desde el inicio en el  Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos sale adelante. Sus sueños son tener un bebé.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Solidarios" (Supportive Ones) meets every two weeks in Portoviejo, known since colonial times as the city of the true tamarinds. 
This is where señora Mirla lives.  She is 30-years old and married but doesn't have children yet.  Her husband is a refrigeration technician.  
Doña Mirla is a young woman who likes to work to earn her own things and meet her own needs as well as those of her household.  She makes her living selling clothing and shoes through catalog orders.  She makes her sales by going door to door at times when she doesn't have much to do.  However, the customers she knows well come to her home to make purchases.  Doña Mirla sells on credit and collects payments every week.  She has been in this business for over two years, and with it she earns her keep and plans for a better future. 
This loan will be used to purchase clothing and shoes.  Doña Mirla has been with the communal bank since its inception.  She likes it because with the loans, she is getting ahead.  Her dream is to have a baby.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Khalima

texts.ru: Халима вместе семьей проживает на районе Б.Гафуров. Она ответственная и шустрая женщина. Ей 56 лет. Она замужем и мать троих детей. Два сына и одна дочка. Дочка замужем, она живет отдельно. Ее сыновья женаты и живут с родителями. Муж Халимы работает таксистом на районе. Халима занимается шитьем женской одежды и одеяло. Она шьет национальную женскую, европейскую одежду и одеяло. Халима начала заняться этой деятельности 2000 году. Она любить свою работу. Ей этой деятельностью нравится сшить разную одежду и одеяло. Халиме в работе помогают невестки. Халима берет кредит, чтобы купить ткани для шитья. Она хочет увеличить производство товаров и продвинуть деятельность на новый уровень, соответственно увеличиться доход, благодаря которому Халима и ее семья может позволить себе новые экономические возможности. Вы можете поддержать Халиму. Халима ждет Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Khalima and her family live in the B. Gafurov district of Tajikistan.  Khalima is a smart and responsible woman.  She is 56 years old, married, and the mother of three children (two sons and a daughter).  Her daughter is married and she has left the family's house.  Her two sons are also married, and they have remained at home.  Khalima's husband has a local job: he works as a taxi driver.  Khalima herself sews women's clothes (traditional Tajik as well as western clothes) and blankets.  She started this activity in 2000 and she loves her work as it allows her to sew a variety of items.  Her daughters-in-law help her with her work.  

Khalima is taking a loan in order to buy fabrics for sewing.  She wants to increase her merchandise production and bring her activity to a higher level.  This will in turn help her to improve her income and create new economic opportunities for herself and her family.  Please support Khalima.  She is relying on your help.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and expand her activity.

loans.name: Elsa Mirella

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Bahía De Caraquez, conocida por sus hermosas playas, por su rica y variada gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente, cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Grupo  De Crédito San Agustín Km 20.
En este lugar vive la señora Elsa, tiene 41 años de edad, hace varios años su compañero de toda su vida falleció y quedo viuda pero de esta relación tuvo cuatro  hijos de 18, 15,  10 y 8 años  de edad, todos ellos estudian en universidad, colegio y los dos menores en escuela.
Doña Elsa es una gran madre  que para ganarse el sustento diario para ella y sus hijos  se dedica a la cría de pollos, chanchos y a la agricultura, tiene un lugar adecuado para la cría de sus animalitos los mismos que al venderlos le dejan buenos ingresos que le sirven para salir adelante y poder darles a sus hijos para sus estudios, aunque son muchos los gastos ella lucha día a día para que a ellos no les falte nada, ella en la época invernal arrienda un terreno en el cual siembra maíz lo cual está haciendo actualmente. De esta forma ella se gana la vida aunque de una forma dura pero por el bien de sus hijos.
Este crédito es para comprar alimentos para los pollos y chanchos  y semillas para la agricultura. Lleva 7 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan  los créditos. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The "San Agustín Km 20" communal bank meets every two weeks in Bahía De Caraquez, which is known for its beautiful beaches, its rich and varied cuisine and the warmth of its people.

This is where señora Elsa lives. She is 41-years old. A number of years ago her life-long partner passed away, leaving her a widow. She had four children with her husband. The children are 18-, 15-, 10- and 8-years old respectively. They all go to school- university, high school, and the two youngest are in primary school.

Doña Elsa is a great mother who, to earn her living and support herself and her children, raises chickens and pigs, and she farms. She has a place set up to raise her animals, which earn her a good income. With her income she is getting ahead and able to provide her children with their educations. Even so, there are a lot of expenses, and doña Elsa works hard day after day so that her children lack nothing. In the winter season, doña Elsa rents a plot of land on which she plants corn, which she is doing currently. This is how she earns her living; although it is tough, it is for the good of her children.

This loan is for the purchase of chicken and pig feed and for seeds for farming. Doña Elsa has been with her communal bank for seven years. She likes it because of the help she gets with the loans. Her dream is to give her children the best.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her chickens and pigs and to purchase seeds.

loans.name: Dina Del Cramen

texts.es:
Dina, de 50 años de edad, estudió hasta noveno grado de educación básica, es madre soltera de 4 hijos, todos ya son mayores de edad, solo una de sus hijas menores estudia.

Dina, es propietaria de un restaurante, en donde vende toda variedad de platillos de mar.

Dina, tiene ubicado su restaurant cerca de la playa, en el lugar donde ella reside, se ha dedicado a este negocio desde hace 7 años.- Antes, se dedicaba a la venta de pan y quesadillas, pero luego ella pensó en tener un lugar fijo en el cual le permitiera obtener más ingresos.

Ella está solicitando un crédito para comprar camarones, pescados, carnes, pollo, y variedad de bebidas refrescantes; todo con el fin de dar un mejor servicio y ofrecer una mayor variedad de comidas y bebidas a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Dina is 50 years old and studied up to Grade 9 of Basic education. She is a single mother of 4 children all now adults. Only one of her younger daughters study. Dina is the owner of a restaurant where she sells all types of seafood.

Dina's restaurant is located close to the beach in her place of residence. She has been running this business for 7 years. before she used to work selling bread and quesadillas but later she decide to have a fixed location which would allow her to obtain more income. She is requesting a loan to buy shrimp, fish, meat, chicken and a variety of refreshing drinks. All with the aim of providing better service and offering a greater variety of foods and drinks to her clients.

loans.use: to buy shrimp, fish, meat, chicken and a variety of refreshing drinks.

loans.name: Charlie

texts.en:
Charlie is 63 years old and a widowed mother with six children.  

Charlie is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Charlie requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Charlie has been raising pigs for 14 years now and has borrowed 21 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Charlie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 57 years old and married with six children. Two of her children are in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Teresita is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Teresita has been raising pigs for six years and earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Shaoying

texts.en:
Shaoying is a 36-year-old man who is married with two children who are both in school. Shaoying has had an unfortunate life; his father died at a young age, and his mother is illiterate but capable. He also has a big handicapped brother who broke his spine bones in an accident. He has been learning motor repair since he graduated from middle school; since then, he owned his own business. He and his wife run a car maintenance shop, and his mother and step-father are working at a construction site for a living. Shaoying and his wife need to take care of his two children and his disabled brother, but they have a very happy family. 

He completed a building in his hometown, but the decoration process isn’t finished yet. Due to the lack of enough funds, his business didn’t profit very well. Shaoying requested 20,000 CNY from Microcred. Since the whole family has moved the business to the suburbs, they need enough money to support their family and to purchase car parts. He believes that with the growing number of businesses, the family will have a bright future.

loans.use: to purchase car parts

loans.name: Vanessa

texts.en: Vanessa is 30 years old, married and has two children. She has been in the fishpond business for 10 years already. With her husband's help, they get their source of living from this. Vanessa became a member of GDMPC in 2014 and she borrowed a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional fingerlings for her fishpond to have more fish production, and also to buy feed for the feeding of the fingerlings. In the future, Vanessa wants her family to have better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional fingerlings for her fishpond to have more fish production, and also to buy feed for the feeding of the fingerlings

loans.name: María Tatiana

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Bahía De Caraquez, conocida por sus hermosas playas, por su rica y variada gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente, cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Grupo  De Crédito San Agustín Km 20.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 25 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene una  hija de año y medio de nacido. El marido trabaja en un comisariato.
Doña María es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para salir adelante junto a su familia, ella en sociedad con familiares se dedican a la agricultura, siembran sandia, melón, maíz, maní y verduras en toda época del año ya que cuentan con bombas de riego para esto, actualmente en esta época invernal han aumentado la cantidad de tierra para el cultivo ya que también han sembrado en terreno alto, por lo cual esperan tener una gran producción este año. 
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar semillas, fertilizantes y  pagar mano de obra para sembrar. Está desde el inicio  en el Grupo de Crédito y le  gusta porque le ayudan con los créditos. Sus sueños es tener una muy buena cosecha y darles lo mejor a su pequeña.
texts.en:
The "San Agustín Km 20" communal bank meets every two weeks in Bahía De Caraquez, which is known for its beautiful beaches, its rich and varied cuisine and the warmth of its people.

This is where señora María lives. She is 25-years old, married and has a daughter who was born a year and a half ago. Her husband works in an administrative office.

Doña María is a woman who likes to work to get herself and her family ahead. She farms jointly with her family members to earn a living. They plant watermelon, melon, corn, peanuts and vegetables all year round. They have water pumps to help with this. Currently, in this winter season, they have increased the amount of land they are planting. They have planted a high plot, from which they hope to get great production this year.

This loan is going to be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers and to pay for labor during planting. Doña María has been with the communal bank since its inception. She likes it because they help her with the loans. Her dreams are to have a very good harvest and to give her little one all the best.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia works hard to support her family. Sofia is widowed and has a general store business in the Philippines.
