Sofia requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Sofia has been in this business for 20 years now.

Sofia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Raina

texts.es: Raina: Es una mujer miskita,  originaria de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 55 años de edad, es madre soltería de siete hijos: Seis son mayores de edad e independientes y el menor de 16 años, estudia su segundo año de secundaria. Es una pequeña microempresaria que tiene una pequeña pulpería en un anexo de madera que construyó pegado a su vivienda. Está solicitando financiamiento para aumentar el inventario de los productos de granos básicos, sopas instantáneas, entre otros, que vende en su pequeño negocio. Su sueño es llegar a tener una vivienda de concreto (cemento) porque es de mayor durabilidad.
texts.en: Raina is a Miskita woman.  She is a native of Puerto Cabezas, 55-years old and the single mother of seven children.  Six of her children are grown and live independently.  The youngest, who is 16-years old, is in his second year of secondary school.  Raina is a small micro-entrepreneur who has a small grocery store run from a wooden unit, which she built and attached to her home.  She is requesting the loan to increase her inventory of staple grains, instant soups and other items that she sells in her small business.  Raina's dream is to one day have a concrete home (made of cement) because it would have greater durability.

loans.use: to purchase instant soups, laundry detergents, staple grains and snacks.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 43 years old and married with two children.  

Elizabeth is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Elizabeth requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Elizabeth has been raising pigs for six years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain this. 

In the future, Elizabeth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 59 years old and a widowed woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Nenita has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Nenita requested a loan of 8,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Nenita has been in this business for 18 years. In the future, Nenita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Rona

texts.en:
Rona is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rona is 45 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Rona has a personal collection business in the Philippines. Rona requested a loan of 5,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional stock like shampoo, cologne, and lotion.

Rona has been in this business for seven years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like shampoo, cologne, and lotion.

loans.name: Ronalyn

texts.en:
Ronalyn is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has an egg retailing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from her general store and raising livestock businesses. Ronalyn is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of eggs to offer for sale.

Ronalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of eggs to offer for sale.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is 46 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. Dolores works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of soft drinks, sugar, rice, eggs, milk, canned goods, etc.

Dolores has been in this business for five years. In the future, Dolores would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of soft drinks, sugar, rice, eggs, milk, canned goods, etc. for her general store business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and build a bathroom, septic tank, a toilet and water sources at their home to improve access to water and sanitation for their family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and build a bathroom, septic tank, and a toilet at her home to improve access to water and sanitation for her family.

loans.name: Xiomara Griselda

texts.es: Xiomara tiene 25 años de edad y habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y su pequeño hijo de 8 años de edad que se encuentra estudiando con su apoyo, ya que desea que pueda gozar de una mejor calidad de vida. Ella es una mujer laboriosa que al no encontrar otra manera de ganarse la vida decidió dedicarse a la elaboración y venta de tortillas actividad que realiza desde hace 1 año, por lo que cuenta con una buena cantidad de clientes. La vivienda de Xiomara es muy humilde y está hecha de madera y láminas viejas, pero lo que en verdad la tiene agobiada es el techo ya que este tiene muchas filtraciones, por lo que ella desea cambiarlo antes de la época de lluvias, y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, alambre y clavos para cambiar el techo de su vivienda lo antes posible, ella sabe que logrará cumplir con las cuotas que el crédito implica con las ganancias de su venta de tortillas.
texts.en:
Xiomara is 25 years old and lives in her own home along with her life partner and her young son, who is 8 years old.  He is in school with her support, since she wants him to be able to have a better quality of life.  She is a hard-working woman who, when she couldn’t find another way of making a living, decided to work preparing and selling tortillas. She has carried out this activity for a year, and thus she has a good amount of customers.

Xiomara’s house is very humble and is made of wood and old metal sheeting.  But what really weighs her down is the roof, since it has a lot of leaks.  Therefore, she wants to replace it before rainy season, for which she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in galvanized metal sheeting, wire, and nails to replace the roof of her home as soon as possible.  She knows that she will be able to make the payments that the loan entails with the profits from her tortilla sales.

loans.use: to invest in galvanized metal sheeting, wire, and nails to replace the roof of her house.

loans.name: Ma. Fatima

texts.en:
Ma. Fatima is 47 years old and married with seven children. Three of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Ma. Fatima has a general store business in the Philippines. Ma. Fatima requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more items like soft drinks, canned goods, soap and other groceries.

Ma. Fatima has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Ma. Fatima would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items like soft drinks, canned goods, soap and other groceries

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean is 37 years old and has four children. Mary Jean is married and has four children who are in school.

Mary Jean is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Mary Jean requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Mary Jean has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain this.

In the future, Mary Jean would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Mira

texts.en:
Mira is 32 years old, married and has two children who are both in school.

Mira is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Mira requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Mira has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain this.

In the future, Mira would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Esterlina

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Esterlina works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from direct selling personal collection products. Esterlina is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Josephine is 47 years old and has three children who are in school.

Josephine has a house rental business in the Philippines. Josephine requested a loan of 19,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase materials like wood, etc. for the maintenance of her business.

Josephine has been in this business for six years. In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase materials like wood, etc. for the maintenance of her business

loans.name: Dinalyn

texts.en:
Dinalyn is 25 years old and has two children. Dinalyn is married and has one child who is currently in school.

Dinalyn is in the agricultural business, farming bananas in the Philippines. Dinalyn requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Dinalyn has been farming bananas for six years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain this.

In the future, Dinalyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Edna

texts.en: Edna works hard to support her family. She is married and has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell. She has been in this business for seven years now. In the future, Edna would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Elena works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane and rice.  Elena is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her past one loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Ninfa works hard to support her family. She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store. Ninfa is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell for her rice retailing business.

Ninfa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 39 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of household goods to sell.

Erlinda has been in this business for 13 years.

In the future Erlinda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of household goods to sell.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
As a widow parent of one child, Agnes works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle shop business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store, buy and sell feeds. Agnes is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to purchase additional spare parts for her motorcycle shop business.

Agnes has been sustaining her business activities through her past one loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional spare parts for her mototcycle shop

loans.name: Dorica

texts.en:
Dorica is 46 years old and married with two children who are in school. Dorica works very hard to provide for them. She runs an ambulant vending business selling household goods in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell.

Dorica has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell.

loans.name: Sairagul

texts.ru: Сайрагул, 27 лет, замужем, мать 2 детей. У Сайрагул среднее образование. В настоящее время занимается животноводством и полеводством, по хозяйству помогает муж. Сайрагул с большой ответственностью относится к своему делу. Ежегодно обрабатывает 0,32 Га земли, выращивает картофель и кукурузу, в хозяйстве есть 2 коровы. Сайрагул обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) для покупки коровы с теленком для увеличения поголовья скота и объемов реализации экологически чистого, вкусного молока. Доходы от кредита Сайрагул направит на дальнейшее развитие бизнеса, также хочет накопить на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Sairagul is 27, married, and the mother of two children.  She has a secondary education.  At the moment, she is involved in animal husbandry and agriculture.  Her husband helps her to run the farming business.  Sairagul takes her business very seriously.  Every year, she grows potatoes and corn on 0.32 hectare of land, and she also owns two cows.

Sairagul has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC to request a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to purchase a cow with her calf, in order to increase her cattle headcount and her production and sales volume of delicious, organic milk.  She will use the earnings from her loan to further grow her business.  She also wants to save enough money to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy one dairy cow with her calf in order to produce and sell more organic milk.

loans.name: Gilna

texts.en:
Gilna works hard to support her family. Gilna is married and has a restaurant business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like carrots, cabbage, meat, fish, etc.

Gilna has been in this business for three years now.

In the future Gilna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like carrots, cabbage, meat, fish, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and build a bathroom, septic tank, and a toilet at their home to improve access to water and sanitation for their family.

loans.name: Hongbing

texts.en:
Hongbing is a 35-year-old woman who was suffering from incompatibility with her husband, and she and her husband divorced last year. Now she raises her daughter alone.

Hongbing has engaged in a garment processing business for a long time. The payment is meager, which can only make end in domestic life. She lives with her older sister at present to save a house rent. As her daughter comes to college, the tuition and fees have run out of their savings. She had a very difficult life. This year, her daughter was admitted by a dancing training school, but the training costs a lot of money. 

Hongbing requested a loan of 10,000 CNY from Microcred. She wants to use part of the money to support her daughter to finish her dance lessons. The rest of the money will be used to expand her business. She wants to rely on her own hands to support her family.

loans.use: to cover tuition fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and build a bathroom, septic tank, and a toilet at home to improve access to water and sanitation for her family.

loans.name: Kylychbek

texts.ru: Кылычбек, 55 лет, женат, отец 6 детей. У Кылычбека среднее образование, в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи на протяжении 14 лет занимается полеводством и животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду и целеустремленности Кылычбека, в его хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 2 коровы, 15 овец, на ежедневной основе он продает молоко. Также есть земельный участок мерою 7,0 ГА собственной земли, где он выращивает люцерну и ячмень для реализации. Ежемесячный доход Кылычбека составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, он обратился в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойных коров для увеличения объемов реализации молока. Доходы от кредита Кылычбек планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие его бизнеса, он хочет приобрести автомобиль для семьи.
texts.en:
Kylychbek is 55 years old, married, and the father of six children.  He has a secondary education. For the past 14 years, he has been involved in agriculture and animal husbandry, two activities which constitute an additional source of income for his family.  Thanks to his very hard work and determination, he currently owns two cows and 15 sheep, and he sells milk on a daily basis.  He also owns seven hectares of land on which he grows alfalfa and barley for resale.  

Kylychbek makes a monthly income of 15,000 som (KGS).  In order to further grow his farming business, he has turned to Bai Tushum CJSC for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS).  He will use this loan to buy some additional dairy cows, in order to produce and sell higher volumes of milk.  He is planning to use the earnings from his loan to further develop his business.  He would also like to purchase a car for his family.

loans.use: to buy dairy cows in order to produce and sell higher volumes of milk.

loans.name: Remilyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Remilyn works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from charcoal retailing and raising chickens. Remilyn is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy additional stock of rice to sell to customers.

Remilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of rice to sell

loans.name: Nanette

texts.en:
Nanette is 52 years old and married with four children.  With two children in school, Nanette works very hard to provide for them.

Nanette runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

Nanette has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Nanette would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
Analie is 31 years old and has three children. She is married and has two children who are in school.

Analie is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Analie requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Analie has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain this.

In the future, Analie would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Gina works hard to support her family.

She has a rice farming business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Gina is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to  buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for her rice farming business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy poultry.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 42 years old and married with six children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Grace has borrowed and paid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell charcoal for eight years and also earns an income from selling bananas and from fish vending.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 51 years old and has two children.  Vilma is widow and both of her children are in school.

Vilma is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Vilma requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Vilma has been raising pigs for thirty years now, and has borrowed 27 times in the past from NWTF to sustain this.

In the future, Vilma would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is single and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Sonia requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Sonia has been in this business for eight years now, and also earns additional income from farming rice and tailoring.

In the future, Sonia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jessielyn

texts.en:
Jessielyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a jeepney transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to purchase additional spare parts for her jeep transport business.

Jessielyn has been in this business for 10 years. Jessielyn earns more income from food vending.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her jeepney

loans.name: Ermelinda

texts.en:
Ermelinda is 44 years old and married with three children. Two of her children are in school.

Ermelinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Ermelinda has borrowed and paid 35 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Ermelinda aspires to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is 34 years old and a married woman with three children. Two of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Leah has a fishing business in the Philippines. Leah requested a loan of 15,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

Leah has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Leah would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Margarita works hard to support her family.

She has a dry goods business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Margarita is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stock of plastic ware and footwear to offer for sale.

Margarita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of plastic ware and footwear to offer for sale.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 36 years old and a married woman with six children. Four of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Mary Grace has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Mary Grace requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stock of rice to sell.

Mary Grace has been in this business for five years. In the future, Mary Grace would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 30 years old and married with two children, both of whom are in school.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Evelyn is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF in order to buy more livestock to raise.

Evelyn has been raising livestock for three years and also earns additional income from E-loading (mobile prepaid load).

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream; to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more livestock to raise.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is 48 years old and married with one child in school.

Melinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

Melinda has borrowed and repaid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 14 years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Melinda aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Bintou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe créé depuis le 19 Juillet 2002, il vient d’entamer son vingt quatrième cycles et les femmes sont solidaires entre elles et vivent dans le même village. L’activité principale est le petit commerce.
 Madame Bintou (assise à l’extrême droite) est l’emprunteuse vedette du  groupe. Elle est âgée de 53 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants dont un garçon et 02 filles. Elle est vendeuse d’encens, de savon et de tissu qu’elle achète a Dakar pour les revendre dans son village.
Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter 20 kg d’encens, 10 cartons de savon et 10 pièces de tissu.
Les bénéfices lui serviront de participer à la dépense familiale et de renforcer ses épargnes mieux prendre en charge les besoins de sa famille et de renforcer son épargne.







Ce groupe créé depuis le 19 Juillet 2002, il vient d’entamer son vingt quatrième cycles et les femmes sont solidaires entre elles et vivent dans le même village. L’activité principale est le petit commerce.

 Madame Bintou (assise à l’extrême droite) est l’emprunteuse vedette du  groupe. Elle est âgée de 53 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants dont un garçon et 02 filles. Elle est vendeuse d’encens, de savon et de tissu qu’elle achète a Dakar pour les revendre dans son village.

Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter 20 kg d’encens, 10 cartons de savon et 10 pièces de tissu.

Les bénéfices lui serviront de participer à la dépense familiale et de renforcer ses épargnes mieux prendre en charge les besoins de sa famille et de renforcer son épargne.
texts.en:
This group was created July 19, 2002, and has just started its twenty-fourth cycle. The women are united and live in the same village. Their main activity is  small business.

Mrs. Bintou (seated at the far right) is the group's featured borrower. She is 53 years old, and is married with three children, a boy and two girls. She sells incense, soap and cloth she buys in Dakar for resale in her village.

With this loan, she intends to buy 20 kg of incense, 10 boxes of soap and 10 lengths of fabric.

Profits will be used to participate in family expenditures, strengthen her savings and better support her family's needs.

loans.use: 20 kg of incense, 10 boxes of soap and 10 lengths of fabric.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en: As a simple housewife, Nilda makes a living by raising pigs, in support of her husband to sustain their family. She was at her weakest moment when she didn't have enough capital for her business. When she joined PMPC, she was truly grateful to avail herself of credit to fully support her business. Just as how she takes care of her pig raising business, so it is with her membership with PMPC. She wants to maintain her membership in good standing so she can always run for any financing needs. Now, the loan of PHP 10,000 will help her build a concrete pig pen that would support sanitation and care for the environment.

loans.use: to build a concrete pig pen.

loans.name: Linah

texts.en:
Linah is a brilliant, hardworking, 66-year-old Kenyan lady whose home is on a small farmland in a remote village called Yemit. She gets a lot of help and support running her business from her handsome husband and their lovely children. 

In a bid to expand her farm, Linah is seeking a KES 30,000 loan to purchase farm inputs, farm implements and animal feed. Currently, she sells sheep meat (mutton), wool, and crops at Yemit . 

To boost the quantity of produce she sells, she needs a loan from Kiva lenders to purchase farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer. She also needs to purchase tools and implements that will be used to work on the increased acreage. 

Linah also grows fodder for her cattle. With the loan, she will buy a wider range of feed from those in the locality. Linah will use any money made from this investment to help her husband meet the family's basic needs. She will also save for future investments into the business.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs, farm implements and animal feed.

loans.name: Coumba's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe créé depuis le 19 Juillet 2002, il vient d’entamer son vingt quatrième cycles et les femmes sont solidaires entre elles et vivent dans le même village. L’activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame Coumba (assise à l’extrême droite) est une des femmes les plus engagées et plus dynamiques du groupe dans la gestion du groupement ainsi que de ses activités génératrices de revenu. Elle s’active dans le commerce de Tissus teintés et de chaussures qu’elle achète à Dakar et vient revendre dans son village. Elle est mariée est mère de huit enfants dont quatre filles et quatre garçons tous majeurs.

Avec son nouveau prêt elle désire acheter 16 tissus teintés à  6000f l’un, et 30 paires de chaussures à 3000f l’une.

Les bénéfices lui permettent de développer son épargne dans le banc villageois
texts.en:
This group was created July 19, 2002, and has just started its twenty-fourth cycle. The women are united and live in the same village. Their main activity is small business.

Mrs. Coumba (seated at the far right) is one of the most committed and dynamic women in the group, and is involved in the group's management and its income-generating activities.

She is active in trading colored fabrics and shoes she purchases in Dakar to be resold in her village. She is a married mother of eight adult children: four girls and four boys.

With the new loan, she wants to buy 16 lengths of colored fabric at 6,000 francs each, and 30 pairs of shoes at 3,000 francs a pair.

Profits will enable her to increase her savings in the "banc villageois" loan association.

loans.use: buy 16 lengths of colored fabric at 6,000 francs each, and 30 pairs of shoes at 3,000 francs a pair.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia has a wide experience in farming activities. She has mastered corn farming from growing, caring, harvesting, and earning income as well. Lucia has supported her husband doing this type of work. 

Like her farm, Lucia has nurtured her member relationship with PMPC and has maintained a good repayment record. She knows she can always turn to the Cooperative for her financial needs. Recently, she applied for a loan to buy corn fertilizer for more produce. 

Someday, Lucia hopes to purchase more agricultural land to cultivate that will potentially add income for the family.

loans.use: to buy corn fertilizer for more produce.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 54 years old and married with one child.

Alicia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stock of groceries to sell.

Alicia has previously borrowed and re-paid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 30 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Alicia aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Creciendo Juntas Group

texts.es:
El grupo cuenta con actividades consolidadas que le permiten tener una buena gestión de su empresa. El trabajo en equipo ha permitido tener un crecimiento importante en el patrimonio que ha traído beneficios a todas sus familias. Mantienen actividades de comercio, ofreciendo una buena calidad del producto y facilidades de pago para sus  clientes.

Mayra una integrante de este grupo desde el inicio en la zona de Puntarenas, para el apoyo de mujeres que desean superarse y salir a delante, vive en el Barrio 20 de Noviembre en Puntarenas, lugar de mucha pobreza y problemas sociales, tiene 50 años de edad y vive con sus 2 hijas. Con el esfuerzo y trabajo ha logrado dar estudio a sus hijas; por medio de su microempresa, dedicada al comercio . Se ha mantenido informando a mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras,  para apoyarlas con crédito por parte de Fundación Mujer, siendo el único ingreso de la casa ya que su esposo está discapacitado. Ella ofrece productos de catálogo como ropa, perfumes y bisutería.
	El objetivo de este préstamo es comprar mercadería, como productos de catálogo que va a comprar por pedido de la gente,  ya sea para regalar  o para auto regalarse, situación que la clienta, por su experiencia y conocimiento del mercado aprovecha. Mayra pertenece al  Banco Mujer Creciendo Juntas.
	Entre sus metas destaca salir adelante para que sus hijos y ella tengan un futuro mejor, que puedan estudiar y apoyar los ingresos del hogar. Por ahora la dificultada más grande ha sido la económica, pero han encontrado en este programa un apoyo para su micro emprendimiento.
Este es  un grupo consolidado, han trabajado con Fundación Mujer desde el año 2004, realizando, con esta, más de 10 solicitudes de crédito, pasando por su grupo mas de 20 mujeres de la comunidad de Veinte de Noviembre en la zona de Puntarenas. Han demostrado trabajo, crecimiento, unión y solidaridad, una buena conducta de pago y ha renovado sus préstamos año a año. Sus actividades están generando ingresos que les permiten viajar al exterior a comprar mercadería (Nicaragua y Panamá) contar con locales propios, maquinarias propias, y ofrecer una variada gama de productos en los lugares donde viven.
texts.en:
The group has established activities that allow them to have good management of their business.  Team work has allowed them to have major growth in their assets, which has benefited all of their families.  They carry out their commercial activities, offering good quality products and good payment terms to their customers.

Mayra has been a member of this group since the beginning in the zone of Puntarenas, for the support of women who want to better themselves and get ahead. She lives in Barrio 20 de Noviembre in Puntarenas, a place of great poverty and social problems.  She is 50 years old and lives with her two daugthers.  With effort and work, she has been able to provide education to her daughters.  With her business, she works in sales.  She has supported herself by informing hardworking, enterprising women to support them with the loan from Fundación Mujer.  That is her home’s only income since her husband is disabled.  She offers catalog products such as clothing, perfume, and costume jewelry.

The objective of this loan is to buy merchandise, such as catalog products, which she will purchase on people’s requests, whether the products be for gift giving or for treating oneself.  The borrower makes the most of this situation with her experience and her knowledge of the market.  Mayra belongs to the Banco Mujer Creciendo Juntas [the Women Growing Together Bank].

Getting ahead stands out among her goals, so that her she and her children may have a better future, and so that they can go to school and support the household income.  For now, the greatest difficulty has been economic, but she has found support for her micro-enterprise in this program.  This is an established group.  They have worked with Fundación Mujer since 2004 and, with this request, have made more than 10 loan requests.  More than 20 women from the community of 20 de Noviembre in the Puntarenas zone have passed through their group.  They have demonstrated work, growth, unity, and solidarity, good management of their payments, and they have renewed their loans year after year.  Their activities are generating income that allow them to travel abroad and buy merchandise (Nicaragua and Panama), to have their own venues, their own equipment, and to offer a varied range of products in the places where they live.

loans.use: to buy items requested by her customers.

loans.name: Cfjdt 7 Group

texts.fr: CFJDT 7 est un sous groupe de la convergence des femmes et jeunes pour le développement de Tassette. Il est composé de 5 personnes et font pratiquement les mêmes activités. Ils habitent dans le même village et organisent des cotisations mensuelles. Il a comme président Madame Nogaye qui est mariée et mère de famille. Elle évolue dans l'agriculture et la commercialisation des fruits et légumes. Nogaye a une expérience de plus de 10 ans et aide son mari dans la gestion des charges quotidiennes de sa famille et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Elle veut ce prêt pour acheter des semences et intrant pour faire l'agriculture des céréales comme le mil, le sorgho, l'arachide. Elle démarre sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 20h. Elle souhaite avoir avec l'aide de l'institution une nouvelle boutique de denrées alimentaires. Ainsi elle pourra augmenter ses revenus et diversifier ses activités.
texts.en:
CFJDT 7 is a subgroup of the convergence of women and youth in the development of Tassette. It consists of five people who practice similar activities. They live in the same village and organize monthly contributions.

The president Mrs Nogaye is married and a mother. She is active in agriculture and marketing fruits and vegetables. Nogaye has over ten years' experience and helps her husband in managing her family's daily expenses and her children's tuition fees.

She wants this loan to buy seeds and inputs to cultivate cereals such as millet, sorghum, and groundnuts. She starts her day at 8 am to finish at 8 pm. With the help of the institution she wants to open a new food store. Thus she will be able to increase her revenues and diversify her activities.

loans.use: buy seeds and inputs for vegetable farming

loans.name: Cfjdt 9 Group

texts.fr: CFJDT 9 est un sous groupement de la convergence des femmes et jeunes pour le développement de Tassette. Il est composé de 5 personnes qui habitent toutes dans le même village et pratiquent les mêmes activités. Ils se réunissent chaque fin de mois pour organiser des tontines mensuelles. Le président Ibrahima est un homme marié et père de famille qui évolue dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Il a une expérience de plus de 10 ans  et commence sa journée à 9h pour la terminer à 19h. Ibrahima sollicite ce montant pour acheter des semences et intrant pour la pratique de l'agriculture des céréales comme le mil, le sorgho, l'arachide et les haricots. Avec l'aide de l'institution, il voudrait à l'avenir avoir une voiture de transport en commun. Ainsi, il pourra augmenter ses revenus et diversifier ses activités. De ce fait il pourra aussi améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille
texts.en:
CFJDT 9 is a subgroup of the convergence of women and youth in the development of Tassette. It consists of five people who all live in the same village and practice similar activities. They get together at the end of each month to organise monthly "tontines" (savings group).

The president Ibrahima is a married man and a father. He manages his family's daily expenditures and his children's tuition fees. He has over ten years' experience and starts his day at 9 am to finish at 7 pm.

Ibrahima wants this loan to buy seeds and inputs to cultivate cereals such as millet, sorghum, groundnuts and beans. With the help of the institution, he would like to own a public transportation vehicle. Thus he will be able to increase his revenues, diversify his activities, and consequently improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: buy seeds and inputs for farming

loans.name: Domingo

texts.en:
Domingo is a farmer in Tambulig. He learned about Paglaum MPC and the financial assistance it extends, and he decided to try his luck, so he took out a loan to jump-start his rice production. After several months, he was able to return his borrowed capital. 

To this day, Domingo feels he owes his good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted him with the money he used for his business. 

Recently he has taken out another loan to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer for the next cropping season. He wishes to sustain his business and be able to supply rice to neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 61 years old and lives in Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married with 3 adult children. 

Rosalina manages an internet cafe with her husband, and she has been doing this for 5 years already. She earns approximately PHP 10,000 each month doing this type of business activity. She has requested a loan to purchase an additional computer set unit. 

Rosalina has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. In the future, she hopes to expand their business.

loans.use: to purchase an additional computer set unit

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza landed at the right place for the capital she needed when she joined PMPC. She knew this would be her last chance to get back on her feet when she went broke after her first business went bad. PMPC came as a rescue to Flordeliza and lent her money when she needed it most. 

Now she has taken out another loan for the next cropping season. She has borrowed an amount for land and seedbed preparation.  

Flordeliza perseveres and always believes in reaching her goals in order to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparation

location.town: Pagadian - Balintawak, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a hardworking mother from Bato, Plaridel. She is 49 years old and separated. She supports her three children by being a businesswoman who makes copra. She buys whole coconuts for this. 

Lydia became a member of the cooperative in order to gain access to insurances and credit. Now she has applied for a loan to buy whole coconuts for making copra. 

She hopes to succeed in this business and continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy whole coconuts to make copra (dried coconut meat used for oil production)

loans.name: Elengie

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Elengie works hard to support her family.

She has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from personal product sales. Elengie is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase more sacks of charcoal to resell.

Elengie has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Victoria Maribel

texts.es: Victoria tiene 47 años de edad y habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo desde hace 30 años. Ella es una mujer tenaz que luego de sacar adelante a sus hijos se gana la vida con su negocio de venta de productos básicos en su vivienda actividad que lleva realizando 8 años y que le ha permitido mantener la economía de su hogar. Victoria desea mejorar un poco la calidad de vida de su familia, es por ello que ha decidido  instalar ladrillo de piso en su vivienda la cual ha logrado construir poco a poco a base de mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena y ladrillo de piso para instalar en su vivienda lo antes posible y de esta manera seguir mejorando la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Victoria is 47 years old and has lived in a privately owned house with her husband for 30 years. Victoria is a tenacious woman who, now having raised her children, earns a living selling groceries from her home. She has had this business for eight years and it has allowed her to support her household economy.

Victoria wants to improve her family’s quality of life a little and so has decided to lay a brick floor in her home. She has been able to do this work gradually, with a lot of effort and sacrifice. Victoria is applying for a loan from FUSAI in order to buy cement, sand and floor bricks to lay a floor in her home as soon as possible and continue improving her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and floor bricks to lay a floor in her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies such as reams of papers, toner for photocopiers, and beauty products such as dyes, massage products, and shampoo.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio es un joven sencillo y busca mecanismos para generar sus ingresos, él es soltero tiene 25 años, vive junto a sus padres y hermanos en una comunidad llamada el Tablón. 
Antonio es un hombre muy dedicado a su trabajo, ya que lo que él busca es superación en la vida y  apoyar a su familia, Pues Antonio es agricultor anteriormente él sembraba muy poco, la superación con la agricultura, fue a través de un prestamo que solicito en ADICLA, de ese prestamo compro más semillas, fertilizantes e insumos y pudo sembrar más, le fue muy bien en la cosecha obtuvo ganancias y con la ganancia pudo comprarse un pick-up, y esto le facilita ahora trasportar su cosecha desde el campo hasta el lugar donde vende, pues con este resultado Antonio solicita nuevamente un segundo prestamo que le servirá nuevamente para comprar semillas y fertilizantes y con las ganancias pagara nuevamente este prestamo, y tiene esperanzas que lograra alcanzar otro sueño, 
 Lo que anhela Antonio  ahora es construir una su  casa donde pueda darse un descanso después de un agotado trabajo en el campo día tras día. Antonio es un joven muy responsable y sincero.
texts.en:
Antonio is a simple young man who is looking for ways to earn an income. He is 25 years old and single. He lives with his parents and siblings in a community called El Tablón.

Antonio is very dedicated to his work as, through it, he is looking to do better in life and support his family. Antonio is a farmer. He used to sow very little but is doing more as a result of a loan from ADICLA. He used a previous loan to buy more seeds, fertilisers and supplies to sow more. His last harvest was very good; he earned more profits that he used to buy a pick-up truck that makes it easier to transport his harvest from the fields to his point of sale.

Following this positive result with his previous loan, Antonio is applying for a second loan in order to buy seeds and fertilisers. He will use his profits to pay off this loan, and hopes to achieve another dream: to build a house where he can relax after the exhausting work in the field every day. Antonio is a very responsible and sincere young man.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilisers.

loans.name: María Fernanda

texts.es:
María Fernanda es una joven de 24 años, nació en el Municipio de Montero del Departamento de Santa Cruz de la Sierra – Bolivia y vive con sus padres. Actualmente se encuentra culminado sus estudios de la carrera de Contaduría Pública en la Universidad Privada CUMBRE, para lo cual solicita un crédito educativo.
María Fernanda trabaja desde hace aproximadamente un año en una fábrica de Cerámicas donde se desempeña como Auxiliar Contable con el objetivo de tener mayor experiencia laboral y de esta manera estar preparada al momento de obtener su titulación. Ella manifiesta que le apasiona el área de las Finanzas y todo lo que se relaciona con los números es por ello que escogió esta carrera y considera que existe una alta demanda de profesionales en el mercado laboral. 
Ella comenta que su mayor inspiración para salir adelante son sus padres y anhela poderles apoyar económicamente, para  mejorar su calidad de vida.
María Fernanda menciona además que lo que la diferencia de otros estudiantes son sus deseos de superación y perseverancia. Su sueño es trabajar en una prestigiosa empresa de la ciudad de Santa Cruz.  
María Fernanda se siente feliz y agradecida con aquellas personas que a través de sus recursos económicos le brindan la oportunidad de alcanzar sus sueños.
texts.en:
María Fernanda is a young woman of 24 years. She was born in the Montero municipality of the Santa Cruz de la Sierra department of Bolivia, and lives with her parents. María is currently finishing her studies in public accounting at the CUMBRE private university. She is applying for an education loan.

For about a year now, María has been working at a ceramics factory as an accounting assistant with the aim of gaining more work experience and to be prepared for the end of her studies. María says that she is passionate about finances and numbers, hence why she chose this career. She believes that there is a high demand for professionals on the labour market.

María says that her biggest inspiration to move forward is her parents. She wants to support them financially in order to improve their quality of life.

María also says that what differentiates her from other students is her strong will to better herself, and her perseverance. María’s dream is to work for a prestigious business in the city of Santa Cruz.

María feels happy and grateful to those who, with their own money, are providing María with an opportunity to achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to pay for her degree in public accounting.

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Adjo, âgée de 33 ans est une femme au foyer. Elle vit avec son mari et ses quatre enfants à Lomé dans le quartier d’adakpamé. Elle vend des poissons fumés au marché d’Adakpamé et ses environs, et s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au port de pêche de lomé. Adjo sollicite un prêt pour financer spécialement son activité génératrice de revenu qu’elle trouve rentable. Grâce à ce prêt, Adjo pourrait avoir une épargne pour étendre son commerce et soutenir ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire.
texts.en:
33-year-old Adjo is a housewife. She lives with her husband and four children in the Adakpame district of Lomé. She sells smoked fish in the Adakpame market and its surrounding area, and resupplies twice a month at Lomé's fishing port.

Adjo is requesting a loan to finance her income-generating activity, which she considers to be profitable. Thanks to this loan, Adjo can start saving to expand her business and support her children's education.

loans.use: buy 41 baskets of smoked fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in galvanized layers, wood, nails and wires to repair her house.

loans.name: Mayner Benjamin

texts.es: Mayner es un joven de 23 años de edad, el aprendió este arte desde pequeño; su padre le enseño a reparar motocicletas y gracias a sus enseñanzas, creció dentro de él el amor por esta profesión. Hoy en día él está dedicado al mantenimiento y reparación de motocicletas, en esta actividad cuenta con quince años de experiencia, sin embargo este emprendedor hombre también es comerciante, él ofrece productos cárnicos, ropa, calzado y electrodomésticos a sus vecinos y amigos, a quienes les brinda facilidad de pago. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en la compra repuestos para su taller de motocicletas y de carnes frías, ropa, calzado.  Esta inversión es muy necesaria puesto que mejora los tiempos de entrega de los productos y servicios, así mismo incrementa la credibilidad de su negocio y masifica la ramificación de la satisfacción.  Mayner es padre de un hijo de cuatro años de edad a quien desea continuar educando y ofreciendo bienestar, su desafío es continuar trabajando comprometido, para concluir la meta a futuro de ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Mayner is a 23-year old young man who learned the job when he was a boy. His father taught him to repair motorcycles and thanks to that he started to love this profession. He currently makes a living maintaining and repairing motorcycles and has 15 years of experience. He is also an entrepreneur and sells meat products, clothes, shoes and appliances to his neighbors and friends, to whom he offers good payment conditions. 

He is currently using his first Kiva credit through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, a loan that he will use to buy replacement parts for his garage and cold meats, clothes and shoes' store. This investment will improve delivery times, increase the business credibility and intensify satisfaction. 

Mayner has a 4-year old son. His goal is to keep giving him education and quality of life, and his challenge is to keep working towards his future goal of expanding his business.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts for his motorcycles' garage and his cold meats, clothes and shoes' store.

loans.name: Paz

texts.en: Paz has always had an enthusiasm for farming. She has cultivated rice land in Tambulig and has good yield and earnings from doing this type of work. Recently, she applied for a loan to pay for labour and fertilizer. This will ensure that the rice field is grows well. Paz knows that she has to get things right to yield more income from this cropping season. In the future, Paz hopes to buy a hauling truck for easy transport of produce.

loans.use: to pay for labour and fertilizer.

loans.name: Felipe

texts.en: Felipe is 79 years old. He is known in Tambulig area for his rice mill. He is actively participating in the various programs and services that the PMPC offers. He hopes to live comfortably, in a decent house, for which he has applied for a loan to pay for labour, paint and cement. Felipe hopes to sustain his business so that he can continually provide for his family.

loans.use: to pay for labour, paint and cement.

loans.name: Edelita

texts.en:
Edelita is 45 years old and married with six children. Four of her children are in school.

Edelita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of rice, snack food, canned goods and other groceries.

Edelita has borrowed and paid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Edelita aspires to save enough money so she continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of rice, snack food, canned goods and other groceries.

loans.name: Emmy

texts.en:
Hello lenders, meet Emmy. She is a 54-year-old smallholder farmer based in Kapsowar, which is a small rural town in the North rift region of Kenya. Emmy and her husband are blessed to have a beautiful and adorable family. Emmy has been a farmer for more than 4 years. She keeps poultry for eggs and grows maize and vegetables for sale. She also holds a day job and engages in small businesses on the side whenever an opportunity crosses her path. Despite the rapid fluctuation of prices in the market, Emmy is very passionate and optimistic about the future of horticultural farming in Kenya. 

Emmy is seeking a loan to expand her horticultural farm. This move is quite a big deal for her. With your loan, Emmy seeks to continue growing different varieties of crops but on a greater scale. The demand for vegetables and other greens in Kapsowar and other parts of the country is very high. Income from this venture will negate the high farming expenses she has to deal with currently. In the long run, with increased income, she will finally be able to satisfy her family’s basic needs. She stated, “In the future, I will be able to provide food for my family and also educate my children." With a loan you will be able to support a mother who is full of life and energy for her family!

loans.use: To grow her horticulture/farming business

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Letecia works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store, and buying and selling frozen foods.  Letecia is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of ingredients to sell like meat, fish, vegetables, etc for her restaurant business.

Letecia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of ingredients to sell like meat, fish, vegetables, etc

loans.name: Neri Maritza

texts.es:
Neri, de 46 años de edad, no estudio porque sus padres no tenían suficientes recursos económicas, está casada, tiene tres hijos, de los cuales uno de ellos está acompañando y los otros dos viven con ella, su esposo se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura.

Neri, trabaja en la sastrería, ella realiza este trabajo desde hace más de cinco años y siempre lo ha hecho en su casa.

El crédito lo necesita directamente para construir su casa, ya que  la que tienen está en mal estado y ha decidido empezar a construirla nuevamente con la ayuda de sus hijos.

Sus sueños a futuro son en primer lugar terminar de construir su casa, luego quiere comprar otra máquina de coser ya que la que tiene, casi no funciona muy bien, ella desea que sus hijos se superen en el trabajo para que tengan una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Neri is a 46-year old woman who did not attend school because her parents did not have enough financial resources. She is married and has three children, one of whom lives with his partner. The other two live with her and her husband works in agriculture. Neri has ran her tailor shop for more than 5 years and works at her house. 

She will use the loan to rebuild her house, which is in bad condition. She will build it again with her children. Her dream is to finish the house and to buy a new sewing machine, given that hers does not work well. Her final goal is for her children to self-improve to have a better life.

loans.use: to build her house.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 42 years old and married with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like coffee, chips, eggs, bread, soap, etc.

Lourdes has borrowed and repaid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice and gasoline.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like coffee, chips, eggs, bread, soap, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a new ceiling for her house.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es: Esther: Es una mujer alegre, emprendedora, originaria de Bilwi, Puerto Cabezas, tiene 34 años de edad,  casada, tiene cuatro hijos: Tres son adolescentes, estudian su secundaria y un pequeño de un año de edad. Su esposo es albañil pero sin ingreso fijo, por lo que ella   decidió emprender su pequeño negocio hace 12 años. Con apoyo de su esposo construyó un anexo de madera en su casa donde estableció su pequeña pulpería en la que vende productos básicos, caramelos, galletas, generando ingresos propios con lo cual asegura la alimentación y educación de sus hijos. Está solicitando un crédito para comprar más mercadería, para diversificar su oferta, comprar en Managua, ropa, accesorios para damas y calzado en Masaya. Su sueño es llegar a ser una exitosa comerciante con un negocio próspero.
texts.en:
Esther is a cheerful and entrepreneurial woman who comes from Bilwi, Puerto Cabezas. She is 34 years old, married and mother of 4 children, 3 of whom are teenagers and attend high-school. Her youngest child is only 1. Her husband is a builder without a fixed income, which is why she decided to start her small business 12 years ago. She built a wood annex to their house with the support of her husband and started a grocery store where she sells basic products, candy, cookies, etc. The income she obtains goes to food and education for her children. 

She is requesting a loan to buy more products and diversify her offer. She plans to buy clothes and accessories in Managua and shoes in Masaya. Her dream is to become a successful saleswoman with a successful business.

loans.use: to buy basic products, candy, cookies and sodas, among others.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en: Marjorie is a hardworking mother who pushes her ability when it comes to her hog raising business. She is hands-on in her chosen business to support her family. Recently, she availed a loan to purchase bags of animal feed. Aside from her project of concreting the pig pens, she thought of adding heads of pigs for commercial sale. Someday she hopes to open a meat shop in the nearby town.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feed

loans.name: Jose Antolin

texts.es:
José, de 41 años de edad, no estudio debido a que sus padres no le dieron la oportunidad, ya que trabajaba mucho en la agricultura, está casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios del hogar, mientras que 2 de sus hijos le ayudan en los trabajos agrícolas.

José, trabaja desde los 6 años de edad, motivo por el cual se ha empeñado en enseñar a sus hijos a que sean personas responsables, trabajadoras y cumplidoras de sus compromisos.

El dinero del crédito lo ocupará para comprar madera y la lámina para cambiar el techo de la casa, ya que está un poco deteriorada.

Sus sueños son, continuar trabajando en la agricultura, ya que le gusta mucho y mejorar poco a poco su vivienda, ya que es importante para el darle mejores condiciones a su familia.
texts.en:
José is a 41-year old man who did not attend school. His parents did not give him that opportunity as he had to work in agriculture. He is married and his wife works at the house while his 2 sons help with the farming work. José has been working since he was 6, which is why he wants to teach his sons to be responsible, hard-working and reliable with their commitments. 

He will use the loan to buy wood and layers to replace the ceiling of the house, which is damaged. His dream is to keep working in agriculture, which he enjoys, and to improve his house little by little so that he can provide his family with better life conditions.

loans.use: to buy wood and layers to replace the ceiling of his house.

loans.name: Willimina

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Willimina, 29 years old, who is from Litein, a remote rural town in the South Rift area of Kenya. This is a region with good weather patterns that favor crop and animal farming. She resides with her handsome husband and they are blessed with beautiful children. Willimina has been actively involved in mixed farming for the past 10 years and she sells milk, eggs, and various varieties of food crops at a local market and to her neighbors. Litein is one of the places with conditions that favor horticulture farming: good climate, soils, a transport system, and market. 

Willimina has always wanted to diversify and start horticultural farming, but the biggest challenge she has been facing is a lack of funds. She is therefore requesting a loan to start horticultural farming. Through the Tuiyobet self-help group, whose members co-guarantee each other to secure a loan, Willimina joined Juhudi Kilimo, a micro finance organization that supports young and enterprising farmers. With your loan, she intends to buy good quality vegetable seeds, flowers and potatoes. Proximity to an airstrip will allow her to transport the produce faster to an international market, hence enabling her to make more money. This loan will improve Willimina's living conditions and secure the future of her children

loans.use: To start horticulture farming

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is 28 years old and an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She is the mother of only one daughter. She is a simple housewife and her husband has been running a photography business. He is the only one responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the overall household.

Salma's husband needs to buy different types of accessories for his photography to do the maintenance but due to insufficient financial resources, he is not in a position to buy these accessories to fulfill his needs. Therefore, Salma planned to help her husband by demanding a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, her husband can buy all the above items relevant to his business and be able to earn maximum profitable income by providing better services.

loans.use: to buy accessories for her husband's photography business

loans.name: Lý

texts.en:
Mrs Lý works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle.

Lý is 32 years old and married with one child. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Lý's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Lý has been involved in her business for five years. The main hardship that Lý faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Lý hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Johna

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Johna works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from her butcher shop. Johna is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her rice retailing business.

Johna has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a tobacco retail business in the Philippines and earns additional income from farming sugarcane.  Merlinda is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of tobacco to sell to her customers.

Merlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 27 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of tobacco to sell.

loans.name: Jonessa

texts.en:
Jonessa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle for her motorcycle transport business.

Jonessa has been in this business for three years. Jonessa earns more income from her general store.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tomatoes, onions, green chilies, chayotes, potatoes, carrots, cabbage, etc.

loans.name: Ignacia

texts.es:
Ignacia, de 65 años de edad, no estudió, es viuda, tiene 7 hijos, pero solo uno de ellos vive con ella, ya que los otros emigraron los Estados Unidos y tienen sus propios hogares.

Ella se dedica a los trabajos agrícolas, específicamente a cultivar maíz, frijol y café, trabajos que aprendió de sus padres y que no piensa dejar de hacerlos, ya que eso contribuye mucho para los gastos del hogar, estos trabajos los hace pagando personas que le ayuden y cobran a $6 el día de trabajo.

Ella solicita el crédito para comprar café para sembrar.

Ignacia, sueña con recuperar el cafetal, ya que sufrió una plaga y no ha sacado ni la tercera parte de lo que cultivó en años anteriores, también sueña con mejorar su vivienda, específicamente cambiarle el techo y pintarla.
texts.en:
Ignacia is 65 years old. She didn't go to school. She is a widow and has 7 children. Only one of them lives with her, because the others immigrated  to the United States and have their own homes. 

She does agricultural work, specifically growing corn, beans and coffee. She learned this work from her parents and is not planning on leaving it, because it contributes a lot to the household expenses. She does this work by paying people to help her. They charge $6 a day for the work. 

She is asking for the loan to buy coffee to plant. 

Ignacia dreams of recovering the coffee crop, because it suffered from disease and she hasn't harvested even a third of what she grew in previous years. She also dreams of improving her home, specifically changing the roof and painting it.

loans.use: to buy coffee to plant.

loans.name: Armando

texts.es:
Armando, de 37 años de edad, estudió hasta segundo grado, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a la prestación de servicios en una finca cafetalera, tiene 3 hijos, ellos aun  están en la escuela.

Armando, trabaja en un finca cafetalera, se dedica a esta labor desde su juventud.
El crédito lo necesita para reemplazar la madera del techo de su casa, ya que está dañada, así como también necesita comprar laminas para cubrir parte del techo, porque está descubierto.

El sueña con tener un hogar seguro y confiable, así como también desea que sus hijos triunfen en la vida y se formen profesionalmente.
texts.en:
Armando is 37 years old. He went to school up to the second grade. He is married and his spouse works at a coffee farm. He has 3 children. They are still are in school. 

Armando works at a coffee farm. He has done this work since his youth. He needs the loan to replace the wood in the roof on his house, because it is damaged. He also needs to buy sheeting to cover a part of the roof, because it is uncovered.

He dreams of having a safe and stable home. He also wants his children to triumph in life and to go to college.

loans.use: to replace the wood in the roof on his house.

loans.name: Jose Alfredo

texts.es:
José, de 37 años de edad, es un hombre con deseos de trabajar y muy emprendedor, actualmente vive un tiempo con su papá y otros días con su mamá; José, tiene un hijo de 1 año de edad, que actualmente por situaciones económicas no puede tenerlo cerca de él, aunque lo ve todos los días.

José, obtuvo un crédito anteriormente, para colocar una pequeña tienda y le ha ido muy bien, ya que descubrió que es muy rentable; es por eso que quiere invertir más, su negocio mejoró considerablemente en los últimos meses y hoy cuenta con más ingresos, gracias al crédito que se le otorgó.

José, quiere seguir invirtiendo en más productos alimenticios para su tienda, es por esa razón que solicita otro crédito para comprar golosinas, galletas, gaseosas, entre otros productos. 

Su sueño es que su hijo estudie y sea una persona de bien para la sociedad.
texts.en:
José is 37 years old. He is a man who wants to work and he is very enterprising. Right now he lives part time with his mother and part time with his father.    José has one child who is 1 year old. Right now, due to financial situations, he can't have him at his side, but he sees him every day. 

José obtained a loan to open a little store and it has gone well for him, because it has been very profitable. That is why he wants to invest more in it. His business improved considerably in the last few months and now he has more income, thanks to the loan he was given. 

José wants to keep investing in more food products for his store. That is why he is asking for another loan to buy candies, cookies, sodas, and other products. 

His dream is for his son to go to school and to be an upstanding member of society.

loans.use: to buy candies, cookies, sodas and other products.

loans.name: Edgardo Antonio

texts.es:
Edgardo, de 30 años de edad, se dedica a la agricultura y a la venta de frutas y verduras, está casado y tiene dos hijos, el no pudo estudiar.

Edgardo, es agricultor, desde muy pequeño ayudaba a su padre con las siembras y siempre anda buscando aprender oficios nuevos.- Actualmente, emprendió un negocio de ventas de frutas y verduras, ya tiene varios meses y le está yendo muy bien.

El dinero lo necesita para hacer modificaciones en su vivienda y el resto para invertir en su negocio.

Edgardo, desea expandir su negocio y salir a vender por mayoreo las frutas y verduras.- Desea también, empezar un ahorro para que esté disponible para el futuro y la educación académica de sus hijos.
texts.en: Edgardo is 30 years old. He works in agriculture and sells fruits and vegetables. He is married and has two children. He was not able to attend school. Edgardo is a farmer. Since he was very young he helped his father with his crops, and he is always trying to learn new jobs. Currently, he started a business selling fruits and vegetables, and he is doing very well with it. He needs the loan to make some renovations in his house, and the rest to invest in his business. Edgardo wants to expand his business and sell his fruits and vegetables wholesale. He also wants to start a savings plan in order to have some savings available for the future and for his children's education.

loans.use: to make renovations in his house.

loans.name: Randy

texts.en:
Randy is a strong-willed man who pushes his ability when it comes to his piggery business. He is a hands-on businessman and father who never gets tired of supporting his family. 

Recently, he availed a loan to purchase bags of animal feeds. 

Aside from his project of concreting the pig pens, he thought of adding heads of pigs for commercial sale. Someday he hopes to open a meat shop in a nearby town.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feeds.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a widow who has her hog-raising business in Bato, Plaridel, in the Philippines. This is how she makes a living and is able to support her needs.

Unfortunately, she didn't have enough capital for her business. When she joined PMPC, she was truly thankful to obtain a loan to fully support her business. 

She wants to maintain her membership in good standing so she can always meet any financing needs. Now, the loan of PHP 7,000 will help her build a concrete pig pen that will support sanitation and care for the environment.

loans.use: to build a concrete pig pen.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 49 years old, married and has one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years.  

Lourdes requested a PHP ,7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

In the future, Lourdes would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Florena

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Florena works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  

Florena is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell for her general store business.

Florena has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a furniture-making business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 13 years. Merlinda earns additional income from buying and selling recycled materials.

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials like nails, wood, paint, etc. to use for her furniture-making business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like nails, wood, paint, etc.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is a jovial and ever-smiling smallholder dairy and poultry farmer dying to get her hands on the horticultural market. She is the mother of a beautiful family and has been doing crop farming too, but for subsistence purposes. She also grows vegetables, a bit of maize and grass for her cow. 

She is seeking a loan to grow vegetables on a bigger scale for commercial gains. The demand for horticultural products such as fruits and vegetables has grown steadily in Kenya in recent years. As much as they have become one of the top traded agricultural products, there is still plenty of room to expand. 

Leah is very excited to start commercialization of her crops. With your $25 loan, you can help her achieve this. She will rely on other sources of income to make initial installments on the loan, but in no time, the horticultural farm will start pumping in income.
