The profits will be ploughed back into the business to fuel growth. Her increased income will uplift the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To expand her farm.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 39 years old, married, and has four children.

Marivic works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from pig fattening. 

Marivic requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Marivic has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan.

Marivic aspires to save enough money to expand her business in order to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Minda

texts.en:
Minda works hard to support her family. Minda is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eight years now.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like sugar, milk, cooking oil, etc.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like sugar, milk, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Melodia

texts.en:
Melodia works hard to support her family. Melodia is married and has a tailoring shop business in the Philippines. Melodia has been in this business for 30 years now.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials like thread, fabrics, needles, etc. 

In the future, Melodia would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like thread, fabrics, needles, etc.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 47 years old, married, and has three children.

Editha works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from food vending. 

Editha requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Editha has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Editha aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Emie

texts.en: Emie, 36 years old, is married and has nine children, three of them in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past 3 years, Emie has run a general store business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her store. In the future, Emie would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Ninfa works hard to support her family. She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a coffee shop.  Ninfa is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of ingredients such as spices, canned goods, meat, vegetables, etc. for her restaurant.

Ninfa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of ingredients such as spices, canned goods, meat, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Jesyl

texts.en:
Jesyl, 28 years old, is married and has three children. She works hard to provide for her family. For the past 2 years, Jesyl has run a general store in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from selling vegetables and raising pigs.

Jesyl has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items such as canned goods, soft drinks, cooking oil, biscuits, detergent, soap, shampoo, noodles, etc. to sell. Jesyl has previously borrowed and repaid 2 loans from NWTF. She aspires to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items such as canned goods, soft drinks, cooking oil, biscuits, detergent, soap, shampoo, noodles, etc. to sell

loans.name: Juana Reyna

texts.es:
Juana, de 54 años de edad, es madre soltera de 4 hijos, pero todos viven en sus propias casas, con ella solo viven algunos de sus nietos. 

Juana, se dedica a comercializar aves de corral, realiza esto desde que estaba muy joven y fue de esta forma que logro sacar adelante a su familia.

Juana, dice tener la oportunidad de hacer un buen negocio, ya que una de sus amigas pronto viajará al extranjero y le ofrece venderle una cantidad considerable de pollos, pavos y patos a un precio muy bajo, por lo que ella podría obtener mucha ganancia.

Es para eso que necesita el crédito, para comprar aves de corral.

Juana, desea ayudar a sus nietos a ir a la escuela y apoyar a sus hijos para que logren llegar a estudiar en la universidad.
texts.en:
Juana is 54 years old, and she is a single mother with 4 children, all of whom live in their own homes. Juana only lives with some of her grandchildren.

Juana makes a living selling poultry, and she has been doing this since she was very young. Through this, she has managed to take care of her family. 

Juana says she has a good business opportunity. One of her friends is going to travel abroad soon, and she has offered to sell Juana a considerable amount of chickens, turkeys, and ducks for a very low price. With this, Juana would be able to earn a lot of profit.

This is the reason that she needs a loan, to buy poultry.

Juana would like to help her grandchildren go to school, and support her children so that they can go to college.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Dolores Claribel

texts.es:
Claribel, de 35 años de edad, es madre soltera de 2 hijos, gracias a su esfuerzo ha logrado construir su propia casa hecha de ladrillo. 

Claribel, se dedica a la comercialización de suplementos vitamínicos, medicinas tradicionales y también vende ropa en su comunidad y los lugares cercanos, en algunas ocasiones camina grandes distancias, para poder venderle a sus clientes.

Claribel, necesita el crédito para comprar más medicinas para su negocio, pero con el dinero que tiene ahora mismo se le dificulta mucho, es por eso que ha optado por solicitar un poco de ayuda para concretar su inversión.

Claribel, sueña con colocar un puesto con sus productos en el mercado de su pueblo, así podrá encargar a alguien esa venta y al mismo tiempo seguirá dando a conocer su producto en las comunidades, de esta forma logrará darle un mejor futuro a sus dos hijos.
texts.en: Claribel, 35 years old, is a single mother of two children. Thanks to her effort, she has been able to build her own house made of brick. Claribel works selling vitamin supplements, traditional medicines, and also clothing items in her community and in nearby places. Sometimes, she walks long distances to sell her products to her customers. Claribel needs the loan to buy more medicines for her business. With the money she has right now it is very difficult to invest in her business; therefore, she opted to ask for some help. Claribel dreams of having a stand with her products at her local market. This way she will have someone attending that stand, and at the same time she will continue making her products be known in the communities. This way she will be able to give her children a better future.

loans.use: to buy more medicines for her business.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina, 64, is a smallholder mixed farmer from South Rift, Kenya, who is married to a nice, handsome husband. They have been blessed with 9 children so far. Regina is very hardworking and focused. Her primary income sources today are milk, eggs, and tea, among other crops. 

Regina is seeking a loan to purchase more poultry. She seeks this expansion to enhance her family's financial security. The more hens Regina acquires, the more assets under her name and the more income she makes through egg sales. The hens will also bring other numerous benefits including chicks, manure and feathers. The income from this investment will enable Regina to take better care of her family and to pay for her children's education. Lend $25 to improve the quality of life of a wife, a mother, and a progressive lady farmer in Chepkotoo village.

loans.use: to pay for poultry

loans.name: Gelyn

texts.en: Gelyn, 41 years old, is married and has one child who is in school. For the past 5 years, Gelyn has been in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Gelyn has previously borrowed 2 times from NWTF to sustain her business. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to fix the roof of his house.

loans.name: Rafael Adalberto

texts.es: Rafael de 21 años de edad es un joven trabajador que desde hace 3 años cuenta con una pequeña tienda de productos básicos y es apoyado en ella que logra salir adelante junto a su madre con la que vive en casa propia desde hace varios años. Rafael desea invertir en su negocio ya que sabe que es el único ingreso económico con el que cuenta y el cual le permite sostener y apoyar a su madre en la vejez, por lo que sabiendo que al tener mayor cantidad y variedad de productos sus ventas son mejores ha decidido solicitar un crédito a FUSAI el cual le permita invertir en su negocio para poder obtener mejores ingresos económicos, entre los productos que vende están: arroz, frijoles, leche, huevos, café, pan dulce, sachet de champú, jabón, detergente, papel higiénico, etc.
texts.en:
Rafael is a 21 years old young worker who for the past 3 years has had a small store selling basic products. He is sustained by it so that he has manged to get ahead together with his mother with whom he has lived with in their own house for the past few years.

Rafael wants to invest in his business as he knows it is his only source of income which allows him to live and support his mother in her old age. Knowing that having more quantity and variety of products makes his sales better he decided to request a loan from FUSAI. It will allow him to invest in his business to obtain better financial income. Amongst the products that he sells are rice, beans, milk, eggs, coffee, pastries, shampoo packets, soap, detergents, toilet paper, etc.

loans.use: to invest in rice, beans, milk, eggs, coffee, pastries, packets of shampoo, soap, detergent, toilet paper, etc.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en: Alex, 26 years old, is married. Since 2000, he has earned a living from selling produce and farming in Kagadi, Uganda. Alex is hopeful of starting up another outlet in town due to the fact that he is hardworking. Despite being challenged by price fluctuations, Alex is requesting a loan to buy cassava, beans and maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy cassava, beans and maize to sell

loans.name: Ana Del Carmen

texts.es: Ana es una mujer emprendedora de 40 años de edad que se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y joyería de enchape y fantasía, actividad que realiza desde hace 15 años y que le ha permitido llevar el sustento a su hogar. Ella vive con su compañero de vida y sus 2 hijos desde hace 5 años, por lo que se siente feliz de poder contar con un lugar donde vivir para ofrecerle a su familia, sobre todo porque es el fruto de su esfuerzo. Ana cuenta con una gran cantidad de clientes que solicitan de sus productos, por lo que ella desea lograr cumplir con la demanda de productos que le son solicitados, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: joyería de enchape y fantasía, labiales, pinta uñas, lociones, cremas humectantes, desodorantes, etc., y de esta manera tener una mayor cantidad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes en la época navideña.
texts.en:
Ana is an enterprising 40 year old who sells beauty products and plated and fantasy jewelery. She has done this business for 15 years and it allows her to provide sustenance for her household. She has lived with her life companion and 2 children for 5 years. She is happy to have found a place to live to offer her family, moreover as it is fruit of her labor.

Ana has a large number of clients who request her products and she wants to fill these request for products. So she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in fantasy and plated jewellery, lipstick, nail polish, lotions, moisturizing cream, deodorants, etc. In this way she will have a greater quantity of products to offer to her clients for the Christmas season.

loans.use: to invest in plated and fantasy jewellery, lipsticks, nail polish, moisturizing cream, deodorants etc.

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
Hello Wonderful Kiva lenders. Meet Dinah, a very industrious, honest and hardworking woman from the Nandihills area of Kenya, near the famous Rift valley escarpment of Kenya. 

Dinah, 39, has been farming for the past 5 years. Through these years, she has gathered much experience and is considered among the best farmers in her village. She has been practicing mixed farming. Her primary sources of income have been milk, eggs, maize, crops and some small business ventures that help her make ends meet. Dinah is very passionate about farming and loves cultivating her farm. That is why, every day, she wakes up very early to go to her farm to plow. Although she makes profits from farming, she is not comfortable and has always wanted to increase her income by selling cereals. That is why she is seeking this loan to buy cereals. Kenya's Nandihills area, one of the country's populated regions, has a high demand for cereals. This means that Dinah could increase her profits and satisfy the demand that is there. 

Accessing funds has been a challenge for Dinah, but she now feels relieved because Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva lenders to help aspiring women farmers like her turn their farming dreams into reality through training and loan financing. Dinah believes that this loan will be of much help, and that she will be able to satisfy the demand for cereals. She also believes that the extra income she earns will enable a permanent change in her life and increase her business. Increased profits will allow Dinah to repay this loan and secure the future of her school-going children. All that Dinah waits for is your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine is 25 years old and a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Geraldine has a fishing business in the Philippines. Geraldine requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Geraldine has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Geraldine would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 53 years old and married with eight children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Rose is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Rose has been pig fattening for 7 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream which is to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Judita

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Judita works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Judita is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Judita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is a widowed woman with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ana is 41 years old and has five children who are in school.

Ana has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Ana requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Ana has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Ana would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of  fish to sell.

loans.name: Reyna Carolina

texts.es:
Reyna, de 54 años de edad, actualmente solo vive con uno de sus hijos.

Reyna, tiene 10 años de prestar sus servicios como secretaria, en un ayuntamiento municipal de su pueblo, esto le ha ayudado a poder ir poco a poco arreglando su casa y cubriendo los gastos de su hogar.

Ella necesita el crédito para hacer reparaciones en su casa ya que con el sueldo que obtiene, no le alcanza para hacer estos trabajos.

Reyna, sueña con tener su casa arreglada antes de su jubilación y por eso se está esforzando tanto en trabajar, pues ella sabe que cuando se jubile ya no estará recibiendo su salario, sino solo un porcentaje.
texts.en:
Reyna is 54 years old and currently only lives with one of her children.

Reyna has 10 years experience offering her services as a secretary in the city hall of her town. This has helped her to be able to slowly make improvements to her home and cover household expenses.

She needs a loan to make repairs in her home because the earnings she obtains is not enough to cover these jobs.

Reyna dreams of having her home repaired before retirement. For this reason, she is striving so hard to work now, knowing that when she retires she will only receive a percentage of her current salary.

loans.use: to make repairs to her home.

loans.name: Tanya Lisseth

texts.es:
Tanya, de 33 años de edad, alcanzo sus estudios hasta el 7º grado de educación básica, ella es madre soltera de un jovencito de 17 años y una pequeña de 11 años.

Tanya, se dedica a la venta de golosinas y antojitos en un cafetín ubicado en una escuela en su comunidad, tiene la experiencia de laborar 5 años en el cafetín, es ahí de donde dependen los ingresos para el sustento diario en su familia.

Ahora Tanya, desea invertir en su cafetín, con el efectivo del crédito comprara mas productos como churros, dulces, galletas entre otros que son muy solicitados por los infantes.

A futuro desea ver a sus hijos convertidos en unos profesionales, una casa remodelada y una calidad de vida mejor.
texts.en:
Tanya is 33 years old, and she completed basic education through the 7th grade. She is a single mother with a young 17-year-old boy and a small 11-year-old girl.

Tanya makes a living selling sweets and snacks in a small cafe located at a school in her community. She has been working at this cafe for 5 years, and her and her family depend on the income from this to take care of their daily needs.

Now, Tanya would like to invest in her small cafe. With the money from this loan, she will buy more products such as fritters, sweets, and cookies among other things, since these items are very popular with the young children.

In the future, Tanya would like to see her children become professionals, and she would like to remodel her house and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fritters, cookies, and sweets.

loans.name: Iris Beatriz

texts.es: Iris es una mujer de 25 años de edad que se gana la vida elaborando y vendiendo tortillas frente a su vivienda, lo que le permite ganarse la vida y cuidar de su pequeña hija, dicha actividad la realiza desde hace 15 años. Ella habita en vivienda propia junto a su hija de 3 años de edad desde hace mucho tiempo, por lo que es reconocida como una mujer tenaz y emprendedora. Iris sabe que su única fuente de ingresos económicos es su negocio, por lo que desea invertir en él ya que desea obtener mejores ingresos económicos que le permitan mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su pequeña hija, y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: maíz, cal y gas propano para continuar con su negocio y obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Iris is a 25 year old woman who makes her living making and selling tortillas in front of her house. This allows her to make a living and care for her young daughter. She has had the business for 15 years. She has lived in her own house with her 3 year old daughter for many years. She is known as a determined and enterprising woman.

Iris knows that her business is her only source of money. So she wants to invest in it to obtain better income from the business which allows her to improve her quality of living and that of her small daughter. So she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in corn, lime and propane gas to continue with her business and obtain higher income.

loans.use: to invest in corn, lime and gas.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 38 years old and a mother of four children attending school. 

Due to financial hardship, she helps her husband in gaining income by offering catering services to any occasions within their community. She has been in this business for almost 15 years. 

She aspires to continue and strengthen this business but she has insufficient capital. For this reason, she wants to avail a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy more tables, chopping dishes, forks, spoons and chairs. 

She hopes that she will receive her request amount to be able to provide better services to her customers and earn sufficient income to sustain the necessities of her family.

loans.use: to buy more tables, chopping dishes, forks, spoons and chairs

location.town: Brgy. San Geronimo, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.es:
Jose Angel tiene 34 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y sus dos menores hijos en casa propia en el distrito de Pucará que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La población de este distrito se dedica principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte público, cuenta con una mototaxi propia con la cual brinda este servicio, cuenta con más de 04 años de experiencia en el rubro y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. Adicionalmente se dedica a realizar labores agrícolas como peón en los cultivos de la zona. El préstamo será para realizar reparaciones y mantenimiento de su vehículo ya que actualmente se encuentra en mal estado. Con esto Jose Angel espera brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir obtener un mayor nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
José Ángel is a 34-year old man who lives with his wife and 2 minor children in their house in the district of Pucará, province of Jaén, region Cajamarca, north mountains of Perú. People in this district mainly work in agriculture, stock breeding and trading. He offers transportation service with his mototaxi. He has more than 4 years of experience and very good personal and professional references in the region. He is also a hand in some crops in the area. 

He will use the loan to repair and maintain his vehicle, as it is currently in bad condition. Thanks to this, José Ángel expects to offer a better service to his clients, obtain higher income and improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to repair and maintain his vehicle, which is currently in bad condition.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in pants, skirts, blouses, shirts, t-shirts, dresses, etc.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 33 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Arlene works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like eggs, canned goods, shampoo, etc.

Arlene has been in this business for one year now. 

In the future, Arlene would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like eggs, canned goods, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is 43 years old and has one child who is in school. For the past 15 years, she has run a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Clarita is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Clarita is requesting a 4,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Winnie works hard to support her family. She runs a business buying and selling frozen products in the Philippines and also earns additional income from operating a general store and buying and selling gasoline. Winnie has been sustaining her businesses with her past loan from NWTF.

Winnie is requesting an 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks such as ham, bacon, and other products to sell at her business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ham, bacon, and other products to sell

loans.name: Bessie

texts.en:
Bessie is 53 years old and married with five children in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like beverages, canned goods, groceries, etc.

Bessie has been in this business for one year now. 

In the future, Bessie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like beverages, canned goods, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is a 35-year-old Ugandan married woman living in Kagadi. She operates a stationery store to generate income and also owns a primary school. Harriet used a previous loan to buy books, pens, and paper to sell. 

Harriet is requesting a loan to buy books, pens, reams of paper, and other stationery to sell. She is targeting her high demand period when children are going back to school. Harriet hopes to improve her incomes despite her business being seasonal which affects her returns.

loans.use: to buy books, pens, reams of papers and other stationery

loans.name: Busaadat

texts.ru: Бусаадат, 56 лет, в разводе, есть 3 сына. В поисках дохода для своей семьи, 5 лет назад Бусаадат начала свой бизнес в сфере розничной торговли. Благодаря упорному труду, на сегодняшний день у нее есть продуктов питания в обороте на сумму 100,000 сом (KGS). Ежемесячная прибыль составляет около 25,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бусаадат обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение товарооборота в ее магазине. Доходы от бизнеса Бусаадат планирует направлять на дальнейшее развитие своего дела.
texts.en: Busaadat is 56, divorced, and has three sons. In search of income for her family, Busaadat started a business in the retail sector five years ago. Thanks to her hard work she currently has 100,000 som (KGS) of retail goods and her monthly income is around 25,000 som (KGS). In order to expand her business, Busaadat applied for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) with Bai-Tushum Bank to increase the sales turnover in her store. She plans to use her business profits to continue developing her business.

loans.use: to purchase products for retail sales and offer a wider variety of products in her shop

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to  increase  and to  buy the fast moving  cosmetics.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline has a sari-sari store which she has operated for ten years. The profit from her business is spent for her family's needs.  She sent her children to school. 

Her current loan will be used to purchase canned goods, detergents, condiments, candies and other food supplies which is in demand at the store.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, detergents, condiments, candies and other food supplies.

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
Lita is 58 years old and married with six children. She works cooking and selling “bibingka” (rice cakes) to the people in her village. Lita wanted to increase her earnings but she needs to buy more ingredients to make her snacks more delectable.

Lita is requesting a 24,000 PHP loan to buy flour, coconut, and glutinous rice to use to cook bibingka. She hopes to distribute more products and earn good profits from her business. Someday, she hopes to increase her sales capacity and profits.

loans.use: to buy flour, coconut, and glutinous rice to use to cook bibingka

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en:
Ninfa is 58 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock, such as rice, coffee, milk, etc., to sell.

Ninfa has borrowed and repaid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock, such as rice, coffee, milk, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Flora, an ever smiling 38-year-old, very hardworking, honest and dedicated farmer who lives in Chepkoiyo, a remote village in Nandihills. 

She is happily married and is blessed with four adorable children. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last five years and has gained much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs and varieties of food crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and make extra cash, she has been engaging in another small personal business or “side hustle” as she likes to put it. 

The Nandihills area is very populated and demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” 

Flora's biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand that is really high. She lacks funds to expand her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 35,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry. For a woman, accessing funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved, and she will be able to buy more poultry. 

Through the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market, and this will translate to increased profits and an improved income level. Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and expand her poultry market to other markets and this will increase her income and improve her living conditions. 

The extra income she will get will be used in fully repaying the loan and permanently changing her living conditions and securing the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a Ugandan, married and a hardworking man. He lives in Kagadi where operating a retail shop, selling produce, and farming are his income sources. 

He hopes to grow his business into a wholesale shop despite challenges of competition in the market leading to low profit returns. Emmanuel is requesting a loan to buy maize, sugar, beans, and soap, among others, to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize, sugar, beans, and soap, among others, to sell.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma, 32 years old, is married and has six children. She works hard to provide for her family. For the past 16 years, Emma has run a general store in the Philippines. She also earns an income from buying and selling ready-to-wear. 

Emma has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items such as canned goods, condiments, eggs, beverages, groceries, etc. to sell. Emma has previously borrowed and repaid 5 loans from NWTF. She aspires to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items such as canned goods, condiments, eggs, beverages, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Lenah

texts.en:
Lenah, 39, is a smallholder farmer in the Nandi hills area of Kenya. In the past eight years, she has bred more than four dairy cows, developed her farm, and planted and sold a variety of crops. Lenah says the secret to her success is thinking of farming as a way to make money, not just as a traditional way of life – adopting new technologies and methods, crop diversification, record-keeping and good planning also helps. Lenah was unable to study to get a professional career because of the economic situation that her family faced. However, she never gave up and she has been practicing farming. 

Lenah always says, “I have always had an affinity for farming; it runs in my blood.” Because of how much she likes farming she has even nicknamed one of her cows “Chemunken.” She is a very proud farmer, especially when she is milking her cows. Through her dairy cow, she is able to get between 10-15 liters of milk a day, and this helps her support her family. Lenah also practices crop farming, but she has not been making good profits because of poor farming implements.

Lenah is requesting a loan to buy farm implements. She will be able to buy high-quality seeds, good fertilizer, and pesticide that she will use to greatly improve her crop production. Modern farming requires the use of modern techniques and using high-quality seeds will assure her of a bumper harvest and increased profits. Lenah is visionary, and her goal for the season is to boost her crop production and be able to get more harvest than the previous year. All this can be achieved through lender help and goodwill. Lenah believes that her loan will help turn around her family’s life and she will be able to give her child a solid educational background. This loan will be Lenah’s way out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy farm implements, high-quality seeds, good fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 34-year-old married man living in Kagadi, Uganda with one child. He has been operating a veterinary drug shop, rearing animals and farming since 2008 for income generation to earn a living.

Peter hopes to have better standards of living and development, since he is honest and hardworking despite the challenges of limited capital to grow his business.

He is requesting a loan to buy veterinary drugs for selling.

loans.use: to buy veterinary drugs for selling.

loans.name: Mameta

texts.en:
Mameta is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Mameta is 59 years old now.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Mameta requested a PHP 3,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other materials needed for her business.

Mameta has been in this business for 40 years. In the future, She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other materials needed for her business

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es:
Wilfredo, de 46 años de edad, estudió hasta cuatro grado, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene dos hijos, pero solo uno vive con ellos en casa.

Wilfredo, se dedica  a la agricultura desde hace 20 años, fue su papá el que le enseño este trabajo, pero también tiene otra fuente de ingreso en la casa, tiene un molino, hay una buena cantidad de personas alrededor que iban a moler muy lejos y el decidió ponerlo para que tener ese ingreso para la familia; los trabajos de agricultura están a una distancia de 35 minutos, y llegas hasta ahí caminando.

Wilfredo, necesita el crédito para cortar la cosecha de los granos básicos que sembró y tenerlo en la casa para cuando tengan un buen precio, sacarlos al mercado para venderlos.- Wilfredo, también quiere invertir en un tienda, quiere aprovechar de poner esa venta de productos de la canasta básica y así tener ese ingreso más para su familia.

Los sueños de Wilfredo, son seguir cultivando  para que nunca le falte el maíz en su casa y para tener ingresos en la familia.- Además, desea que su hijo estudie en la universidad.
texts.en:
Wilfredo is 46 years old and studied up to Grade 4. He is married and his wife does domestic work. He has 2 children but only one of them lives in their house. Wilfredo has worked in agriculture for 20 years. His father taught him this work.

He also has another source of income for his household, a mill. There are a good number of people around him that travel a long ways to mill their grains and he decided to have one to have this income for his family.

His agricultural work is 35 minutes away and he gets there walking. Wilfredo needs the loan to harvest his crop of basic grains and have it at his house until the price is good. Then he will take it to the market to sell.

Wilfredo also wants to invest in a store. He wants to take advantage of it to sell basic food items and have this extra income for his family. Wilfredo dreams of continuing his growing so that they never lack corn in their house and to generate income for the family. He also hopes that his son can study at university.

loans.use: to harvest his basic grain crops.

loans.name: Lerma

texts.en:
Lerma is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lerma is 39 years old and has five children who are in school.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Lerma requested a PHP 3,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Lerma has been in this business for one year. In the future, Lerma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en: Jesusa, 41 years old, is married and has two children, both in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past 4 years, Jesusa has operated a business buying and selling coconut wine in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional containers of coconut wine to sell. In the future, Jesusa would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Jhia Mae

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Jhia Mae works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling ready-to-wear in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish. Jhia Mae is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy additional items to sell for her business.

Jhia Mae has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorbike to deliver her produce to the market.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is a hardworking married man living in Kagadi, Uganda. He has been operating a retail shop alongside farming and selling produce as his income sources since 2008. Robert is challenged by competition hindering his dream of setting up another outlet. Robert intends to use the loan to buy maize, beans and general merchandise such as sugar and salt for selling.

loans.use: to buy maize, beans, alcohol and general merchandise such as sugar and salt for selling.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Creciendo Juntas Group

texts.es:
El grupo cuenta con actividades consolidadas que le permiten tener una buena gestión de su empresa. El trabajo en equipo ha permitido tener un crecimiento importante en el patrimonio que ha traído beneficios a todas sus familias. Mantienen actividades de comercio, ofreciendo una buena calidad del producto y facilidades de pago para sus  clientes.

Carmen ha sido una líder en la zona de Puntarenas para el apoyo de mujeres que desean superarse y salir a delante, vive en el Barrio 20 de Noviembre en Puntarenas, lugar de mucha pobreza y problemas sociales, tiene 56 años de edad y vive con sus 3 hijos y tiene 2 nietos. Con el esfuerzo y trabajo ha logrado dar estudio a sus hijos, una de ellas es enfermera; además de agrupar mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras para apoyarlas con crédito por parte de Fundación Mujer, siendo el único ingreso de la casa. Ella ofrece productos de catálogo como ropa, perfumes y bisutería.
	El objetivo de este préstamo es comprar mercadería, como productos de catálogo y electrodomésticos, que va a comprar a un deposito libre, muy conocido en la zona Sur de Costa Rica, aprovechando la época donde hay muchos ingresos por aguinaldo, ahorros y la gente desea comprar artículos, ya sea para regalar  o para auto regalarse, situación que la clienta, por su experiencia y conocimiento del mercado aprovecha. Carmen pertenece Banco Mujer Creciendo Juntas y funge en el puesto de tesorera
	Entre sus metas destaca salir adelante para que sus hijos y ella tengan un futuro mejor, que puedan estudiar y apoyar los ingresos del hogar. Por ahora la dificultada más grande ha sido la económica, pero han encontrado en este programa un apoyo para su micro emprendimiento.
Este es  un grupo consolidado, han trabajado con Fundación Mujer desde el año 2004, realizando, con esta, más de 10 solicitudes de crédito, pasando por su grupo más de 20 mujeres de la comunidad de Veinte de Noviembre en la zona de Puntarenas. Han demostrado trabajo, crecimiento, unión y solidaridad, una buena conducta de pago y ha renovado sus préstamos año a año. Sus actividades están generando ingresos que les permiten viajar al exterior a comprar mercadería (Nicaragua y Panamá) contar con locales propios, maquinarias propias, y ofrecer una variada gama de productos en los lugares donde viven.
texts.en:
The group has established activities that allow them to have good management of their business.  Team work has allowed them to have major growth in their assets, which has benefited all of their families.  They carry out their commercial activities, offering good quality products and good payment terms to their customers.

Carmen has been a leader in the Puntarenas zone for the support of women who want to better themselves and get ahead. She lives in Barrio 20 de Noviembre in Puntarenas, a place of great poverty and social problems.  She is 56 years old.  She lives with her 3 children and has 2 grandchildren.  With effort and work, she has been able to provide education to her children.  One of them is a nurse.  In addition, she gathers hardworking, enterprising women to support them with the loan from Fundación Mujer, since that is her home’s only income.  She offers catalog products such as clothing, perfume, and costume jewelry.

The objective of this loan is to buy merchandise, such as catalog products and electrical appliances.  She will buy them from a well-known free trade zone in the southern zone of Costa Rica.  She will take advantage of this season when there is a lot of income due to Christmas bonuses and savings.  People want to buy items, whether to give them as gifts or to treat themselves.  The borrower makes the most of this situation with her experience and her knowledge of the market.  Carmen belongs to the Banco Mujer Creciendo Juntas [the Women Growing Together Bank] and serves as the treasurer.

Getting ahead stands out among her goals, so that her she and her children may have a better future, and so that they can go to school and support the household income.  For now, the greatest difficulty has been finances, but she has found support for her micro-enterprise in this program.  This is an established group.  They have worked with Fundación Mujer since 2004 and, with this request, have made more than 10 loan requests.  More than 20 women from the community of 20 de Noviembre in the Puntarenas zone have passed through their group.  They have demonstrated work, growth, unity, and solidarity, good management of their payments, and they have renewed their loans year after year.  Their activities are generating income that allow them to travel abroad and buy merchandise (Nicaragua and Panama), to have their own venues, their own equipment, and to offer a varied range of products in the places where they live.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Anatoli

texts.en:
Anatoli is a Ugandan hardworking single man of 29 years. 

He lives in Kagadi where he has been operating a bar and restaurant business since 2009 and farming for financial support. 

He hopes to grow his business despite competition being his major challenge. Anatoli is asking for credit to buy crates of beers and sodas and pork to sell.

loans.use: to buy crates of beer and sodas and pork to sell.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel, de 25 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, es casado, la esposa trabaja en ventas y tienen una hija que vive con ellos, en la casa viven la suegra, su cuñada y un sobrino, pero solo la esposa y la hija dependen de él.

Daniel, se dedica a las ventas de medicina natural, hasta la fecha tiene más de un año de dedicarse a este negocio, desde muy joven se dedica a las ventas.- Daniel, decidió dedicarse a este trabajo, para tener un mejor ingreso para su familia, además de las ventas de medicina también, vende ropa americana de segunda mano.

El negocio de medicina que tiene es ambulante, viaja de pueblo en pueblo para ofrecer los productos, en el negocio se involucra su cuñada.  

Daniel, con el crédito comprará medicinas naturales, para incrementar el inventario y poder vender un poco más.

Ya que esto le ayudará a tener un mayor ingreso económico.  

El sueño de Daniel, es poder hacer crecer el negocio y así poder darle un mejor futuro a su hija.
texts.en:
Daniel, 25, studied  until high school and is married. His wife works in sales. They have a daughter who lives with them in a house with Daniel's mother-in-law, sister-in-law, and a nephew. Only his wife and daughter are dependent upon him. Daniel works selling natural medicine; to date, he has over a year of experience working in this business, and has worked in sales in general since a young age. 

Daniel decided to take up this work in order to have more income for his family. In addition to selling medicine, he also sells second-hand clothes from the US. He sells medicine as a travelling salesmen, going from town to town to offer his products. His sister-in-law is also involved in the business. 

With this loan, Daniel will purchase natural medicine in order to augment his inventory and make more sales, as this will help him increase his income. Daniel's dream is to be able to grow his business and, in that way, provide a better future for his daughter.

loans.use: to purchase natural medicine for sale

loans.name: Areliza Ernestina

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Salud y Progreso, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Areliza, tiene 64 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 6 hijos todos mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun vive en su casa. Su esposo es agricultor.
Doña Areliza se dedica a la elaboración de dulces, prepara sus dulces para fiestas y compromisos sociales, también tiene una pequeña granja en la cual cría pollos. Lleva más de 15 años dedicada a la fabricación de dulces lo cual le da para salir adelante. 
Ella está repitiendo el crédito ya que de esta forma ella puede seguir adelante en su actividad económica, sus ganancias las utiliza para arreglos y necesidades en su hogar ya que su marido a veces no tiene como cubrir estos gastos ya que no gana mucho en sus faenas en el campo. Este crédito es para  comprar todo tipo de ingredientes para preparar sus deliciosos dulces y alimentos para los pollos. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho. Sus sueños son seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Every 15 days, the group called “Salud y Progreso” (Health and Progress) meets in Tosagua. This town is known for being dynamic. Most people that live here work in agriculture and in raising animals, as this is a region with a lot of vegetation. Areliza lives here. She is 64 years old and married, with six children that are now all adults. One of her children lives in her home. Her husband works in agriculture. Areliza makes candies, preparing them for parties and social events. She also has a small farm in which she raises chickens. She has been making candy for more than 15 years, which is how her family gets by. 

She is requesting this loan again because in this way, she can get ahead in her business. Her earnings are used for repairs and basic household needs, as her husband doesn't always make enough money to cover these expenses since his farm work doesn't pay well. This loan will be used to purchase ingredients to prepare her delicious candies, and food for her chickens. She has been with the group since the beginning, and she likes it because the loans help her a lot. Her dream is to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and chicken food.

loans.name: Teofila Gricelda

texts.es:
Teofila Gricelda tiene 37 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La vida en este distrito es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral como cuyes, gallinas, patos, entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con 04 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales como chivos, patos, gallinas, entre otros, así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para el engorde de estos. Con esto Teofila Gricelda espera ofrecer una mayor variedad de animales a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir incrementar su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Teófila Gricelda is 37 years old and is in a relationship. She owns a house where she lives with her three children, located in the Oyotún district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, in the northern coast of Peru. Life is calm in this district, and locals work mainly in agriculture, animal farming and commerce.

Teófila works at home, raising and selling small farm animals such as guinea pigs, hens, and ducks. She has been doing this for four years and has very good personal and professional references.

Teófila will use the loan to buy more animals, such as goats, ducks, and hens, and to buy feed to fatten them. This will allow her to offer her customers a wider variety of animals, which will in turn help her to increase her income level and improve her and her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more animals, such as goats, ducks, and hens, and feed to fatten them.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 43 years old and married with six children. With three children in school, Imelda works very hard to provide for them.

Imelda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 4,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, candies, groceries, etc..

Imelda has been in this business for ten years now. 

In the future, Imelda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, candies, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Lida

texts.en:
Lida is a distinguished pedagogue of 66 years old. She lives in Vanadzor city of Lori region. She has higher education, and since 1975 until today, she works at the Vanadzor State University as a lecturer of Russian Language and Literature.

As she says, she is happy with her occupation and feels great pride in her students, who are eager to study and to learn more. Lida says she is doing her best to give them the knowledge that they will surely need during their lives, no matter what kind of work they will do. Lida says that her students inspire her to continue to work, and she still feels young and full of energy.

Lida also helps pupils to get prepared for the entrance examinations, giving them paid private courses at her house. Lida is married and lives with her husband and son. Lida’s husband is her colleague and a pedagogue; he is a specialist in geography.

Lida wants the support of Kiva lenders, since she wants to buy a computer; also a printer and professional literature. She will use all of these to make her lectures and courses more interesting and more informative.

loans.use: to buy a computer; also a printer and professional literature.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is 40 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell such as canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

Perlita has borrowed and paid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for twelve years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell such as canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to open a small shop, as there is a space available for rent and he would like to take advantage of this opportunity.

loans.name: Marcos Tulio

texts.es:
Marcos de 26 años de edad, es un joven trabajador, se encuentra estudiando bachillerato, su madre falleció y ha tenido que trabajar para ayudar a su padre,  está acompañado y aún no tiene hijos.


Marcos tiene un negocio de venta de repuestos para bicicletas y triciclos, este negocio lo inició con la ayuda de una tía suya, la cual ha sido el medio de ingresos económicos para su hogar.


Él necesita muchísimo de este crédito para ampliar el negocio, comprará  más repuestos para bicicletas, de esta forma se le estará ayudando a Marcos para que tenga mercadería suficiente.

Él sueña con que su negocio crezca  y seguir adelante con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Marcos is 26 years old, and is a hard-working young man who is studying for his degree. His mother died and he has had to work to help out his father. He has a partner but but not have any children yet.

Marcos has a business selling spare parts for bicycles and tricycles, which he set up with the help of one of his aunts. It has been his source of income for his household.

Marcos really needs this loan to expand the business and buy more spare parts for bicycles, so that he has enough stock.

Marcos dreams of growing his business and continuing his studies.

loans.use: to expand his business and buy more spare parts for bicycles.
